loans.name: María De La Cruz

texts.es:
After her husband retired and his pension did not cover basic needs, María de la Cruz began to sell a very modest quantity of food products in order to earn income for family expenses. Unfortunately she was recently widowed, and after swallowing that bitter pill she decided to put herself to work and today she is asking for your help in order to buy merchandise and thus maintain her business.

María de la Cruz needs $250, which she will repay in four months, in order to supply her grocery store. Many thanks for supporting María. She has a great desire to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de que su esposo se jubiló y la pensión que les daban no les alcanzaba para los gastos indispensables, María de la Cruz comenzó por vender una muy módica cantidad de productos de abarrotes, para poder sacar para los gastos que tenían, desgraciadamente enviudó hace poco, y después de un amargo trago de la vida decidió ponerse a trabajar y hoy está solicitando de tu ayuda para poder comprar mercancía y así mantener el negocio.

María de la Cruz necesita US $250 para pagarlos en un plazo de cuatro meses y así poder surtir su puesto de abarrotes. Muchas gracias por apoyar a María, ella tiene grandes deseos de salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy products to supply her business

loans.name: Emma Leticia

texts.es:
Six years ago Emma’s husband had an accident which left him unable to work for a long time. This was what pushed Emma Leticia to take up sales. She began by selling second hand clothes and little by little, through hard work, she added new clothes, footwear, cosmetics, and other things in order to pay for her husband’s medical expenses as well as the needs of her young son and household costs. Currently she has a list of client requests that unfortunately she has not been able to fill due to lack of money.

Emma is asking for a loan of $325 that she is prepared to repay in 6 months. This would help Emma buy merchandise that her clients have asked for and it would help her grow her business a little. You could be the angel that helps Emma.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 6 años el esposo de Emma tuvo un accidente donde quedó sin poder trabajar durante un largo tiempo, esto fue lo que impulsó a Emma Leticia a emprender el camino de las ventas, comenzando por vender ropa de segunda y poco a poco, con mucho esfuerzo metiendo ropa nueva, calzado, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Para así poder pagar los gastos médicos de su esposo, los gastos de su pequeño hijo y los de su casa. Actualmente ya cuenta con una lista de pedidos que desafortunadamente no ha podido surtir por falta de dinero.

Emma está solicitando un préstamo de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, y así ayudaras a Emma a comprar mercancía que le han solicitado y así poder crecer un poco su negocio. Tú podrás ser ese ángel que ayude a Emma.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise that will fill orders for clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana R. is a woman who likes to advocate for her children’s welfare. Her children needed school supplies, so she decided to open a small business, even though it didn’t seem likely that her business would prosper since the area in which it is located is not very good. Mariana succeeded in arranging a room in her house for the sale of grocery items. Little by little, with the help of Mariana’s husband, the business has been growing.

Today Mariana is asking for a loan of $550 in order to buy a cooler and thus be able to sell more merchandise that requires refrigeration. This will give her grocery store greater variety. Mariana is prepared to repay the loan in 6 months. With your help, Mariana will be able to sell more products that require refrigeration.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariana R., es una mujer que le gusta luchar por sus dos hijos que necesitaban de utensilios para la escuela, por lo tanto decidió poner un pequeño establecimiento, a pesar de que las esperanzas de que su negocio prosperara, puesto que en la zona donde se ubica no es muy buena, y logró arreglar un cuarto de su casa con un poco de mercancía de abarrotes hace siete años, que poco a poco y con la ayuda de su esposo ha ido creciendo.

Hoy está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para poder comprar un enfriador y así poder vender más mercancía de la que necesite conservarse en un lugar fresco, para tener más surtido en tu abarrotería. Mariana R. está dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Mariana podrá vender más productos que necesiten refrigerador.

loans.use: To purchase a cooler in order to supply more refrigerated products.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica R.’s husband is a mason and therefore goes through seasons when there is no work and the family is left without money for household expenses. For that reason, four years ago Angélica decided to make flour tortillas to sell amongst her neighbors and relatives. Angélica’s business has grown little by little with the help of one of her three children, the oldest, who goes out onto the street to sell the tortillas.

Angélica is asking for assistance in the form of a $375 loan to be paid back in five months in order to buy some tortilla pans. These will help her make more tortillas at the same time, since right now she only has one small pan with which she cannot make many tortillas. Angélica needs you. With your help, her business will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica R., debido a que su esposo, que es Albañil, tiene temporadas en que no le dan trabajo, y no les queda dinero para los gastos del hogar, ella decidió elaborar tortillas de harina hace cuatro años para vender entres sus vecinos y familiares, poco a poco y con la ayuda de uno de sus tres hijos, el mayor, que sale a la calle a vender las tortillas, ha ido creciendo poco a poco su negocio.

Angélica está solicitando ayuda para pedir un préstamo de US $375 en un plazo de 5 meses, para poder comprar unos comales que le ayuden a cocinar más tortillas al mismo tiempo, puesto que actualmente tiene un comal muy pequeño con el que no puede hacer muchas tortillas. Ella necesita de ti, con tu ayuda su negocio podrá prosperar.

loans.use: To buy tortilla pans in order to make more product in less time.

loans.name: Joffe Emerson

texts.es:
Joffe is the father of a young family who, lacking employment, needed to find a way to provide for his family. A year ago, he decided to purchase a mototaxi on the advice and loan of a relative to solve this problem. Currently his work has allowed him to grow economically, since he covers routes in his town throughout the day. That is the only way he could earn sufficient income to cover all his families need. As a responsible father who, along with his wife, cares for their 4-year-old son and dreams of giving him nothing but the best and having their own home some day, Joffe continues working hard every day to make his dreams a reality. It's for this reason he's requesting a loan of $375 so can be able to purchase the necessary parts and fix his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Joffe es un padre de familia joven que ante la carente oportunidad de empleo y la necesidad imperiosa de sostener a su familia, decide hace una año comprarse un mototaxi con el consejo y préstamo de un familiar para poder sostener económicamente a su familia; en la actualidad este trabajo le ha permitido poder crecer económicamente ya que cubre diariamente las rutas cercanas a su localidad durante todo el día, sólo así puede tener ingresos considerables que le permitan poder cubrir varias necesidades.Como padre responsable que es desea darle lo mejor a su pequeño de 4 años es por ello que junto a su esposa han decidido también dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes con el propósito de adquirir algún día casa.Joffe seguirá esforzándose cada día para ver sus sueños realidad, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares para poder comprar los repuestos necesarios y arreglar su vehículo de transporte público..Apoyemos a un padre de familia responsable con ganas de superación, juntos lo podemos lograr

loans.use: Make repairs on mototaxi so he can provide for his family

loans.name: Santiago Florencio

texts.es:
Santiago is a selfless father, and as a good head of household, he has in mind what he should do to support his family. He decided to dedicate himself to raising livestock five years ago, after gaining experience working on a livestock ranch. He added everything he learned to the education his parents instilled in him since he was a child. He stopped practicing his professional career of nursing because the low wages that he received didn't let him support his three sons. Now he is dedicated to raising and fattening his cattle. He rents and sells the breed that he raises at his farm for bullfighting activities in the various towns in the Mantaro Valley. In accordance with upcoming celebrations, Santiago presently has 12 cattle that he is raising for these activities. He plans to keep raising livestock and to acquire even more. Subsequently, he plans to open a small pharmacy in the city where he can practice his profession independently. This is why he is requesting a loan of $100 that would allow him to purchase more food for the normal development and competitiveness of his cattle. He thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago es un padre abnegado y como buen jefe de familia tiene en cuenta que debe sostener su hogar. Decidió dedicarse a la ganadería hace 5 años, después de adquirir experiencia trabajando un tiempo en una hacienda ganadera y adicionó tofo lo aprendido a la enseñanza que sus padres le inculcaron desde niño, dejando así de ejercer su carrera profesional de enfermería por el bajo sueldo que percibía y el cual no le alcanzaba para sostener a sus 3 hijosAhora se dedica a criar y a engordar su ganado, la raza que cobija en casa le permite poder arrendar y vender su ganado para las corridas de toros y otras actividades taurinas en los diferentes pueblos del valle del Mantaro; deacuerdo a sus fechas festivas, en la actualidad cuenta con 12 vacunos que le permiten poder realizar estas actividades; Santiago piensa seguir dedicándose a la ganadería y por ello piensa adquirir más ganado y posteriormente abrir una botica en el centro de la ciudad para ejercer independientemente su profesión. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares que le permitirán poder comprar más alimentos para su normal desarrollo y competitividad, desde ahora agradece a aquellas personas que gentilmente accedan a su pedido.

loans.use: Purchase of food for cattle

loans.name: Elba Lucinda

texts.es:
Elba is an enterprising woman who works hard everyday to be able to generate sustenance for her home along with her husband. The difficult financial situation has motivated her to sell refreshments at local events for the past 11 years. On the advice of an aunt, she went out on business on her own. Every day she prepares the beverages in her kitchen, and currently her business has allowed her to contribute significant sums of money to the family income, mostly going toward educating her four children at a prestigious center in her city. They are the motor the drives her every day and keeps her going because her husband works temporary jobs and household necessities can be urgent. Elba dreams of one day having her own home since her family leases the one they live in now, and that motivates her to keep working hard every day. She's requesting a loan of $375 to purchase ingredients and utensils to increase the quality of her delicious drinks. Help this fine woman who searches for a better life for her family every day. She thanks you in advance for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Elba es un a mujer empeñosa que cada día se esfuerza para poder generar el sostén de su hogar en compañía de su esposo, la difícil situación económica la ha motivado a desempeñarse en la venta de refrescos para las ferias comerciales y artesanales hace ya 11 años, por consejo de una tía que la animo a valerse por sí misma.Cada día en su cocina prepara los refrescos para poder comercializarlos y en la actualidad su pequeño negocio le permite poder aportar significativas sumas de dinero a la economía de su hogar, sobre todo por educar a sus 4 hijos que están estudiando en un prestigioso centro educativo de su ciudad, ellos son el motor que impulsa cada día su vida y seguirá haciéndolo porque su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales y las necesidades aún apremian en casa.Elba desea poder tener algún día su propia casita ya que la que habita es por determinado tiempo, por este motivo se ha propuesto seguir trabajando a diario con mucho empeño; solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares que los invertirá en la compra de insumos y utensilios para incrementar la calidad de sus deliciosas chichas, por anticipado les extiende su agradecimiento por el apoyo que le puedan proporcionar.Ayudemos a esta noble dama que cada día busca lo mejor para su familia

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and utensils to keep preparing delicious beverages

loans.name: Amelia Rosa

texts.es:
Amelia is a hard-working woman who earns a living selling candy in a cart at a bus station near her home. She leaves home very early every morning to be able to secure her supplies, and she works throughout the day in hopes of providing a better life for her three children. Two of them are in school, and the oldest one is intensely preparing at a prep school to attend a university and study accounting. Due to the demands of her children's education, she decides to sell candy and other treats at the most popular place in town. Previously she had sold outside local schools, but thanks to her perseverance her business has grown and will continue to grow. Amelia has the desire to keep working hard so she can soon open a bodega and cultivate some land to grow her own food. To fulfill her goals, she's requesting a loan of $375. You are putting your support in good hands with Amelia.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Amelia es una mujer luchadora que cada día se gana la vida vendiendo dulces en su triciclo en un paradero de vehículos de transporte público cerca de su casa; cada mañana muy temprano sale para poder alistar su mercadería y todo el día se dedica a esta actividad comercial por el bien de sus tres hijos que la motivan a seguir trabajando.Dos de sus hijos están estudiando, la mayor se prepara intensamente para ingresar a la universidad en una academia preuniversitaria ya que anhela estudiar contabilidad, es así que ante la demanda de la educación de sus hijos, decide vender dulces y golosinas en el paradero más concurrido de su ciudad. En anteriores oportunidades vendía en la puerta de los locales escolares, pero gracias a su constancia su pequeño negocio ha estado creciendo y seguirá creciendo, Amelia tiene el anhelo de poder seguir esforzándose para pronto establecerse en una bodega e iniciar el cultivo de algunos terrenos que ella posee para consumo propio.Amelia para cumplir sus anhelos solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares, tu aporte será una inversión sabia en manos de Amelia, no pierdas la oportunidad de apoyarla

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities and wide variety of candy and begin an new project

loans.name: Faiese

texts.en:
Faiese T. is a 64 year old mother of four children. She was married to a husband who was very talented in growing crops and developing the family land. He passed away two years ago, and Faiese has since then hired some of her family relatives (men) to run and look after the plantation.

Faiese lives together with her daughters and their children in one house. They support and rely on each other. She has two daughters who work and help Faiese run the business. The plantation is their major source of income. The loan she is requesting will be her sixth loan. She will use the money for home improvements and for the children's school fees. She is a hard working lady and she would like to continue with loans with SPBD.

loans.use: To buy iron roofing for her home and to pay for her children’s education

loans.name: Lilia Rubila

texts.es:
Ms. Lilia is a woman with a great drive to better herself, and this positive outlook on life has led her to make progress little by little. For the past year she has been continuously devoted to agricultural activities. In spite of having suffered a total loss when the crude winter hit her sown fields and ruined all her crops, she still maintains her hopes and efforts on sowing, in order to assure the well-being of her three children, the reason of her constant efforts.

In these times of sowing, part of her agricultural activities are concentrated on animal farming; with time, this activity has become an increasing financial support vis-a-vis the crises she has gone through.

She exerts herself daily so that all of her children have access to an adequate education and grow up to become good men; and, above all, to ensure a good health coverage for them; two of her children underwent surgery recently, and she was forced to part with some of her belongings in order to cover treatment costs.

She wishes to restore the well-being of her family, investing in animal farming, for which she is requesting a $200 loan. She kindly thanks your solidary attitude.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Lilia es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y esta actitud favorable en su vida la ha conducido a seguir adelante y a progresar poco a poco. Es así que desde hace un año su dedicación es continua en las actividades agrícolas; a pesar de haber sufrido un fracaso total cuando el crudo invierno azotó sus campos de cultivo y malogró toda su cosecha, aún sigue con la esperanza y empeño de seguir sembrando para procurarles bienestar a sus tres hijos, que son la razón de sus esfuerzos constantes.

Está en época de siembra, parte de sus actividades agrícolas están dirigidas a la crianza de animales; este trabajo se ha acentuado con el correr de los años, como soporte económico ante las crisis que ha sufrido.

La importante razón por las que se esfuerza diariamente es para que cada uno de sus hijos pueda acceder a una adecuada educación y en el futuro convertirse en hombres de bien, y sobre todo para que gocen de buena salud ya que hace poco dos de sus hijos fueron operados, razón por la que tuvo que despojarse de algunos bienes a fin de solventar los gastos de sus respectivos tratamientos.

Ahora quiere recuperar el bienestar de su familia, invirtiendo en la crianza de animales, para lo cual solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares y agradece muy gentilmente su actitud solidaria.

loans.use: Purchase of small animals to breed and sell.

loans.name: Sinafea

texts.en:
Sinafea S. is a 19 year old mother in Faleu Manono who runs a very successful fishing business. Her husband works at Yasaki and she relies on him to make payments and help support the family. They have one child who is in school.

This will be Sinafea's fifth loan and she will use it for home improvement. She believes these loans will be the beginning of success for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy iron roofing, nails, timber and cement for home improvement

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Don Rolando learned the art of embroidery in his childhood, and with time, he has perfected it making high quality suits, which qualify him as one of the best artisans in his area. He does this work for all kinds of traditional suits. He also works at parties to celebrate towns' histories, since his artistic talents have let him perform for some time as a musician playing the tuba. Nevertheless, his permanent work is dedicated to the embroidery of clothing for exclusive use for the parties in his beloved valley. This noble trade has allowed him to be able to support his five children, who motivate him every day. He is a good father who wants to see his children succeed, and he wants to pass on his knowledge to them so they can perform this noble work along with him. Don Rolando hopes to have an embroidery stand and also a large restaurant in Chosica. This is why he will keep working and giving it his best to keep offering beautiful suits for parties to the Huancaína population. He is requesting a loan of $100 to be able to purchase materials that he will use in the production of his traditional suits. Let help a talented person with excellence keep being a pillar in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Desde su niñez Don Rolando aprendió el arte del bordado y con el tiempo se ha estado perfeccionando haciendo trabajos de calidad que lo califican como uno de los mejores artesanos de su zona, él realiza estos trabajos para todo tipo de trajes típicos, también para las fiestas patronales de cada pueblo ya que sus dotes artísticas le han llevado a desempeñarse por un tiempo como músico tocando la tuba, Sin embargo su labor permanente está abocado al bordado de prendas de uso exclusivo para las fiestas de su querido valle.Este noble oficio le ha permitido poder sostener a sus 5 hijos que son su motivación diaria, como buen padre que es quiere verlos superados y transmitirles sus conocimientos para que desempeñen esta noble labor en su compañía. Don Rolando desea tener un stand de bordados y también un amplio restaurante en Chosica, es por ello que seguirá trabajando y dando lo mejor de sí para seguir ofreciendo hermosos trajes de fiesta a la población huancaína. Solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares para poder comprar los materiales que utilizará en la elaboración de sus trajes típicos. Apoyemos a un talento con excelencia a seguir siendo un pilar en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for the production of traditional suits.

loans.name: Ana Fati

texts.en:
Ana Fati W. is a sixty-year-old lady who is married and has eight children. Five of the eight live overseas. Out of the three who live with Ana, one daughter is mentally handicapped. Her daughter's needs are one of her main obstacles. No one in the family works, except for Ana's husband, who is a village leader (the Pulenuu). Ana has a garden that helps to supplement the family income.

Supporting the family is not that easy for Ana. Every morning she has to irrigate and weed the garden. Aleisa, where she lives, is far from the town, so petrol is one of her daily expenses. She has an old van that she uses to transport her cabbages, cucumbers, spring onions and flowers to the market. Ana is old and not suitable for hard work like digging holes in the garden, and so she hires two boys from her neighborhood to dig the holes for her. She is on her seventh loan and has received $4,000. Ana is requesting this loan to fertilize her garden and improve her home. Her dream is to have a market overseas for her goods and also to build better housing for her and the children.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her garden and also iron roofing and timber for home improvements.

loans.name: Thelma Odilia

texts.en: I am dedicated to selling natural medicines like manzanillas, anise, romero, cinnamon, linseed, and others. I also sell vegetables and plastic boats in a market in the city of Tegucigalpa, Honduras. I have been doing this for 11 years. With the profits from the sales, I have been maintaining my family and the expenses of studies and medicines for my children. My husband and I work hard from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. to be able to maintain our family.

loans.use: Purchase of natural medicine and vegetables

loans.name: Liua T

texts.en: Liua is one of the old ladies in the Samatau Fou Center. She is sixty years old and she is married with eight children. Her husband does not work. Therefore, her plantation is the primary way Liua supports her family. The income helps send the children to school, pay family commitments, and solve financial issues. Liua goes to the market four days a week. She spends the rest of her time weaving fine mats and also fans for extra income. However, she lives on the far east of Upolu Island, which means transportation costs are one of her major problems. She is looking for a solution to this problem and she hopes that in the future she will be able to have her own transportation to deliver her goods to the market. Although Liua is happy with her business, she is requesting the current loan to further develop her plantation.

loans.use: To buy iron roofing, timber, and cement for home improvements and also chemicals and equipment for her plantation.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en: For eleven years I have had this little business selling food in the market for San Miguel in the town of Guanacaste, Honduras. I have quite a few clients because they like the soups and foods such as meat, rice and salads. The soups of beef and vegetables are very delicious. Now I need to buy more meat and vegetables to make my meals, and help my family with the income from the sales.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, beef, chicken, condiments and more

loans.name: Lemau

texts.en: Lemau G. is one of the younger women who have joined the programme recently. She is only twenty-one years of age and she is running a vegetable garden. She grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers and beans. She sells her vegetables to the market and also to the village people. She sells her produce five days of the week, which earns her $80 a day. She is requesting her first loan of  $300 USD. Lemau is very proud to run her own business.

loans.use: To buy weed spray, weed-killing chemicals and knives for her plantation

loans.name: Victorinda

texts.es:
Victorinda is the mother of a family, and every day she strives to give the best of herself to her small children. She has practiced embroidery since her childhood, as her parents taught her this worthy trade with diligence. Today, thanks to this, she can support her family. This fills her with satisfaction because she can use her money to secure the well-being of her family. Not long ago, she formed a co-operative of embroiderers with her brother, in which they work adorning traditional suits. The embroidery and preparation of a suit takes her one to two months depending on the complexity of the work. She always makes a suit according to the preferences of the client. She now plans to keep working even more and plans to raise animals to be able to provide for the needs of her home when there is scarce demand for her suits. This is why she is requesting a loan of $200, which she will invest in the purchase of fabric and thread to continue creating her beautiful hand-made adornments for the benefit of her children. Let's help these marvelous hands that create a promising future every day.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Victorinda es una madre de familia que cada día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de sí a sus pequeños hijos.Se dedica al bordado desde su niñez ya que sus padres le enseñaron con diligencia este digno oficio y hoy gracias a ello puede sostener a su familia.Esto la llena de satisfacción porque puede disponer de su dinero para procurarle bienestar a su familia y junto a su hermano hace poco han formado una sociedad de bordadores en la cual se desempeñan adornando trajes típicos. El bordado y acondicionamiento de un traje le toma de uno a dos meses dependiendo de la complejidad de sus trabajos, siempre lo hace al gusto del cliente y ahora piensa seguir trabajando más ya también piensa dedicarse a la crianza de animales para poder atender en tiempos de escaso trabajo las necesidades de su hogar, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares los cuales invertirá en la compra de tela e hilos para seguir realizando sus bellos adornos manuales en beneficio de sus pequeños.Apoyemos a estas manos maravillosas que cada día forjan un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and thread.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata is a hardworking woman who has dedicated herself to giving her best to her three children and for this reason a year and a half ago she began traveling around her community selling food. She began by taking food to sell to bus stops and now she takes her food to sell on a tricycle. The reason she began doing this is because she needed to support her family. Her husband does not have stable work because he suffers from health problems. His continuing health problems make it so the family cannot rely on him for a stable source of income to cover the many costs associated will supporting the family. Thanks to Honorata’s talents in the kitchen and her hard work she has been able to make enough money to be able to pay for her children’s education in a privates schools and in the university. Honorata wants her family to have their own house one day because presently they live in a dwelling that belongs to a family member. To achieve this dream Honorata will continue to dedicate herself to her work. She wants to increase her business with a loan of US $375. She will invest the money in buying supplies in bulk that she will use to make the foods that she sells daily. With your help Honorata will continue work and her children will have a bright future.

Translated from Spanish and Mariela and Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Honorata es una mujer valerosa que cada día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de sí a sus 3 hijos y esta es la razón por la cual ha decidido hace un año y medio dedicarse a la venta de comidas de manera ambulatoria. Comenzó llevando la comida en tapers al paradero de buses y ahora vende llevando la comida preparada desde su casa en un triciclo, la razón más fuerte que la condujo a realizar esta labor fue el de llevar a su familia el sustento necesario para vivir; su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales y está delicado de salud, las continuas dolencias no le permiten un ingreso seguro y suficiente para poder cubrir varios gastos que se generan en el interior de su hogar. El rubro al que se dedica Honorata gracias a la buena sazón y trabajo diligente le ha permitido poder educar a sus hijos que estudian en el colegio y la universidad pero anhela algún día poder tener una casa propia ya que por ahora habita la morada de un familiar. Es por ello que está decidida a seguir trabajando con diligencia y quiere acrecentar su negocio y para llevar a cabo su propósito solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares que invertirá sabiamente en la compra de víveres al por mayor para poder elaborar las comidas diarias que comercializa. Con tu ayuda podemos hacer que Honorata siga trabajando para ver a sus hijos con un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Buy supplies for the preparation of foods that she will offer daily to her faithful clients.

loans.name: Lusiane

texts.en: Lusiane is one of the new members in the programme. She is requesting a starting loan of $300 USD. She is just beginning to run a Popcorn Business. She sells the popcorn to the school children and also to the people in her village. Lusiane sells one packet of popcorn for $1. She sells six days a week and earns $30 a day. She plans to use the money to buy supplies for her business. Her dream is to build a stable business to run in the future.

loans.use: To buy oil, fryer, and an oven to start her popcorn business

loans.name: Alida Julia

texts.es:
Alida A. is 58 years old and she is a self-sacrificing mother who, since the tragic loss of her husband, had to be both mother and father for her 5 children who thanks to the education that she granted them they are now in high school. She began dedicating herself to agricultural labor, which failed due to the impotence of man over the nature. Later, after some time she opened a kiosk in the Tarma University. When she started her journey, the business road on its tailwind, but due to the commercial location she had problems with the rent amount and she was forced out. Now she is initiating a new project farming and raising sheep, guinea pigs, and hens, and thanks to good fortune she can smile in this activity and has hopes of being able to economically recuperate. This way she will be able to finish remodeling her home in order to give her family better security and to not be easy prey for the thieves that have had the opportunity of disturbing her home.

The amount she is soliciting is $275 USD to invest in improving the breeds of her animals to increase her earnings, which would be directed to the education of her kids and the construction of her home. Collaborate with this mother so that she can reach her highest yearnings with satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alida A. tiene 58 años y es una abnegada madre D. familia que desD. la trágica pérdida D. su esposo, tuvo que ser padre y madre para sus 5 hijos que hoy gracias a la educación que les otorgó cursan estudios superiores.Con mucha entereza empezó dedicándose a las labores agrícolas en la cual fracasó por la impotencia del hombre sobre la naturaleza, luego después D. un tiempo abrió un kiosco en la universidad D. Tarma, cuando inicio su travesía el negocio marchaba viento en popa pero debido a que el local comercial era alquilado tuvo problemas con el monto del alquiler y se vio obligada a dar por terminada su labor.Y ahora esta iniciando un nuevo proyecto ganadero criando ovejitas, cuyes y gallinas; gracias a que la fortuna la sonríe en esta actividad tiene la esperanza D. poder recuperarse económicamente y D. esta manera poder terminar su casa que están remodelando para dar mayor seguridad a los miembros D. su familia y no ser presa fácil para los ladrones que ya han tenido la oportunidad D. turbar la tranquilidad D. este hogar.

El monto solicitado es D. 275 dólares, dinero que invertirá en la mejora D. razas D. sus animales para incrementar sus ganancias que estarán destinadas a la educación D. sus hijos y construcción D. su casa.Colabore a que esta madre pueda culminar sus anhelos con mucha satisfacción

loans.use: Improving the breeds of her little animals in order to increase her earnings

loans.name: Alena

texts.en: Alena T. is a thirty five year old lady, who is married and has five children. This will be her fifth loan to help run her plantation. This time, she will use her loan to improve and expand the business. Alena is a member who budgets her money wisely. When she sees that her inventory is plentiful, she will sell it in the market. If she is low on supplies, she sells in front of one of the shops in her village. Alena believes that if she can grow her business she will no longer need to go all the way to the market. Instead, she will build a shop in her village, or a canteen at the nearby school.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Fuatia Ah

texts.en:
Fuatia is living near the town area, and she is one of the new members in the program. This is her first loan, and she is very proud to be one of the 3,000 ladies within the program that run their own businesses.

The husband does not work, and he is the one who is going fishing. She is 37 years of age, and she is supporting four kids that are all in school. One of her dreams is for her kids to have better education and have good futures.

loans.use: To buy a torch, hooks, strings and other supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Luis Edison

texts.es:
Luis is a very hard working and entrepreneurial 24-year-old. He has worked hard since he was a boy to help his mother. He will soon complete a chef's certification from a prestigious cooking school and hopes some day to attend university. In the meantime he runs several businesses--one selling firewood and another raising guinea pigs for meat. Luis is asking for a loan of $300 to expand these businesses and achieve financial stability so he can some day provide for a family. Let's help this young entrepreneur carry out his plans.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Luis es un joven de 24 años, diligente que ha sabido trabajar desde muy niño ayudando a su madre y que hoy ha decidido emprender su propio centro de ocupación dedicándose a la crianza de cuyes y a la venta de leña.Actividad con la cual se auto educa y gracias a su desempeño está a punto de terminar su carrera de chef en un prestigioso instituto y mantiene latente aún la esperanza de cursar estudios superiores en una universidad sin descuidar sus proyectos de negocio.Podemos observar a un joven que como pocos progresa a su corta edad y cada día tiene nuevos proyectos que anhela realizar, requiere de 300 dólares para poder ampliar su granja y deposito de leña y apela a su buen corazón para poder incrementar su capital para que con el tiempo obtenga estabilidad económica y pueda ofrecer lo mejor de sí a su familia cuando decida conformarla..Ayudemos a este joven empresario a poder realizar sus proyectos de vida.

loans.use: To finance raising guinea pigs and firewood sales.

loans.name: Neivi

texts.en:
Neivi is a 39- year-old lady who is married and has six children. She is one of the new members and this is her first loan of $750.

Her husband is a Carpenter and he gets $250 a week. Neivi said that this is not enough for the family, and running a chips business is her way of helping out her husband with the money problems.

She will be working five days of the week, and she will take the chips to the school to sell. Her dream is to have better housing for the family and also good education for her kids.

loans.use: To buy oil, an oven, pots and other tools for her chips business

loans.name: Fai

texts.en:
Fai P. is proud to be one of the ladies who runs her own small business. She is well educated and got up to the Secondary Level. She said that running her own small business will be one good way of refreshing and keeping her mind active.

She is 31 years old, and she has four dependents. Her husband is a fisherman and he gets paid every week.

She is one of the new members of Vaimoso Uta, and she is young and strong. She joined the program recently, and she is waiting for this first loan to start up her dream. She will start with a BBQ business, and she will be selling it for only five tala a plate.

loans.use: To buy boxes of mutton flaps, turkey tails, sausages and supplies for her BBQ business

loans.name: Gabriela  Elena

texts.es:
Gabriela has worked very hard to raise four children on her own since her husband left her. The two eldest are now independent but she continues to support the younger ones. They are the light of her eyes and her inspiration. She raises quail, guinea pigs, rabbits and chickens on her small homestead and the income has served her well to provide for her children. Still, she wants to increase production to finance a good education for them. He greatest goal is to see her sons grow into good men. She is asking for a loan of $375 to build more pens for the animals and raise money for school fees. Please help her realize this dream.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gabriela es padre y madre para sus 4 hijos a raíz del abandono de su pareja, desde entonces tuvo que trabajar muy duro, pero hoy ha aminorado su carga al ser sus dos hijos mayores independientes, ahora sólo vela por el bienestar de sus 2 menores hijos quienes se han convertido en el motor de su corazón y la luz de sus ojos.Esta responsabilidad la hizo una mujer con mucha entereza y vigor, así logró implementar en su hogar una pequeña granja de codornices, cuyes, gallinas y conejos; actividad que hasta ahora le ayuda mucho para satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.Sin embargo Graciela requiere aumentar sus ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de estudios superiores de sus hijos y para ello sigue trabajando arduamente con una clara visión, hacer de sus hijos hombres íntegros y con valores.Solicita la suma de 375 dólares, con el que podrá ampliar los espacios de sus animalitos e incrementará sus ingresos con los cuales podrá ofrecer una educación adecuada a sus menores hijos.Tu colaboración hará que sus anhelos puedan hacerse realidad en poco tiempo.

loans.use: To expand pens for raising quail and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Falealuga

texts.en:
Falealuga is a 29-year-old mother of one child. She is on the first step of supporting her family, and she wants to begin with a very good start.

She just joined the program recently, and she will start with a Pancake and Ice Cake business. She will be selling her stuff at the school and also to the women during the Bingo game.

Her husband is a Bus Driver, and he earns about two hundred tala a week. Falealuga is looking at a way of developing her family and she wants to continue with loans from SPBD for the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, a fryer and plastic cups for her cake business

loans.name: Lulu Aulia

texts.en:
Lulu is a mother who is talented in sewing materials together in many different styles and patterns. She can also put a printed design on your dress if you want. Lulu is 50 years of age and has been doing her sewing business almost 30 years.

She is thankful for the opportunity to be able to have access to loans for improving her small business. She said that this is the first time she will be borrowing money and this money will buy her a brand new sewing machine.

She has six children, and she is not depending on anyone for money and support. She works six days of the week, and she gets 80 tala a day at this time.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, paint and brushes for her sewing business

loans.name: Mulifanua

texts.en:
Mulifanua P. is a 37-year-old lady who is married and has six kids. All her kids are in school and all of them are depending on Mulifanua for feeding and everything. Mulifanua’s husband is a Policeman and he works five days of the week. The husband gets $200 every week and this money does not cover everything.

Mulifanua and her husband have been doing the plantation for years, but this is the first time they will run it as a business through the SPBD program. She is on her first loan and she wants to continue after this one.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, a wheelbarrow, knives and other tools for her plantation

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en: I have a business designing and selling tortillas. I run this business in my home and also sell at the market in the San Miguel neighborhood of Guanacaste. I started this business 8 years ago. I have very good customers who love my tortillas because they are large and fresh. With the sales revenue I buy medicine for my arthritis. This is the only income I have, since I am a single mother. Thank you.

loans.use: Buy milk, corn, salt and lime

loans.name: Fausia

texts.en:
Fausia F. is 32 years of age, and she is married with three children. They live at Falelauniu, and she is one of the new members of the program. Her husband is a policeman, and she relied on him for everything before she joined the program.

She is is now running her own small business, and this money will really help the husband for the week’s expenses and other family things. She is young and active and her dream is for the business to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds for cucumbers, cabbages and tomatoes, as well as tools for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Tagiilima P

texts.en:
Tagiilima is 38 years old and her husband is a Policeman. He works at Tafaigata Prison and he earns $250 every week. They have three kids who are attending the Village Primary School.

She is new to the program, and she is on her first loan of $300. She has been doing this business for two years, but this is the first time she has joined the program and the first time to run it as a business. She is looking at expanding this business in the future so that she can earn more for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rakes, knives, weed-killers and chemicals for her garden

loans.name: Maranata

texts.en:
Maranata used to be a teacher at Leififi College. She resigned from there four years ago and decided to stay home and run her own small shop. She is now joining the program and this is her first loan of $300.

She lives at Faleula, and her shop is located at the front of her house on the roadside. She is open seven days of the week from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m., and she manages to get $1,800-$2,000 a week.

She has one child and she is in the Primary Level at school. Her dream is to have a better future for her daughter, and to let the business grow.

loans.use: To buy more supplies and stock for her shop

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en: Hello, I have this small business in my house in the neighborhood of Villa Nueva. I sell used clothing for children, men and women. I have been doing this for five years. The loan money is to invest in the business and have more variety of clothing to be able to provide better service to my clients. I already have several orders from my clients as we approach the Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase used shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, blouses and other clothes

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a mother of four children. She is taking good care of them by sending them all to school, and she is working hard to meet all their needs physically and mentally. The husband is a gardener, and he is working hard to help Winnie with running the business.

She grows cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes, and also beans. She works three days of the week on their garden, and then goes to the market on Fridays and Saturdays. She provides fresh vegetables, and she is making sure that the public is interested in her products and will always buy from her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, chemicals and seeds for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
I sell second-hand clothes for a living. I have had this business for five years. Now I need more capital in order to maintain my business and buy shirts, pants, sweaters, blouses, and other apparel. Because the holidays are approaching, I currently have several orders. This is a great season for my business because my sales increase. With the income generated from my business, I help my husband with the family expenses, since he earns very little.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, este negocio lo tengo en mi casa desde hace 5 años. Ahora necesito el dinero para poder sustir mi negocio y comprar: camisas, pantalones, sueteres, blusas etec. Ahora tengo varios pedidos ya que se hacerca la tenpodata de navidad esta es una buena epoca ya que se incrementan mis ventas. Con los ingresos de las ventas ayudo a mi esposo con gastos de familiares, ya que el gana muy poco dinero en su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of shirts, jeans, pants, and other apparel

loans.name: Folole

texts.en:
Folole joined the program recently. She is on her first loan of $300 US, and she is running a Pancake Business. She sells her pancakes at the school and also to the village people for morning tea. She sells seven days of the week including Sundays and Saturdays.

Her husband does not work and this will be a good source of income for not only them but also for their four children, who are in school. She is hoping that this business will really support her children in school so that they will be well-educated and have good futures.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, a fryer, spoons and forks for her pancake business

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
My name is Yesica C.. I sell cinnamon twists, cookies, candy, and newspapers in my small business. I have owned my shop, located in the Villa Nueva district of the capital city of Tegucigalpa, for five years. I need the loan in order to maintain my business and provide better service for my customers—the students and pedestrians who frequent the nearby bus stop. I am a single mother who has many expenses, such as paying for my children’s schooling. My profits allow me to pay for their tuition and fees.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Yesica C., tengo este pequeño negocio de venta de churros, galletas, papel periodico y confites. Este negocio lo tengo hace 5 años en la coloni Villa Nueva de la capital de Tegucigalpa. El dinero lo ocupo para sustir el negocio y dar un mejor servio a mis clientes los cuales son los de las escuelas y peatones que pasan cerca de la parada de buses. Soy madre soltera y tengo gastos con mis hijos ya que ellos estan estudiando en el colegio, y de las ventas pago sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase of cinnamon twists, candy, cookies and other products

loans.name: Silupe

texts.en:
Silupe is one of the old members within the programme who is still making use of the loans. She is fifty years of age and she is married and has eleven children. Most of Silupe’s children are living overseas with their own families and their own children. Her husband does not have a job but he is good with boats. He goes to sea five days of the week, depending on the weather and the climate.

Silupe is the one who is dealing with making prices and selling the fish. If she can sell five strings of fish a day she can get one hundred and twenty five tala a day. Silupe takes her fish to the Fish Market twice or three times a day. Fishing provides more money, as she explained, but is very risky for her husband. She is looking for more loans and she is one of the active members within the community.

loans.use: To buy chains and anchors for her family's fishing boat

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
This woman is a widow and mother of twelve. She managed to raise her children thanks to her cooking skills, since before having her own business she worked as a cook for an industrial kitchen. Her husband worked as a farmer and due to his low-income survival was very hard for Mrs. Juana and her children, and she sacrificed much for their well-being. After working at this place for more than 20 years she decided to start her own cooked food business with a small capital of $60 and a pair of old chairs a little more than 14 years ago. At the beginning, her food was prepared at home and then she would take it to her stand at the market. After a while she improvised a grill so she could cook on the spot. With the help from her children, who helped her in the business after their father's death, Mrs. Juana improves her stand, also with some financing from CEPRODEL. Even three of her children (the younger ones) work in the the business , cleaning, cooking and taking care of the clients. One of her younger daughters works on the business and attends university on Saturdays. This business is an important source of employment and it is a means for Mrs. Juana and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es viuda, madre de 12 hijos los cuales logró criar gracias a sus dotes de cocinera, ya que ella antes de tener su propio negocio, laboraba como cocinera para una empresa industrial. Su esposo se dedicaba a la agricultura trabajando como jornalero y dado sus bajos ingresos hizo muy difícil la supervivencia de doña Juana y sus hijos, lo que supuso grandes sacrificios. Luego de laborar en este lugar por más de 20 años decide poner su propio negocio y con un pequeño capital inicial de US$ 60.00 dólares y un par de mesitas un tanto viejas y desgastadas coloca su modesto puesto de venta de comida desde hace poco más de 14 años. Al principio la comida la preparaba en su casa y la trasladaba hasta el puesto en el mercado, luego en el local logra improvisar un fogón para cocinar en este lugar. Con el apoyo de sus hijos quienes le ayudaron en el negocio luego de la muerte de su padre doña Juana logra mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio haciendo uso además del financiamiento proporcionado por CEPRODEL. Aún tres de sus hijos (los menores) trabajan en el mismo negocio, limpiando, cocinando y atendiendo a la clientela. De sus hijos, una de las menores, la cual trabaja en el mismo negocio cursa sus estudios universitarios en modalidad sabatina. Este negocio es actualmente un importante generar de empleo y el medio de doña Juana y su familia.

loans.use: Compra de productos para realizar a diario comida

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
This woman has, since a little bit more than 23 years, a small but well stocked stand of general goods where she sells random merchandise such as basic grains, detergent, tomato sauce, shoe-shining pasta, etc..

According to her, she has had to fight very hard to make her business grow, she has worked on retail since a very young age. Before having he business, she sold traditional dishes such as 'Pork with yucca.' She would sell this outside in the market's sidewalk, the same place where she's located now but in worst conditions (she had a wood and plastic bag stand). After 2 years she decided to change activities and she started selling grains with a very modest capital of $250. Thanks to her sacrifice, perseverance and good management of her resources she has improved her working place and she puts a lot of effort in increasing the variety and quantity of her products.

Mrs. M. is in a relationship, her partner is a driver and he helps her with the house expenditures, although not in 100%, because of his low salary, which is hardly $100 a month. Mrs. M. has three children, all in school age and they are both raising the children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora posee, desde hace poco más de 23 años, un pequeño, pero bien surtido puesto de ventas de mercadería en general en donde vende de todo un poco: granos básicos, detergente, salsa de tomate, pasta de lustrar, etc.

Según manifiesta ella misma, ha tenido que luchar duramente para hacer crecer su negocio, ya que desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio. Antes de tener este local, se dedicaba a la venta de Cerdo con yuca (plato tradicional), las ventas las realizaba en las aceras del mercado, más tarde con su venta de cerdo con yuca logra ingresar al mercado en el mismo lugar donde está ubicada actualmente pero en condiciones menos adecuadas (tramo de madera y plástico negro); luego de 2 años decide cambiar de actividad y empieza a vender granos básicos con un modesto capital inicial de US$ 250 dólares. Gracias a su sacrificio y perseverancia ha logrado hacer uso adecuado de sus propios recursos y de los recursos provenientes de los créditos que ha recibido, realizando mejoras en el puesto que posee y a su vez esforzándose por aumentar el surtido de su negocio, es decir, tiene de todo un poco, aunque en menores cantidades.

La señora M. es acompañada, su pareja labora como conductor particular y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, aunque no en un 100%, debido a su bajo salario que apenas llega a los US$ 100 dólares al mes, tiene tres hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar los cuales está formando junto a su pareja.

loans.use: Compra de productos (arroz, frijoles, maiz, etc).

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
This woman is married with three school-aged children (one in primary school and two in secondary school). From a young age, Patricia has fought to earn a living in different activities.

At the beginning, she had a small grocery store in her home. Later, she dedicated herself to the artesian manufacturing of mattresses in her home which she and her husband sold in the street, but the loading and transport of the mattresses became very difficult and sales were not good. Six months ago, her husband gained employment as a driver and decided to open a modest food establishment which is maintained completely by Patricia.

The business consists of a small table, six plastic chairs, and a small artesian-made stove.

Thanks to her efforts the business has been growing gradually, to the degree of improving the infrastructure of the small dining room and hiring two workers who help in the kitchen and attend to clients.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Sheaffer, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Spanish (Original) Esta señora es casada, tiene un total de tres hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar, los cuales estudian dos en secundaria y uno en primaria. Desde muy joven, doña Patricia ha luchado por ganarse la vida en diferentes actividades.

Al principio tuvo una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, más tarde se dedicó a la elaboración artesanal de colchones, los cuales elaboraba en su casa de habitación y su esposo se dedicaba junto a ella de la venta de forma ambulante, pero cada vez más la carga familiar se hacía más difícil y las ventas no eran muy buenas. Desde hace poco más de 6 años, su esposo consiguió empleo como conductor particular y deciden poner un modesto puesto de comida, el cual era atendido completamente por doña Patricia.

El negocio contaba con una mesita y seis sillas plásticas, además de un pequeño fogón elaborado artesanalmente. Gracias al esfuerzo realizado el negocio ha venido creciendo paulatinamente, al grado de realizar mejoras en la infraestructura del pequeño comedor y actualmente cuenta con dos trabajadores que le ayudan en la cocina y en la atención al cliente.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains for the production of foodstuffs sold daily

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
This young entrepreneur is a single mom with big dreams. With the help of her parents, she was able to start selling spices in Chinandega's central market. She was able to finish her studies and graduate from the Secretariado Ejecutivo, but due to how hard it is to find a job and the low wages, she decided to start her own business with her savings, about $200.00. Back then her stand was just a wooden table.

She continued saving her money over the 10 months she worked for a private company as a secretary and receptionist. She now supports her parents who still have their own stand right next to hers. This young girl, in addition to helping her parents with their business and at home, makes floral arrangements and piñatas. We believe it's very important to help this kind of you entrepreneurs whose initiative helps create more jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta joven emprendedora, es soltera sin hijos pero con grandes deseos de superación. Gracias a que sus padres desde hace varios años establecieron un modesto y humilde puesto de venta de especies en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega ella logra terminar sus estudios y se gradúa de Secretariado Ejecutivo, pero ante las dificultades de encontrar empleos y a los bajos salarios, decide iniciar su propio negocios mediante unos pequeños ahorros de US$ 200.00 dólares, en ese entonces el puesto era una pequeña mesa de madera.

Los ahorros fueron acumulados durante los 10 meses que laboró para una empresa privada como secretaria-recepcionista. Ella ahora sirve de apoyo para sus padres, los cuales aún poseen su puesto de ventas, el cual está ubicado junto al que ella posee. Esta joven, además de cuidar de su propio puesto ayuda a sus padres en el de ellos y aporta en el hogar. Además de vender en el mercado, la joven elabora en su casa de habitación Adornos florales y piñatas por encargo. Creemos que es importante apoyar a este tipo de jóvenes emprendedores, cuyas iniciativas generalmente se vuelven generadoras de empleo.

loans.use:
Purchase of goods (spices) and materials for piñatas

Compra de productos (especies) y materiales para piñatas

loans.name: David

texts.es:
"I have a grocery business in my house, but I would like to invest in it more since I am missing some of the things that my clients request." He is seeking a $600 loan to invest in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio en mi casa de abarrotes, pero me gustaría invertirle más ya que me hacen falta algunas cosas que mis clientes me piden”. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in his business.

loans.name: Geidy Xiomara

texts.es:
Hello my name is Geidy, my main activity is the commerce. I own a store in the center of my community called "Children of Christ". I have been in this business for several years to help my husband with our family expenses. At this moment I do not have enough capital to statisfy my customer's demand which is greater every day.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Geidy, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas llamado como Golosinas "Hijos de Cristo" ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genra ingresos para ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de mi familia. Actualmente no cuento con capital suficiente para satisfacer la clientela ya que la demanda cada día es mayor.

loans.use: Purchase of butter, potatoes, meats, vegetables and refreshments

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
"I need to enlarge the size of my home since the space is small and we are a family of six. I would like to have two more rooms. I seek $1200 to make my home a bit more spacious. "

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito ampliar un poco mi vivienda ya que es muy reducido el espacio que tenemos y somos 6 de familia, me gustaría hacer dos cuartos más ” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para ampliar un poco mi vivienda.

loans.use: enlarge my home

loans.name: Venessa Elizabeth

texts.es:
My name is Venessa Elizabeth. I am an entrepreneur who has a small cosmetics and American apparel business that I operate from my own home. I have been working in this field for a year, and thanks to the income generated from this business, I am able to cover my family expenses. I am a single mother with a son whom, thank God, I have been able to help succeed.

I currently need to restock my inventory because the holidays are coming, and I need to take advantage of the increase in sales. At this time, I do not have enough capital to be able to offer my customers a wide selection of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Venessa Elizabeth, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta cosmeticos y ropa americana, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, tengo un año de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, gracias a los ingresos que persivo de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de mi familia, soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo el que gracias a Dios e sacado adelante.

Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta, la que debo aprobechar al maximo y en estos momentos no cuento con el capital suficiente para poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase of dyes, skin cream, sandals, and hair gel

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is 50 years old. She has a big family. She has 4 children. Three of them live in Argentina with relatives. The fourth one works along with his dad in Zofraco. Cristina takes care of one of her grandchildren.

Cristina sells 'chicha' from her house. She also sells marinated and fried pork meat on the weekends. She raises pigs which she then sells the meat at the local market. She has a lot of experience since this is a family traD. that has been passed from generation to generation.

She has been very successful in her business since not many people in her area do this kind of thing compared to selling chicha and homemaD. food. She will use the loan to purchase some pigs between 176-198 lbs. valued at $600 bolivares. She would like to make her business grow by purchasing more pigs and by selling more pork meat.

This is her second loan with our institution. She has a great credit history which makes her a great candidate for a loan. She was not at home at the time the pictures were taken.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina es una persona D. 50 años D. edad, tiene una familia muy numerosa, su familia esta conformada por 4 hijos D. los cuales tres se encuentran en la Argentina con familias, el cuarto hijo trabaja junto al padre en ZOFRACO. Cristina esta a cargo D. uno D. sus nietos. Cristina se dedica al comercio D. chicha en su domicilio, también venD. los fines D. semana chicharron y escabeche, paralelamente a este negocio se dedica a la crianza D. chanchos para su posterior venta en el mercado, tiene mucha experiencia ya que son negocios heredados D. familia. La cliente tiene mucho éxito con su negocio ya que en la zona la compra y venta D. chanchos son pocas personas las que tienen este negocio, pero si vale recalcar que la venta D. chicha y comida tiene mucha competencia debido a que existen gran cantidad D. personas que realizan esta actividad. Con la presente solicitud comprara varios chanchos entre 80 a 90 kgr los cuales como ganado porcino parado tienen un costo D. Bs. 600 cada uno, la compra la realiza para incremenar su negocio tanto para reproducir como para comercializar su carne. Esta es su segunda secuencia crediticia dentro D. nuestra insititucion su porcentaje D. morosidad es menos del 1% es una buena cliente. Se hace notar que la cliente no se encontraba en su domicilio cuando se fué a sacar las fotos.

loans.use: Compra de Chanchos (to purchase pigs)

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is 54 years old with three children; two of whom can be found in Bolivia and one is traveling. Currently her children are dedicated to the construction and collaborate with her since she runs her business at night. Betty is a very hardworking mother and responsible for her family.

Betty is dedicated to selling food in her family business that offers Sillpanchos and Trancapechos. She takes care of it for 15 days and her brother takes care of it for the other 15 days. They have more than 30 years of experience in that area of food and have a great demand since they are well known in that area.

The competition nowadays for this product is very high, but since the business has been around for so long; the excellent location on America Street and Lobertador Bolivia; and of course the quality of their products relative to other places, they have been very successful.

Betty will buy a conservative with three parts that will allow her to keep her vegetables, conserve the meat and some seasonings used in making her product. The price varies and can range from $400 to $500. This is the fourth time that Betty is seeking a loan. She has repaid all her previous loans without any problems. She was only behind for one day but is a great client and qualifies for another loan. She is currently seeking a $525 loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty tiene 54 años de edad, cuenta con 3 hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en Bolivia uno de viaje. Actualmente sus hijos se dedican a la construccion y colaboran con ella ya que la atención de su negocio se la hace por la noche, Betty es una madre muy trabajadora y responsable con su familia. Betty se dedica a vender comida, en su negocio familiar ofrece Sillpanchos y Trancapechos, por otra parte la señora atiende 15 dias y los otros 15 dias su hermano, ambos se turnan. Tienen una experiencia de más de 30 años en el rubro de la comida y con una buena demanda debido a que son muy conocidos. La competencia hoy en dia de este producto es bastante fuerte pero la antigüedad del negocio, la excelente ubicación America esq. Libertador Bolivar y por supuesto la calidad de producto que ofrece a comparación a otros lugares de venta. Betty comprara una conservadora de tres cuerpos, los cuales le serviran para guardar sus verduras, conservar la carne y algunos condimentos que utiliza en la elaboracion de su producto, el precio es variable ya que el que comprar algo nuevo nuevo el precio oscilaría entre $us. 400.- y $us. 500.-. Esta solicitud es la cuarta secuencia de Betty, los anteriores créditos los canceló con normalidad, presenta un promedio de mora mínimo de 1 dia de retraso pero se la puede calificar como una buena cliente esto en funcion a nuestra Institucion. Se hace notar que el crédito es por Bs. 4,000.-

loans.use: Purchase a conservative.

loans.name: Lesbia Dominga

texts.es:
Hello my name is Lesbia Dominga, my main activity is the sale of used clothes, I have a small business located in the center of my community called varieties "Two Brothers". For a year now and thanks to this business I can earn money to contribute with the expenses of my family and the most important thing is that it allows me to take care of my children. At this moment the demand is greater and I do not have enough capital to satisfy my clients needs offering them a variety of products

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Lesbia Dominga, mi actividad principal es la venta de ropa usada, cuento con un pequeño negocio ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, llamado variedades "Los Dos Hermanos", desde hace un año, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y lo mas importante es que me permite cuidar a mis hijos, actualmente la demanda es mayor y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer a mis clientes, ofreciendoles variedad de producto.

loans.use: Purchase Clothes

loans.name: Lepetia

texts.en: Lepetia is 45-year-old mother from the village of Matautu Lefaga. She is applying for her 5th loan, which she plans to use to expand her plantation business.  She sells her banana and taro products once a week at the Fugalei market, where she earns more than $120 a week. Because of the good quality of her taro and bananas, she is always able to sell all her products in less than 4 hours. Her husband helps her with the maintenance of the plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, knives, and other tools for her plantation, as well as cement and timber for home improvement

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en: Faatupu took out her first loan to start her sewing business from home. She is married with several children to put through school. She specializes in making dressy shirts and Puletasi (a Samoan-style dress). She has a good track record with her loans, having already paid off her first loan of $300. She is now applying for her second loan of $500, which she plans to use to purchase material, buttons, and other supplies for making more T-shirts and puletasi. Her profits have increased from $96 from the time she joined the loan program, to $140 profit now. The improvement of her business has really helped her family meet its daily needs.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, materials, and other supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Peka

texts.en: Peka is a 22-year-old lady from the village of Vailele. She just joined SPBD last month and she is applying for her first loan $300 to start her BBQ business. Unlike many of her fellow villagers, Pkea does not need to come to the market for root crops or local produce because her family owns their own plantation. After receiving the loan, she will operate her business twice a week, on Wednesday and Saturday, which are the days that she knows she can make more money.

loans.use: To buy mutton flaps, turkey tails, potatoes, plastic plates, and other supplies for her BBQ business.

loans.name: Simativa

texts.en: Simativa is a mother of 45 year of age from the village of Toamua Leusoalii. She has five children in school, and she joined SPBD at the beginning of this year. She has already paid off her 1st loan of $300 and is now applying for a $500 loan. She is a hard-working mother, and her bakery specializes in Samoan biscuits. She sells her biscuits at the village shops and also delivers to the market. Simativa earns a profit of $112 every week.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Masi Popo (Samoan biscuits) business and for home improvements

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: The 23-year-old Makerita, from the village of Vaimoso, just joined SPBD 3 weeks ago. She is a single mother of one child. She is looking forward to this loan which she hopes will allow her to start up her barbecue business. She plans to use her earnings to help her family and also for her child’s schooling.  She plans to run her barbecue on Wednesdays and Fridays. She expects to earn $60 profit daily.

loans.use: To buy mutton flaps, turkey tails, potatoes, plastic plates, and other supplies for her BBQ business

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en: Emeline is a young woman of twenty-nine years of age and she has three children. Two of them are in school and the youngest is eight months old. It is a big challenge for Emeline and her husband to struggle for their family's survival. Emeline has a banana plantation and her husband really works hard in getting the job done. Her part to play is selling their products at the market on Fridays and Saturdays, which they believe are the best selling days of the week. Emeline earns more than four hundred tala a week from her sales and she uses it for her loan payment and to meet her family's needs. She is thankful to the S.P.B.D. office for lending her the money to help out with her business and she is looking forward to more loans in order to develop her plantation and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, ladders, boots, knives, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa, a mother of five, does not want her children to suffer in the future. She helps her husband in doing their plantation so they can sell their produce to get money. All of her children are attending school and they both give them their support. It is her husband who works hard to maintain their plantation.

Temukisa appreciates the help of S.P.B.D. for lending the money to back up her business financially. She is responsible for selling their products at the new market where most people go for shopping. Temukisa earns more than 500 Tala ($200 US) a week from her sales and with that she is able to meet her family's needs as well as her loan payment.

loans.use: To buy, knives, boots, weed spray, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita O. is a mother of four and she is forty years old. She runs a food stall business and she sells at the new market from Monday to Saturday. With her husband working as a taxi driver, she decided to have this food stall business in order to help her husband in terms of income for their family.

Anita earns more than three hundred tala profit a week from her business. From this she supports her children’s school and other family needs as well as her loan payment. She is so pleased to have S.P.B.D. to back up her small business' financial needs and she is looking forward to more loans in order to improve her business and her family as well.

loans.use: To buy mutton flaps, turkey tails, tomato sauce, foil, plastic plates, and other supplies for her food stall

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en: Luafulu T. is a hard-working woman of forty-nine years of age. She has six children; four are already married and three are still attending school. As she is about to turn fifty, she has worked so hard to support her husband with their plantation in order to get money to support their children. It is her first loan from S.P.B.D. and she is so grateful to get this help in order to help out with her business financially. Luafulu is looking forward to some more loans in the future in order to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy weed spray, knives, ladders, boots, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
As a wife of a driver, Ketut A. was expected to be able to help her husband to supplement her family income by farming. She chose to farm because this job allows her to work and stay home to take care of her three children. She has been farming pigs for a long time, but still didn't achieve optimal result. Starting with a breeder, Ketut A. plans to add her pig farm population to be grown and slaughtered. The high cost of feeds makes Ketut A. had to prepare additional funds to buy them. She is seeking help from DINARI for financial help and additional training. The loan will be used to buy more piglets and feeds. From this farm, Ketut A. can earn up to $300 per 6 month. This surely helps her family's earnings tremendously and helps her in paying her three children's tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sebagai istri dari suami yang berprofesi sebagai sopir , Ketut A. dituntut untuk mampu membantu suami dalam hal menambah pendapatan keluarga. Bertani sekaligus beternak merupakan pilihan hidup yang dia jalani, karena dengan usaha itu ia masih dapat mengerjakan semua aktifitas sebagai ibu rumah tangga sekaligus mengasuh ketiga orang anaknya. Usaha beternak babi sudah lama dia tekuni, akan tetapi belum mampu memperoleh hasil yang maksimal. Berawal dari satu ekor Induk , Ketut A. berencana menambah populasi babinya untuk penggemukan. Biaya pakan yang cukup tinggi membuat Ketut A. harus menyiapkan dana tambahan untuk biaya pakan ternak. Dinari sebagai sebuah lembaga yang memberi bantuan dari segi dana dan pelatihan, menjadi tujuan Ketut A. untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dana itu dimanfaatkan untuk biaya pembelian pakan dan bibit babi. Dari usaha ternak babi baik pembibitan maupun penggemukan , Ketut A. bisa memperoleh keuntungan hingga Rp. 2.700.000.- / 6 bulan. Ini jelas akan mampu menambah pendapatan keluarga didalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sekaligus biaya sekolah ketiga orang anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase feed and grower pigs

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
Ni MAde S. is a model of extraordinary mother and wife. In her daily life, she helps her husband as a construction labor, runs a farm. These works are done just to supplement her family's income and pay tuitions for her two children. She has run her pig farm for a while, however high cost for feeds and piglets makes it impossible for her to expand her business. She understands that pig farm can be promising financially. The profit from the difference of selling revenue and daily cost and additional revenue stream from selling excrement as fertilizer is quite promising. This increases her motivation to expand her farm and increase her pigs. With additinal funding and training from DINARI, Ni Made S. can add 2 more pigs to her farm so she can have 3 pigs at a time. Piglets costs her $33 each and feeds supply for 4 months costs her $55,so she can earn $100 per 4 month periods. With this additional business income, Ni Made S. can afford to send her two children to school.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Made S. merupakan potret seorang ibu sekaligus istri yang luar biasa. Dalam keseharian hidupnya ia mampu membantu suami dalam pekerjaan membangun rumah , bertani sekaligus beternak babi. Pekerjaan itu ia kerjakan semata-mata untuk menambah pendapatan keluarga sekaligus membiayai sekolah kedua orang anaknya. Usaha beternak babi telah lama ia geluti, akan tetapi harga pakan dan bibit yang tinggi membuat istri dari I Wayan Kariasa ini tidak dapat mengembangkan usahanya. Ia paham betul beternak babi sangat menjanjikan, keuntungan dari selisih penjualan dan biaya yang dikeluarkan sekaligus limbah berupa pupuk kandang membulatkan tekadnya untuk menambah jumlah babi yang dipelihara. Dengan tambahan modal dan pelatihan dari DINARI, Ni Made S. bisa menambah populasi babi lagi 2 ekor. Sehingga total ia memelihara saat ini sejumlah 3 ekor. Dengan harga bibit Rp. 300.000.- / ekor dan biaya pakan selama 4 bulan pemeliharaan sebesar Rp. 500.000.- maka ia akan mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 900.000.- / 4 bulan.
