Dengan tambahan pendapatan dari usaha ini, Ni Made S. mampu menyekolahkan kedua orang anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase piglets

loans.name: Ni Made Tinggalasih

texts.id:
As a wife of a specialty worker. forced Ni Made Tinggalasih to help her husband to increase family income. Husband's income is not certain, made her work harder in her pig raising business. The profit from pig farming has added the family income. Besides selling pig feedstock, pig waste is also used as organic fertilizer, so that all plants in her field could grow and produce as she had hoped. The high cost of pig feed is difficult for Ms. Made to raise her animals. Seasonal Field's results, and uncertain husband's income, made her apply for funds and training from Dinari. The expected funds would be used for pig's feed and prepare for 2 mother pigs. Profit from 1 mother pig could reach Rp2,000,000 (about US$220)/6 months. With such profits, Ms. Made likes to increase her pig's population by another mother pig, so that it could add to family's income. Profit from pig farming is used to pay for daily expenses, and children's food expenses for their future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai istri dari suami yang berprofesi sebagai seorang tukang, mengharuskan Ni Made Tinggalasih untuk dapat membantu suami dalam menambah pendapatan keluarga. Penghasilan suami yang tidak menentu, membuat ia harus lebih tekun dalam mengelola ternak babi yang ia miliki. Keuntungan yang didapat dari beternak babi dirasakan dapat menambah pendapatan keluarga. Selain dari menjual bibit babi, limbah berupa kotoran ternak dimanfaatkan sebagai pupuk organik sehingga semua tanaman yang ada di kebunnya bisa tumbuh dan berproduksi sesuai degan harapannya. Tingginya harga pakan membuat Made kesulitan dalam memelihara ternaknya. Hasil kebun yang musiman dan pendapatan suami yang tidak menentu membuat ia mengajukan permohonan dana dan pelatihan kepada DINARI. Dana yang diperoleh akan dimanfaatkan untuk biaya pakan sekaligus mempersiapkan 2 ekor induk. Keuntungan usaha yang ia peroleh dari 1 ekor induk bisa mencapai Rp. 2.000.000.- / 6 bulan. Dengan keuntungan itu membuat Made ingin menambah populasi ternak babinya berupa 1 ekor induk lagi , sehingga nantinya dapat mampu menambah pendapatan keluarga. Keuntungan usaha ternak babi Made manfaatkan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah anaknya demi masa depan.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed

Membeli pakan dan bibit babi

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: Etevise is a talented young woman of thirty eight years of age. She runs a small retail shop business at her village. She has four children who are all attending school. Etevise believes that she can do better than she is now because her business is being backed up by her loan from S.P.B.D. She has quite tough competition but she never gives up because she wants her children to get a better education in order to get better future.

loans.use: To buy  mutton flaps, turkey tails, tinned fish, chicken legs, and other supplies for her shop

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.ru:
Shamsullo S., 25, is married and has 2 children. Shamsullo has a dealership that sells SIM and prepaid phone service cards. For that, he rents a place at the bus station near the State University of Kurgan-Tube—a busy location with lots of students and commuters passing by. Shamsullo has been in business for 5 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of SIM and prepaid phone service cards. Shamsullo plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоев Шамсулло, возраст – 25 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, имеет 2 детей. Шамсулло имеет дилерский центр по продаже сим-карт и карт для пополнения баланса мобильных телефонов. Для этого он арендует помещение находящееся на автобусной остановке, которое расположено недалеко от Государственного Университета в городе Курга-Тюбе. Этим видом услуг занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести большее количество сим-карт и карточек по пополнению баланса мобильных телефонов. Так как его центр находится недалеко от Университета, студенты и другие люди стоящие на остановке могут приобретать сим-карты и карточки для пополнения баланса мобильных телефонов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of SIM and prepaid phone service cards

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya M., age 46, is a widow who sells porridge for a living, earning $12.50 per day in revenue. She has seven children, two of whom work at a garment factory earning $100 per month each. Two are students, and three are married. Ya would like to borrow $800 to purchase a motorbike for one of her sons to use to operate a moto-taxi business. She anticipates this will bring in another $2.50-$5 per day in income to help her family. She is pictured in the photograph next to her son .

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly K., age 41, works at a factory near her village, earning around $2 per day in income. Her husband is a construction foreman, making around $2.50 per day. They have three children; two are grammar school students and one is still too young to attend school.

Ly would like to increase her family’s income to pay for her children’s education and improve their standard of living. She would like to request a loan of $800 to purchase construction tools so that her husband can vary the type of construction jobs he can work on. This will grow his business and increase income for the family. Ly is pictured with her husband and youngest son in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Ea

texts.en:
Mrs. Ea S. is 27 years old, married with three children, and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her three little children, who are too young to attend school. Her husband is the one who works very hard to support his entire family. He usually gets up early in the morning to drive a motor-taxi to transport his regular customers as well as other passengers in his area.

Mrs. Ea S. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to replace his old one which breaks down often.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to replace his old one which breaks down often

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Ea Sophal start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Nimadgon

texts.ru:
Nimadgon S., 48, is married and has 3 children. He has a sales spot at the “Nikhi” market of Kurgan-Tube. Nimadgon has been selling auto parts for 12 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase more spare parts. With the beginning of the sowing season, the demand for spare parts will increase. Local farmers will be able to acquire the parts they need from Nimadgon. Nimadgon plans to repay this loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Соатов Нимаджон, возраст – 48 лет, образование – средее-техничесткое, женат, имеет 3 детеей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Нихи» в городе Курган-Тюбе. Этим бизнесом занимается уже 12 лет. На сумму кредита планирует приобрести запчасти для автотранспортных средств, тракторов, и других механизмов. В связи с началом посевного сезона, вырастает потребность в приобретение новых автозапчастей, так как селхозтехника находящаяся в пользование у местных фермеров находится не в слишком хорошем состояние и постоянно требует замену определенных частей тракторов и автомомобилей. Нимаджон имея торговую точку на местном рынке даёт возможность местным фермерам приобретать необходимые запчасти, что позволяет им экономить их время и денежные ресурсы. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat S., age 47, works with her husband to grow vegetables on their plot of land and sell them in the market, earning around $1 per day. They have six children. One child works selling rice and fruit in the market, earning around $7 per day in revenue. Three of Mrs. Khat’s children work alongside her son-in-law, who earns about $9 per day in revenue from his blacksmith business. The other two children are students.

Khat would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase additional blacksmith tools so her family can take on larger, more lucrative commissions to meet clients' demands. She would also like to use the money to rent a proper shop so the business can attract more customers in town. The additional income projected to come from this business expansion will help finance her younger children’s education and increase the standard of living for her family. She is pictured with her husband in their home.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith tools and open a blacksmith shop

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en:
I was born and brought up in Okara, a small city, but moved to Lahore, the second largest city after my marriage. I am a mother of six, three daughters and three sons. I make jewelry tassels and I am quite skillful at my work and earn up to $100 a month out of this business.

A year ago I took a loan and established a ready-made clothing business for my son who had to quit his studies after the tenth grade due to our meager household income. The clothing business yielded us handsome profits, which enabled me to continue to pay for the studies of my younger children.

To help my children pursue higher studies, we need to increase our income further. My son plans to expand his clothing business, for which he requires a loan of US$ 400. He will buy trendy clothes in bulk to save on cost so that he can sell at a reasonable profit.

loans.use: buy in bulk for clothing business

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung M., 33, lives with her husband and three children in SiemReap Province, Cambodia. To help support her family, she runs a stand at her home selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her community, where she can typically earn around $5 each day. Her husband works as a tire repairman on the roadside, earning around $ 2/day of profit.  In order to meet her growing customer demand, Mrs Kung M. needs a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet growing customer demand

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Kung Muny start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Gul

texts.en: I am Gul Z. and I moved to Lahore, second largest city of Pakistan from a small mountainous town after my marriage. I live in a small rented house with my husband and five children. I understand the importance of education and therefore I have enrolled all of my children to school except the youngest two who are too small to go to school. I make decorative tassels for jewelry whereas my husband runs an electric appliances shop. Together we are able to make $200 a month. My husband does not have a complete range of appliances at his shop and so many of his customers requests are turned down. We want to fulfill our customer’s needs and need more product variety. This will cost us US$550 Expanding our business this way will leave us with sizeable profits which we will save to buy a house of our own.

loans.use: BUY NEW RANGE OF ITEMS FOR THE ELECTRIC STORE

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Mrs. Ann P., age 28, breeds and sells pigs to earn about $8 in revenue per day. Her husband, age 33, buys and resells recyclable products, earning about $11 per day in revenue. They have two children who are too young to attend school. Ann would like to request a loan of US$ 800 to purchase young piglets to raise and fatten for sale as well as a larger stock of recyclable products for her husband’s business so as to take advantage of bulk discounts and increase their profit margin. They plan to use the increased income to educate their children and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and recyclable items

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Ann Phov has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
I am the mother of five children and a housewife. I am not allowed to go out and work as it is not considered acceptable in my family. My husband is an electrician and operates an electrical goods store where he provides goods such as tube lights, electric bulbs, fans, and so forth.

Earlier I took loans to finance his start-up business. The business is growing slowly since then. We need an additional investment of US$ 400 to buy some required inventory for our store. We will also use our savings to buy the needed stock.

loans.use: EXPAND ELECTRICAL GOODS STORE

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
My name is Parveen Mushtaq and I live in Lahore, a city of 10 million people. I am married and have five children. All of my children are enrolled in a small private school. I make jewelry tassels whereas my husband runs a dairy shop. He purchases milk on credit from the farmers in various nearby cities for his milk store, which is rather expensive.

If he were able to purchase milk in bulk, paying cash rather than on credit, it would decrease his operating cost and thereby increase profits. It is becoming hard day by day to feed and educate our children due to soaring inflation. I request a loan of US$ 400 for my husband to purchase milk on a cash basis.

loans.use: BUY MILK FOR RESALE IN BULK AND PAY CASH

loans.name: Shugufta

texts.en:
I am Shugufta I. from Lahore, a growing metropolis. I am a mother of two sons and one daughter all of whom are in school. I make jewelry tassels and my husband is a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled taxi) driver.

Last year I took a loan and my husband bought a rickshaw on installments. The income enabled us to repay the loan and installments on time but we are left with very little money for our daily household expenses. We plan to buy another rickshaw which we will rent to another driver to supplement our income. Please lend us US$ 400.

loans.use: BUY RICKSHAW

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun V., 30, is a mother of two school-aged children and lives with her husband in SiemReap province, Cambodia. She works in her laundry shop, earning around $4 each day in revenue, whilst her husband works as an officer at an institution where he can earn around $3 each day.  Mrs. Noeun V. hopes to use this loan to purchase a washing machine, so that her business would be better, faster, and easier.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine to facilitate her business

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
I am Zahida Bibi and the mother of six children. A couple of years ago my eldest son started working as an apprentice at a car service station. Last year I took a loan for him and he launched his own car service station in a rented shop.

My son wants to expand his business and take on more orders for which he needs to buy some equipment, including a water pump. I am therefore requesting a loan of US$ 400 to buy him what he needs to expand his business.

loans.use: expand car service station

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
My name is Mariam B. and I am a widow with six children. I make jewelry tassels for $60 a month. My children had to quit their studies due to the financial repercussions that took place after their father’s death. They were forced to do menial jobs for meager wages.

A couple of years ago, one of my sons bought a bull cart by taking out a loan from ASASAH, a microfinance institution. He obtains orders from various wholesalers to transport goods from one place to another on his bull cart. The income from this business is just enough to feed and clothe the family members. This year he plans to buy another bull cart to increase the income. He will put aside money with this extra income for his sisters’ weddings. Please lend us US$ 400 to purchase a bull cart.

loans.use: Buy a bull cart

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
I am Nargis B.. I was born and brought up in Lahore (second largest city in Pakistan). I am married and I have five children, all of whom study. My husband buys second-hand (used) motorbike silencers from the local wholesale markets and supplies them to nearby auto shops. He earns $0.07 profit for every silencer.

If he is able to buy silencers in bulk this will reduce his purchasing cost, since buying in bulk is relatively cheaper, and we will get higher returns. Please lend us US$ 300 to buy a large quantity of silencers.

loans.use: Buy motorbike silencers in bulk

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
I am a widow and the mother of four children. My eldest son is a turner and the breadwinner of our family. My daughter and I make jewelry tassels on order from a jewelry shop.

A couple of years ago, I took out a loan for my son's turning business. The business grew better and increased our household income. Now my son needs to buy a lathe (a machine which is used to turn and shape metal objects) for which I require a loan of US$ 550.

loans.use: buy a lathe for my son's metal-working business

loans.name: Jorge Filipe

texts.pt:
Jorge Filipe M. lives with his wife and 6 children. They live in the Magoanine neighborhood in Maputo. He joined the program in June of 2006, his first loan was of 6.000MT. Jorge raises and sells chickens in from his home. He is now in the 5th cycle of the program. Jorge is requesting a loan of 15.000MT to be repaid in 6 months and he plans on buying more chicks.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge Filipe M. vive maritalmente e é pai de 6 filhos. Vive no bairro de Magoanine em Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Cria e vende frangos e o negócio está localizado na residência do cliente.Vai agora para o 5º ciclo e vai tomar 15.000MT para pagar em 6 meses e pretende aplicar o valor na compra de maior quantidade de pintos.

loans.use: Buy Chick

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en: I am Asiah B. and the mother of three children, one son and two daughters. My son is in grade one whereas the daughters are too small to attend school. I am a textile designer and I make embroidered clothes. I am very good at my work but I cannot operate on a large scale due to limited resources. I need to expand my clothing business and require US$ 300 as a loan to buy the necessary materials.

loans.use: buy materials required for making embroidered clothes

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I am Parveen N. from Lahore (second largest city in Pakistan). Last year I took a loan from ASASAH, a microfinance institution, and bought a rickshaw for my husband. The rickshaw is our major source of income and now it requires maintenance for which we require a loan of US$ 400.

loans.use: repair our rickshaw

loans.name: Maria Admirada Paulo

texts.pt:
Maria Admirada Paulo M. is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children in the neighborhood of Mahotas in Maputo. She grows and sells fruits and vegetables in Machamba. Maria joined the credit program in October 2006 and her first loan was of 3.000MT. Maria is the 3rd cycle of the program. She is requesting a loan of 10.000MT to be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Admirada Paulo M. tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 4 filhos e vive no bairro Mahotas em Maputo.Dedica-se à produção de hortículas e fruta na sua machamba situada no mesmo bairro onde a cliente reside. Entrou para o programa em Outubro de 2006 e tomou como 1º empréstimo 3.000MT. Está no 3º ciclo de empréstimo e vai tomar 10.000MT pagáveis em 6 meses.

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
I was born in Multan (a city famous for its shrines and saints) but moved to Lahore (second largest city in Pakistan) after my marriage. I am the mother of three daughters and two sons. Two of my daughters are married. I buy ready-made clothes from various factories and sell them to markets in Lahore and other cities.

My husband is a welder; he welds frames that are required in making rooftops of buildings. Last year he bought a welding machine with the loan I took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The machine speeded up our business and helped us obtain a reasonable number of orders and better our poor financial condition. We will be able to get big orders and promptly respond to them if we buy an additional welding machine for which we need a loan of US$ 550.

loans.use: buy a welding machine

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en: I am Kishwer M. and the mother of four girls.  All of my daughters completed their studies to grade ten and now help me in making jewelry tassels. My husband runs a fruit stall in a local fruit market. His fruit stall does well, but the income is still not sufficient to allow us to save for our daughters’ marriages. We need a loan of US$ 550 to expand our fruit business by increasing the fruit variety at our stall.

loans.use: expand fruit business

loans.name: Alberto Leví

texts.pt:
Alberto Leví Bié is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and 5 children in the neighborhood of Bagamoyo in Maputo. He has pool tables and arcade games in the neighborhoods of Khongolote and Luís Cabral. He joined the credit program in March of 2006 and his first loan was of 5.000MT. He is now in the 4th cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 15.000MT to invest in the business and continue the construction of his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, KIVA volunteer.

Alberto Leví Bié tem 47 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro Bagamoyo em Maputo.Tem mesas de bilhares e Vìdeo Games nos bairros de Khongolote e Luís Cabral.É cliente do FDM deesde Março de 2006 e começou com um empréstimo de 5.000MT. Está no 4º ciclo e vai tomar 15.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Investe o valor dos empréstimos no negócio e este tem ajudado a contruir a sua própria residência.

loans.use: Buy equipment

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: I am a widow and the mother of two sons. My sons started an electrical goods store after their father's death. The business was made possible with the loans I took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. My sons have worked very hard to improve our standard of living and we were able to repay their loan last year. I wish them a high standard of living and a comfortable life. Therefore I request from you a loan of US$ 500 with which my sons will expand the inventory for their electrical goods store.

loans.use: buy necessary goods for our store

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
I am the mother of six children and we live in Lahore (second largest city in Pakistan). I do embroidery for nominal wages. Moreover my eldest son works for a local shoemaker, the son next to him operates a knitting business, and the remaining ones work at a car service station for meager wages.

Winter is around the corner and our knitting business can yield us higher profits if we can sell in a larger quantity for which we need to buy the necessary raw materials in bulk. We are short of the required funds and therefore need a loan of US$ 550.

loans.use: buy materials for knitting business

loans.name: Leonor Paulo

texts.pt:
Leonor Paulo S. is single. She lives in the neighborhood of Matendene in Maputo. She joined the credit program in February 2006 and her first loan was of 1.8000MT. She has a stand where she sells beverages. Leonor invests the fund on increasing her inventory. She is requesting a loan of 9.000MT to be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, KIVA volunteer.

Leonor Paulo S. é solteira e vive no bairro Matendene em Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro de 2006 com um emprétimo de 1.800MT. Tem uma barraca na qual vende uma variedade de bebidas. Tem aplicado os valores de empréstimos na compra de stock. Vai tomar 9.000MT para pagar em 6 meses

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
I was born and brought up in Gujrat (a small industrial city of Pakistan) but moved to my husband’s city Lahore( a highly populated city in Pakistan) after I got married. I am the mother of two boys and one girl. Two of my children attend school whereas the third is not of school-going age yet.

My husband runs a PCO (Public Call Office). The income from this business is just enough to put food on our table and send our children to school. In order to increase our household income, my husband plans to buy a video camera which he will rent out at various occasions. The income from these two businesses will help us to better clothe and educate our children. Please lend us US$ 275.

loans.use: buy a video camera to rent out

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: I am Rehana B. and the mother of six children. All of my children attend school except the eldest one who did not like school much and dropped out. I make jewelry tassels on order from various shopkeepers whereas my husband owns and runs a sanitary store. The variety in the store is not great and that serves as a major cause for fewer customers. We need a loan of US$ 400 to expand the variety of the inventory for our store.

loans.use: EXPAND SANITARY STORE

loans.name: Joana Fernando

texts.pt:
Joana is not officially married but lives with a man with whom she has 5 children. Three of her children are in school. This will be her first loan and she will use it to purchase bales of used clothes for her retail business. She lives in the city of Inhambane, which is the province's capital, but she will purchase these bales in Maputo. Her husband is a carpenter and she wishes to help him cover their living expenses as well as their future five children's education tuitions - when all reach school enrolling ages, the cost will be too high for him to sponsor on his own.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Joana e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 5 filhos. tres dos filhos de Joana estao a estudar. este e o primeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar.Ela quer usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra de mais fardos de roupa usada para vender. Ela vive na cidade de Inhambane, capital da provincia com o mesmo nome, entretanto comprara os fardos de roupa em Maputo. O marido de Joana e carpinteiro. Ela quer ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa e no pagamento da escola dos filhos, pois que quando todos estiverem a estudar o marido sozinho nao podera conseguir suportar todas as despesas.

loans.use: Joana wishes to purchase bales of used clothes for retail.

loans.name: Saydullo

texts.ru:
Saydullo M., 42, is married and has 4 children. For 6 years, he has been selling spare parts for cars, tractors and other mechanisms. For that, Saydullo rents a spot at the “Nikhi” market in Kurgan-Tube. Saydullo plans to use this loan to purchase spare parts in Dushanbe. With your help, Saydullo will be able to offer spare parts to the local farmers and save them a lot of time and money. Saydullo plans to repay this loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудов Саъдулло, возраст – 42 года, образование средне-техническое, женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент в течение 6 лет занимается продажей запчастей для таркторов, автомобилей и других механизмов. Для этого клиент арендуют торговую точку на рынке «НИХИ» города Курган-Тюбе. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести в городе Душанбе запчасти и продавать их в Курган-Тюбе. В связи с началом посевного сезона местные фермы будут иметь возможность приобрести необходимые запчасти для своей сельхоз техники в городе Курган-Тюбе, что намного съэкономит их время и денежные средства, так как им не надо будет ехать за запчастями в город Душанбе Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of spare parts

loans.name: Chahina

texts.en: Chahina is a single woman living in the Bekaa and owns a grocery shop. The store is her only source of income. Chahina is an entrepreneur who takes business initiatives to ensure her business's survival. Chahina is planning to develop her grocery store and therefore needs to purchase merchandise to expand her line of products. This is the first time Chahina has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. She heard about the Institution through word of mouth.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
I am Ishrat P. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I have four children, all of whom are in school. I stitch clothes on order for my neighborhood clientele to support my husband and share his financial burden.

My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) driver and now he wants to open a car battery store. There is no such store in our neighborhood and the people have to go to markets at a distance to buy their car batteries. I am quite confident that our business will do well as it will be the only store of its kind in our area. Please lend us US$ 350.

loans.use: OPEN UP A CAR BATTERY STORE

loans.name: Helena Maria

texts.pt:
Helena Maria Z. is 43 years old. She is a single mother of 6 children. She runs a convenience store that sells assorted basic goods, capulanas skirts and charcoal from her home in the Mavalene area in Maputo. She joined the program this year in May and she will now request a loan in the amount of 10.000 Mt, which will be paid back in 8 months. The loan amount will be spent on the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Helena Maria Z. tem 43 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 6 filhos. Tem o seu negócio de venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade, capulanas e carvão na sua residência no bairro de Mavalane em Maputo.entrou para o programa em Maio do presente ano e vai tomar agora 10.000Mt pagáveis em 8 meses para aplicar no mesmo negócio.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Usmonali

texts.ru:
Usmonali S., 36, is married and has 3 children. He lives in Bahtarskiy region. Usmonali dedicated one room of his house to his food store. He has been in business for 2 years. Usmonali plans to use this loan to expand his product inventory. According to Usmonali, his store is always open for customers—either him or his wife is always there. Usmonali plans to repay this loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сайдалиев Усмонали, возраст – 36 лет, образование средне-техничсекое, женат, имеет 3 детеей. Имеет торговую точку в Бохтарском районе. Магазин находится у клиента дома под который он выделил одну комнату собственного дома. Этим бизнесом занимается уже в течение 2 лет. На сумму кредита планирует увеличить ассортимент предлагаемого товара. Так как клиент живёт в кишалке, который находится в нескольких киломаметрах от центра, жиетели данного кишлака не всегда имеют возможность приобрести продукты питания в удобное для них время. Данный кредит поможет жителям кишлака приобретать необходимрые товары продукты питания, так как работая целый день в поле у них иногда не остаётся время съездить в город для того, чтобы сделать необходимые покупки. Умарали говорит, что к нему могут прийти и сделать покупки в любое время суток, так как дома всегда есть либо жена, либо он сам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Product inventory expansion

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: My name is Shazia K. and I am the mother of two children. My husband buys second-hand spare parts of various machines and after cleaning them sells them in various nearby cities.  He is not able to earn enough due to high operating costs which can be decreased if the spare parts are bought in bulk. The spare parts bought paying cash and in bulk are cheaper. I am therefore requesting a loan of US$ 300.

loans.use: BUY USED SPARE PARTS IN BULK

loans.name: Carlota

texts.pt:
Carlota M. is a single mother and she has 5 children. She lives in the Magoanine area in Maputo. She is 42 years old and she sells different kinds of fruits. She joined the program in 2005 as a part of a group, receiving a loan in the amount of 1.900Mt. This time, she will take out a loan in the amount of 5.000mt - it will be paid back within 6 months. The money will be used to increase her merchandise stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Carlota M. é mãe solteira de 5 filhos e vive no bairro Magoanine em Maputo.tem 42 anos deidade e vende fruta diversa. Entrou para o programa em 2005 como cliente grupal e tomou como 1º empréstino 1.800MT. Vai agora tomar um empréstimo de 5.000Mt pagável em 6 meses para aumento do stock.

loans.use: Merchandise Purchase.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
My name is Khailda P. and I am a widow from Lahore, a fast-growing metropolis in Pakistan. I have five children: three sons and two daughters. All of my sons are turners and my daughters stitch clothes for neighborhood clients. None of my children is educated due to the high poverty level. My sons have worked very hard day and night to attain a steady level of income and manage three meals a day for us.

Now they wish to expand their business and buy few lathes (machines used for turning iron) which require a loan of US$ 375. The increased profits from this expansion will help me make better arrangements for my daughters' marriages.

loans.use: buy lathes to expand their iron-working business

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.ru:
Mubariz R. was born and lives in the city of Agsu. He was born in 1978 and is married. Since 2002 he has worked as an auto mechanic. Old equipment did not allow him to do quality work, so Mubariz turned to the Agsu division of Normicro. He took out a loan in 2007 and purchased new equipment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Рагимов Мубариз родилься и проживает в городе Аксу. 1978 года рождения. Не женат. С 2002-го года работает автомехаником. Со старым оборудованием работа не дала качественную работу. По этому Мубариз обратилься за помощью в Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Взяв кредит 2007-ом году, он купил нового оборудования.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

loans.name: Ni Luh Juliasrini

texts.id:
27 year old Luh Juliasrini is married to Ketut Gede Anugrah Artha, her tenat farmer husband. Luh Juliasrini has 2 small children, pre school age. Day to day Luh Juliasrini is busy raising her 2 toddlers, besides raising 3 piglets for fattening. With persistent Luh Juliasrini feeds her pigs mornings and evenings. Daily feed cost are about Rp10,000 (about US$1.10). Besides feeding rice and wheat shell clippings, Luh Juliasrini fed nature food like banana and tals leaves, and banana tree trunks. Before feeding she bathe her pigs and clean the stall. With an initial capital of Rp1,200,000 (about US$132), Luh Juliasrini could profit Rp400,000 (about US$44)/4months. That profit was used to pay for living expenses. With the loan, Luh Juliasrini expect to increase her animal business by increasing population, so that income would increase, and directly impact family's well being.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Luh Juliasrini dengan usia 27 tahun menikah dengan Ketut Gede Anugrah Artha, suaminya, yang bekerja sebagai petani. Luh Juliasrini mempunyai 2 anak yang masih kecil-kecil dan belum bersekolah. Dalam kesehariannya Luh Juliasrini disibukkan dengan mengurus 2 anak balitanya, disamping itu Juliasrini memelihara 3 ekor babi untuk penggemukan. Dengan tekun Juliasrini memberi makan babinya pagi dan sore hari. Biaya yang dibutuhkan untuk pakan setiap harinya sampai Rp.10.000.- Disamping memberikan dedak padi dan dedak gandum, Juliasrini juga memberikan makanan alami seperti daun pisang, daun talas, dan batang pisang. Sebelum memberi makan, babinya dimandikan dulu sampai bersih dan juga kandangnya dibersihkan. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.200.000,- Juliasrini memperoleh keuntungan Rp. 400.000 setiap 4 bulan sekali. Dengan keuntungan itu dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya setiap hari. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, Luh Juliasrini berencana untuk meningkatkan usaha ternaknya dengan menambah populasi yang ada sehingga pendapatannya akan meningkat yang secara langsung akan meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedsock to increase animal population so that income would increase

Membeli bibit babi untuk menambah populasi ternaknya sehingga pendapatannya akan meningkat

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
My name is Zubaida B.. I live in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan, with my husband and four children. All my children attend school except the eldest daughter who makes jewelry tassels with me. My husband operates a ready-made garments business. He buys the cloth used in making these garments from a famous and biggest cloth market in Lahore and stitches them into various beautiful and trendy outfits. He then supplies the finished garments to different shops in nearby markets.

My husband now wants to operate at a bit bigger scale but does not have the necessary capital. If he is able to get the required funds, he will buy cloth in bulk and hire a few workers to help him so that he can get big orders. This expansion will double our income. Please lend us US$ 550.

loans.use: purchase cloth in bulk for garment business

loans.name: Azelia

texts.pt:
Azelia is a single mother of 1 child. She lives with her son and also a niece. Her son does not go to school yet because he has not reached the minimum required age, but as soon as he does, he will be enrolled in a public school. The loan amount will be used to purchase additional clothes in South Africa for her retail store. This will be her first loan. If all goes well and she does not face any unexpected problems, she intends on taking out other loans in order to build a better house. She resides in Homine Sede, in the province of Inhambane.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Azelia e mae solteira e tem 1 filho. Ela vive com o seu filho e com uma sobrinha. O filho de Azelia ainda nao estuda porque ainda nao tem idade. mas logo que atingir a idade exigida ela o ira matricular numa escola Publica.Ela que usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra de artigos de vestuario e calcado na Africa do Sul para a sua tenda.este e o primeiro emprestimo que ela quer tomar. Se tudo correr bem e ela nao tiver nenhum problema ela pretende continuar a tomar outros emprestimos, pois que pretende construir uma casa melhorada . Ela vive em Homine Sede do Distrito do mesmo nome na Provincia de Inhambane.

loans.use: Azelia wants to use the money to purchase extra clothing goods.

loans.name: Ni Made Tesni

texts.id:
Ni Made Tesni lives in Ekasari village, West Bali. Ni Made Tesni besides a housewife, also has a hooby raising pigs which she has done since Tesni got married. With a capital of Rp800,000 (about US$88), Tesni bought 1 mother pig, and after 6 months she gave birth to 8 piglets. Income from sales of piglets are Rp 250,000 (about $27.50)/pig. In 6 months Tesni sold the piglets for Rp2,000,000 (US$220) minus mother pig feed expenses of Rp 270,000 (about $30). Profit left for Tesni is about Rp200,000 ($22)/month. That profit is used to pay for family expenses. With her husband I Wayan Raka, Tesni lives in own land, and a quite permanent building, also all children are married. With the loan, she plans to repair her pig stalls, so that it would be larger and cleaner, so that her pig's health are maintained, and free of disease.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Made Tesni tinggal di Desa Ekasari, Bali Barat. Ni Made Tesni disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga juga mempunyai kegemaran memelihara babi dan hobinya ini sudah ditekuni semenjak Tesni menikah. Dengan modal awal Rp. 800.000,- Tesni membeli 1 induk babi, dan setelah 6 bulan induknya melahirkan anak babi sebanyak 8 ekor. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari penjualan anak babinya per ekor Rp. 250.000,-. Dalam 6 bulan Tesni mendapatkan penjualan anak babinya sebesar Rp. 2.000.000 dipotong biaya pakan induk sebesar Rp. 270.000.- Jadi Tesni mendapatkan peningkatan pendapatan sebesar Rp. 200.000.- per bulan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dipakai untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya , bersama dengan suaminya I Wayan Raka, Tesni tinggal di tanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen, dan anaknya sudah semua sudah menikah . Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, direncanakan untuk memperbaiki kandang babinya agar lebih luas dan bersih sehingga kesehatan babinya bisa terjaga dan terhindar dari penyakit.

loans.use:
To repair pig stall so that it would be larger and more hygienic

Memperbaiki kandang agar lebih luas hyeginis

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Marta M. is 43 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in Bagamoyo, Maputo, and she sells basic need products from her house. She joined the program in 2005 as member of a group and she got her first loan in the amount of 960MT. She will begin her fifth cycle as an individual client and she will need 12.000MT, that will be repaid in 7 months. This amount will be fully applied on the business. The loans she has received have greatly helped - she has been able to improve her house's condition with the profits she has made.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Marta M. tem 43 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e tem 2 filhos. Vive no bairro Bagamoyo em maputo e tem o negócio de venda de produtos de 1ª necessiddae na sua residência.Entrou para o programa em 2005 como membro de um grupo e tomou como 1º empréstimo 960MT. Vai agora pra o 5º ciclo como cliente individual e vai tomar 12.000MT para pagar em 7 meses, o qual pretende aplicar no mesmo negócio. Os empréstimos a tem ajudado uma vez que tem comprado bens de casa com os lucros do negócio.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.ru:
Teyyub N. was born in 1971. He was born and lives in Agsu. Teyyub is a family man and has 2 children. Seven years ago he opened a small mini-market. He did not have enough resources to purchase additional inventory. He applied to the Agsu division of Normicro and borrowed $500. This sum helped him and he was able to purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нуриев Теюб 1971 года рождения. Родилься и проживает в городе Аксу. Семейный, имеет двоих детей. Семь лет тому назад он открыл небольщой мини маркет. Чтобы закупить больше товаров ему не хватало средство. Написав заявление в Нормикро Аксуниский филиал, Теюб взял кредит в размере 500$ . Это сумма помогло ему и товара стало больше.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Javid

texts.ru:
Javid N. was born in 1974 in Agsu and lives there now. He is a bachelor but will marry soon. Javid has been a trader for over 10 years. He has borrowed twice from the Agsu division of Normicro. The first time he borrowed $200 and used that money to purchase equipment. This time he has borrowed $500 to purchase additional goods.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нуриев Джавид , 1974 года рождения. Родилься и проживает В городе Аксу. Холость, но скоро жениться. Джавид уже более десяти лет занимаетсья торговли. Он уже второй раз взял кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Первый раз 200$. На эти деньги купил оборудования. Второй раз 500$ чтобы купить побольше товаров.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Cara Eduardo

texts.pt:
Clara Eduardo M. is 37 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She lives in the neighborhood of George Dimitrov in Maputo and has a business selling coal out of her home. She became a member of the group in 2004 with an initial loan for 960MT. She is in the 7th loan cycle and wants to take out an additonal loan for 7,000MT to be repaid within 5 months. She intends to apply the funds to increase stock in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Clara Eduardo M. tem 37 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro George Dimitrov em Maputo e tem o negócio de venda de carvão em casa.Começou como membro do grupo Cinco em 2004 com um empréstimo de 960MT.Está no 7º ciclo e vai tomar um empréstimo de 7.000MT pagável em 5 meses.O valor pretende aplicar no negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Aqadur

texts.ru:
Agadur A., was born in 1979 in Agsu. He is a family man and has 2 children. In 2002 Agadur opened his meat selling business. He purchased a small business location and equipped it. He did not have enough resources to repair the place of business. Agadur turned to the Agsu division of Normicro, borrowed $500 and made small repairs. Now he plans on expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллаев Агадур. Родилься 1979 году в городе Аксу. Семейный, имеет двоих детей. 2000 году открыл свой бизнес по торговли мясо. Купил маленкую точку и оборудовал. Не было средство чтобы отремонтировать свою точку. Агадур обратилсья в Нормикро Аксуниский филиал. Взял кредит на сумму 500$ и сделал небольщой ремонт. Теперь он хочеть расширять свой бизнес.

loans.use: To repair his shop

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Rustam S., 25, is married and has no children. Rustam owns a trading spot where he sells SIM cards and ring tones, makes copies and computer scans, etc. Rustam has been in business for more than a year. To expand the portfolio of his services, Rustam wants to add another computer to his business. He will use this loan to purchase the computer and buy SIM cards for the rest of the money. Rustam plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипов Рустам, возраст – 25 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, детей не имеет. Рустам имеет торговую точку по продаже сим-карт, а также клиент оказывает услуги по записи мелодий для мобильных телефонов и услуги ксерокопии, сканирования и т.д. Этим бизнесом занимается уже в течение 1 года. На сеголняшний день клиент имеет один компьютер, который не позволяет ему обслуживать большое количество клиентов, поэтому клиент на полученную сумму кредита хочет приобрести дополнительно ещё один компьютер, который он будет использовать для записи мелодий на мобильные телефоны, а второй компьютер будет использовать для пополения баланса мобильных телефонов и других компьютерных услуг, на оставшуюся сумму кредита приобретёт сим-карты для мобильных телефонов. Владельцы сотовых телефонов получат возможность производить пополнение баланса своих мобильных телефонов, а желающие смогут приобрести для себя сим-карты. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase computer and SIM cards

loans.name: Latifa

texts.ru:
Latifa H. was born in 1959 in Agsu. She has a family with 3 children. She has been a pharmacist for over 20 years. After the breakup of the USSR she opened her own business and has been active in this sphere. Latifa needed new inventory and she turned to the Agsu division of Normicro. She borrowed $500 and purchased the necessary inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнова Латифа, родилась 1959 году в городе Аксу. Семейная , имеет троих детей . Уже более двадцати лет она работает аптекарем. После падения союза она открыла свой бизнес. Активно занимаетсья в этой сфере. Латифе нужна было новый инвентарь и она обратилась В Нормикро Аксуниский филиал. Взяла кредит 500$ и купила необходимый инвентарь.

loans.use: For purchase of inventory

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie owns a car services workshop.  He washes, sells and changes the oil of cars.  He is a 36 year old man who lives in Ferzol (Bekaa) with his wife. Elie plans to restore his house.  He therefore needs to generate more revenues from his business. He intends to purchase new tools and merchandise to offer more services to his clients. Elie and his wife are very happy about the idea of renovating their home.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and merchandise for his car services workshop

loans.name: Patricia Jann

texts.en: Patricia is 18 years old and is member of the group called Mujeres Inmigrantes de San Cristobal.  Very smart and disciplined, she learned to sew at the age of 14.  She makes pants, shirts, skirts, and baby’s clothes.  She sells her products in her house and in the school to the teachers and her schoolmates.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of raw materials in order to continue with the fabrication of clothes.  With profit earned from her business, she pays her school fees and helps her father bear the expenses of the family, since her mother is currently jobless.  Her father is a farmer, and money obtained from Patricia’s activity is the second source of income of the family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as buttons, cloth and zippers to continue producing clothes for her business

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Mrs. Dupe O. is 37 years old and lives in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 2 children and has been a LAPO client for 3 years. She learned sewing for 3 years before she opened her own business in 1997.  She sales clothes and tailoring material.  Dupe hopes to receive a loan $400 so that she can buy more clothes, an over locking machine, tailoring material and an additional machine.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring material

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali sells paint in the region of El Ain in Bekaa. He is a 52 year old married man with 2 children. Ali is at a turning point in his career where he needs to enhance his business. He wants to offer a larger variety of paint, brands, colors etc. to his clients. Ali is an entrepreneur who always seeks improvement.
This is the third time Ali has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He has a good history of on-time repayments.

loans.use: Buy paint containers for his business

loans.name: Eucharia

texts.en: A. Eucharia is an experienced businesswoman. She has a shop were she sells provisions, drinks and foodstuff. This is a trade she learned from her mother. She has been in this business since 1994 and has been a LAPO member for 2 years. She wants to expand her business and order more provisions, drinks and foodstuff.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan for $400. She is 38 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Benin City.

loans.use: To buy more provision, drinks and foodstuff

loans.name: Odilus

texts.en: Odilus is 25 years old and is studying Informatics in a professional school.  She also is member of the group called Mujeres Inmigrantes de San Cristobal.  She’s single, with no child, and is living alone.  In the workgroup, she prepares pants and shirts for men.  With the loan requested, Odilus will buy raw materials such as cloth, sleeve buttons, zippers and thread to sew more pants and shirts in order to increase her sales volume.  She is finishing the last grade of secondary school right now and wants to go the university next year.  Given the loan, the entrepreneur will have sufficient money so that she can get ready to face that new chapter of her life (university study), that is a gate to wealth and success.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of sleeve buttons, zippers, thread, and cloth to sew pants and shirts for men

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy A. is 32 years old, single and lives with her mother in Benin City. Christy sells fruit e.g. apple, pineapple, orange and gala in the open air market. Christy intends to increase her stock and buy more fruit, for this purpose she is applying for a $250 loan. She has been in business since 1997 and has been a LAPO member for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina lives with her husband and her child in the region of Al Ain, in Bekaa. She is a tailor who offers her great services to her neighbors. Her earnings are used to help cover her household expenses. Her work and her financial contribution have enhanced her self esteem and her self confidence. Amina is very proud of her work. This is the 6th time that Amina has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. Having said this, Amina has an excellent history of on-time repayment.

loans.use: To buy material and accessories for her tailoring work

loans.name: Josefina Rincón

texts.en:
Josefina, 21, has newly joined the group called Mujeres Inmigrantes de San Cristobal. She’s living with her partner who works in a construction company. She sews baby clothes and clothes for girls. She works in the workgroup in the afternoon and sells her clothes on the week-ends in Santo Domingo, the capital.

After having dropped out of school for two years, Josefina wants to start over with her studies. Josefina is requesting a loan to purchase a large amount of raw materials so as to produce more and increase her sales volume. That way, she will be able to continue earning a living and set aside money so that she can go back to school next year.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to continue sewing baby clothes and clothes for girls

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Mrs. Deborah I. is 50 years old, married with 6 children and lives in Benin City.  She has been with LAPO for 3 years and has been running her fruit business since 1999.  She hopes to buy more fruit with the loan amount of $250.  She hopes to pay back the loan in eight months.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 42 years old, married with 4 children and lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She sells foodstuff and has been in this business since 1992. She has been a LAPO client for the past 2 years. She is requesting a $250 loan, which she will repay within 8 months.  She will be use to buy more foodstuff for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Mrs. Edith O. is 41 years old. She is married with one child and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fairly used clothing and break cakes and snacks for people living in her community. She learned catering for 3 years before she started her business in 1992. She has been a leader of her union. She is requesting a loan of $625, which will be use to purchase gently used clothing and catering material.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes & catering supplies

loans.name: Marie Antoinette

texts.en:
Marie, 42 years old, is married and mother of eleven children. Nine years ago, she gave birth to triplets. Marie has been living in the Dominican Republic for more than ten years. Like many Haitian women, she thinks that living in this country, she’ll have more chance to earn a living and support her large family.

Since her arrival in Santo Domingo, Marie started a very small business which has grown a lot. She sells women’s clothes, shoes, perfumes, deodorants and hand and body lotion. She buys the goods in Dajabon, a frontier province with Haiti where products can be obtained at very low prices. Till now, Marie has been selling her products at a public square. She wants to rent a small locale in the public market so that she can attract more clients and sell her products easily. With the loan she has requested, she will also buy more goods in order to continue satisfying the customers’ needs. Given the loan, the entrepreneur will increase her income and help her very large and needy family.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothes, shoes, perfumes and deodorants for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth Yesin is 46 years old and lives in Benin City.  She sells clothes, bags, shoes, cream and powder to people living in her community. She has been in this business since 1997 and a LAPO client for 4 years. She is married with 5 children. Mrs. Ruth hopes to receive $625 for purchase of clothes, shoes, bags, cream and powder for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags cream & powder for re-sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy A. is an experiences businesswoman. She has been in business for 6 years and with LAPO for 3 years. She has a fashion shop where she sows and sells clothes. This is a trade she learned for 3 years. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more clothes for re-sale. She is 38 years old, married with 5 children and lives in Benin City.

loans.use: To buy more clothes & tailoring material

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica G. is 43 years old. She is married and has three children and lives in the Kibera slums. Monica also takes care of her nephew from Meru since the harsh conditions back in the rural part of the country he is from do not allow him to get a stable job.

Monica’s motivation to involve herself in the business of spinning wool was influenced by her mother who was an expert in that trade. Monica then decided to learn more and went through two months of training from her neighbor whom her mother had employed. Her mother could not train her since she was always busy delivering orders from clients. 

Having been equipped with the necessary skills, Monica decided to start her own business in the year 1993. This was after she got married and the business helped in sustaining her family since at this time, she was living with her mother-in –law, who also helped her to buy a spinning machine for her business. She struggled to bring up her business until she was able to save Ksh 3,000.00 (USD 45) with which she added an electric machine to her business, to help with the spinning, since it could do the work faster. G. goes to Nakuru once every month, and buys wool weighing 150-200kgs. She has so far been able to employ three workers who help in combing the wool after which Monica spins it into thread ready for sale. She sells the thread in different areas because she has customers as far as Ongata Rongai, Kikuyu and Limuru (regions within the country). She usually combs about 7kgs of wool per week. Her mother-in-law is now very grateful because Monica is able to supporting her.

Monica is requesting for a loan of USD 325 to enable her to purchase a large stock of wool. The loan will help raise the capital for her business hence the business will expand. This will in the long run raise her family income thus will be able to meet all the family needs. The loan repayment period is 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase wool for spinning

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. S. Rosemary is 50 years old, married with 6 children.   She sells beans and necklaces and also sells phone recharge cards. She has been in this business since 2004 and with LAPO for 2 years. She lives in Benin and needs $400 to buy more beans and recharge cards for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more beans and recharge card

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred Nzuki is 32 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in Kitengela Township on the outskirts of the city of Nairobi. Besides offering computer services, Winfred does voluntary work within her community by visiting institutions that care for orphaned and vulnerable children, especially those that have been affected by HIV/IADS. 

Winfred went through training in typing at the Salvation Army, a church sponsored institution that offers technical skills. Winfred had saved Ksh 20,000 USD 294 from her previous employment and together with Ksh 10,000 (USD 150), which her husband added Winfred was able to set up her business in 2003. 

Winfred offers a wide range of computer services such as typing and scanning. She also offers photocopying services. Winfred wants to expand her business by offering Internet services. She is therefore requesting for a loan of USD 1075, which will be given in kind, to enable her to purchase four computers and a wireless telephone set. This will result in better services for her clients whom she believe are going to increase in number. Her ultimate intention is to open a school where she can create employment becahse the EPZ, an exporting company that offered employment on a casual basis, has closed down and many young people who were employed there now have   nowhere to go. She also intends to start a cheap computer college. Winfred hopes to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase 4 computers and a wireless telephone

loans.name: Naima

texts.en: Naima owns a grocery store in the region of Al Ain, in Bekaa. She lives with her husband and her child. This is the fifth loan Naima has requested from Al Majmoua. Since the first loan we to provided her, she has proved to be a very dedicated, hard working, and honest woman who strives for the development of her grocery shop. She now needs to buy more products to display in her store. Naima is a much appreciated beneficiary who always faces her responsibilities.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria O., 47 is married with 6 children.  She lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria.  She learned the act of soap production for 10 years and started her business in 2002.  She manufactures and sell soap to people living in her community and neighbouring town.  She needs $400 to buy chemicals for manufacturing the soap. She has been with LAPO for the past 3 years as a secretary.

loans.use: To buy more chemical and others material needs for soap production

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha M. is married and has 5 children. She lives in Kariobangi South, an area characterized by informal settlements located within the Eastern part of Nairobi. Here, she sells vegetables and cereals to help provide for her family. She is a born-again Christian and a very committed member of her local church located within her neighborhood. She is the chairlady of the women’ fellowship in her local church where, besides giving spiritual nourishment, they empower women in the church economically. Her husband is involved in casual jobs from which he gets little wages. 

In order to supplement the family income, Tabitha started her business by selling vegetables in small quantities way back in 1997. Previously, she would knit cardigans and sell them at Ksh 500 and this is how she was able to make savings to start off her vegetable and cereal business. With time, she made considerable progress and moved from selling the vegetables from the ground where she arranged them, to constructing a kiosk, from where she now sells her products. Apart from the vegetables that she sold, Tabitha also introduced a range of cereals. However, due to the limited capital she has, she only manages to buy in measures of quarter sacks, and these only last for about two days, after which she has to buy additional stock. 

Tabitha now wants to take her business a notch higher and therefore wants to purchase the cereals in full sacks. This will increase her profit and will enable her to retain her customers who sometimes come to buy cereals but  find them out of stock. She is requesting for a loan of USD 400, which will be given in kind, to purchase the stock of cereals, including beans, peas and rice. The loan repayment period will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchased assorted cereals including  beans, peas and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on his inventry.

loans.name: Catherine Joyce

texts.en:
Catherine Wanjiru is 33 years old and is married with two children. She takes care of her nephew aged 20 who is attending the Kenya Polytechnic, a technical college located in the town centre of Nairobi, and her ageing mother who stays in their rural home in Central part of Kenya. Catherine lives in Kitengela Township.

Catherine started her business in the year 2000.This was after her elder brother loaned her Ksh. 20,000 (USD 295). She used part of the money to rent a small room for Ksh 300 (USD 4) per month. The business grew very well and she managed even to educate her younger brother and sister up to college level. As the business grew, she landed a contract in the year 2004 to run the police canteen at a place known as Kamukunji, where she has been operating to date.

The business has been very good and Catherine now wants to increase her stock for the business. She has approached three of the leading Micro finance banks in Kenya but she found that the interest rate they charge is too high; hence she felt that she couldn’t afford the loans. Catherine therefore thought it wise to come and try her luck with KIVA, hence she approached ANK for support. She is kindly requesting for a loan of USD 1200 to enable her to purchase an assortment of stock for her retail shop which serves the police within the Kamukunji Police Station. Some of the items she intends to purchase include:  Sugar, cleaning detergents, cereals like maize, rice and beans. She also wants to buy maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking fat. Apart from the foodstuff, she would also like to introduce a range of cosmetics, which her customers have been asking for. She is confident that the additional stock will enable her to provide her clients with a wide range of assorted goods, which will be a welcome move. This will in turn translate into more income for her family. She intends to repay the loan over a period of 12 Months.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a general shop  including - Sugar, cleaning detergents, cereals and cosmetics

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en: Natasha is a hard-working young entrepreneur from Mukachevo, Ukraine. Not only is she busy working in her food sales business, she has also been making preparations to get married coming up on Oct. 27th. Natasha has had her own business for the past seven years. She sells a variety of dry food goods from a little stall at the busy Green market in Mukachevo. This has been a good business for Natasha to be in. Her products are always in demand and a high sales rate brings in good income. Natasha typically makes around $600 profit per month. She has requested a loan of $500 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase more food inventories. We are happy for this opportunity to help Natasha with her business at this exciting time in her life.

loans.use: Natasha would like to increase her inventory for her dry food goods business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix seats to his Matatu Van.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on his stock.

loans.name: Felisberto António

texts.pt:
Felisberto António V. is married and a father of 5 children. He has a bar, with a small store and a celular telephone available for public use. He entered the program in June 2006 with an initial loan for 3,000MT. He never missed a repayment. His client base grew considerably compared to when his business was first evaluated at the beginning of the program: he increased his stock volume and expanded his business by purchasing cellular phones for public use. He is now in his 4th loan cycle and wants to take out 16,000MT to be repaid within 8 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Felisberto António V. vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos. Tem uma barraca, uma mini-mercearia e telefone celular público. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 3.000MT. Nunca teve falhas nos reembolsos. O cliente evoluíu consideravelmente no negócio se tomarmos como ponto de referência o estado do mesmo aquando da 1ª avaliação: aumentou o volume do stock e expandiu comprando telefones celulares públicos. Vai para o 4º ciclo e vai Tomar 16.000MT pagável em 8 meses.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en: Mariya is a widow from Mukachevo, Ukraine. She supports herself entirely from her small business selling fresh fruits and vegetables, juice, canned goods, and other food items. Mariya is a thoughtful, kind-hearted entrepreneur. She treats her customers well and is an example of good service. Mariya has one son who is married and has a family but is disabled. Mariya works hard not only to provide for herself, but also so that she can help her family as well. Mariya has requested a loan of $300 to boost her available capital and buy new food inventories. Nadiya Ukraine is happy for this opportunity to help Mariya as she works to make a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Mariya would like to increase the inventory for her small grocery business.

loans.name: Klara

texts.en: Klara runs a cosmetics sales business from a little space at the Univermag store in Vinogradov, Ukraine. In business for about five years, she sells about $1800 worth of products and makes around $250-$300 per month. She has been able to secure a very good location for her business and tries to maintain a broad assortment of quality cosmetic and personal care items to sell. She has requested a loan of $500 to increase her working capital and allow her to purchase additional inventory.

loans.use: Klara would like to increase the inventory for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Vesta Da Conceição

texts.pt:
Vesta da ConceiçãoN. is 45 years old, divorced and a mother of two children. She lives in the neighborhood of Malhangalene in Maputo and works for LAM. She started in the program in April of 2007 with a loan for 10,000MT which she repaid without any problem. She wants to take out another loan for 30,000MT to increase her capital savings and to purchase equipment for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Vesta da ConceiçãoN. tem 45 anos de idade, é divorciada e mãe de dois filhos. Vive no bairro da Malhangalene em Maputo e é trabalhadora da LAM.Entrou para o programa em Abril de 2007 com um empréstimo de 10.000MT e pagou sem quaisquer problemas. Pretende tomar 30.000MT para aumentar com sua poupança e aplicar na compra de uma viatura.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is a sharp business owner from the city of Vinogradov in western Ukraine. For more than eight years, she has run a successful business selling kitchenware – dishes, pots, and pans. Galina loves what she sells and is dedicated to the success of her venture. By wisely using capital from loans received through Nadiya Ukraine, she has been able to expand her business and increase her income. Her future goals include growing her business further and expanding the assortment of products she has available. Galina has requested a new loan of $500 to add to her working capital, allowing her to purchase new inventory and continue focusing on improving her business.

loans.use: Galina would like to increase the inventory for her kitchenware business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a car electrician. His workshop is in Al Ain, in the Bekaa. He is a young entrepreneur of 23 years old. He is striving to be a self made man. Hussein is known by his clients as a good car electrician. They usually come from the surrounding neighborhoods. Hussein needs to buy material for his business. He is planning to grow steadily and progressively. This is the first time that Hussein requests a loan from Al Majmoua. He heard about the Institution by word of mouth.

loans.use: Purchase material for his business of car electrician

loans.name: Merciana Clara Salom

texts.pt:
Merciana N. is 48 years old, single and a mother of 5 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Patrice Lumumba in Maputo. She has a stall in the Patrice Lumumba market where she sells various basic food products. She entered the program in April of 2007 with an initial loan for 6,000MT. She wants to take out another loan for 12,000MT to be repaid within 6 months to purchase additional merchandise for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Merciana N. tem 48 anos de idade, é solteira , mãe de 5 filhos e vive no bairro Patrice Lumumba em Maputo.Tem uma barraca no mercado Patrice Lumumba onde vende diversos produtos de 1ª necessidade.Entrou para o programa em Abril de 2007 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT.Vai tomar um empréstimo de 12.000MT pagável em 6 meses para compra de mercadoria para o negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase seats for cafe.

loans.name: Ali Mahmoud

texts.en: Ali is a 42 year old car mechanic. He lives with his wife and their 3 children in the Bekaa. The business expansion is a priority to Hussein because he wants to protect his family from any financial needs they may come across. He is very confident in the potential of his business. This is the 4th loan Hussein is taking from Al Majmoua and he has always been very reliable especially with the faith he carries in his business development.

loans.use: Buy new material for his car mechanics workshop

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria C. is 52 years old, married with 7 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Magoanine in Maputo. She sells basic produce out of her home. She started with the program in March of this year with her first loan for 5,000MT. She is going to take out another loan for 5,000MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Maria C. tem 52 anos de idade, é casada e tem 7 filhos. Vive no bairro Magoanine em Maputo. Vende produtos de 1ª necessidade na sua residência. Entrou para o programa em Março do presente ano com 5.000MT no 1º empréstimo. Vai tomar novamente 5.000MT para pargar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel C. is Mrs. Rosalina Simbine's partner, a member of the Vonkala group. Rosalina Simbine was a member of the Mondlane group but she encountered a few problems there. She then left that group and formed a new group. She now sells bags of charcoal and Mrs. Isabel sells a variety of goods such as: beverages, eggs, yogurt, cookies, etc. These products are purchased in Swaziland and are delivered to the Estrela de Maputo market.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Isabel C. é a par da senhora Rosalina Simbine membro do grupo Vonakala.Rosalina Simbine era membro do grupo Mondlane e este teve problemas, daí que ela saíu do mesmo e formou novo grupo.Ela vende Carvão em sacos e a senhora Isabel C. vende diversos produtos tais como bebidas, ovos, Yogurtes, biscoitos, etc., que compra na Swazilândia e parte faz entregas no mercado Estrela em Maputo.

loans.use: Stock Increase.

loans.name: Nhelete Lisboa

texts.pt:
Nhelete Lisboa M., was born on 29of April 1958 in Magude a province of Maputo. She is 49 years old, married and mother of 2. She was raised by her parents in Chokwe. She moved to Maputo to work in the Scala radio. After the radio station closed she started working at a stand selling groceries to support her family. She has been working with fishing for 4 years. She has one employee.

With the loan of 10.000MT Nhelete plans on buying new fishing nets. She also wants to fix the fishing boat and to purchase a motor in the future. Her business is doing well and the income is of 1.000MT a month. The loans have been helpful and Nhelete now fishes for a variety of fish including lobsters. She is very enthusiastic about her work.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, KIVA volunteer.

Localização: Zona 5, Catembe-Ma Cliente: Nhelete Lisboa M. Actividade:Pesca Valor de empréstimo: 10.000,00 MT (400.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de redes para pesca Início: 10/10/07 Fim: 31/03/09 Nhelete Lisboa M., nasceu aos 29 de Abril de 1958 em Magude província de Maputo, tem 49 anos de idade, casada maritalmente tem 2 filhos estudou até 8ª classe. Viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais em chokwé, estudava e nos tempos livres ajudava a mãe nos trabalhos da machamba e quando casa-se transfere-se á Maputo e trabalha na Rádio Scala, só que anos mais tarde veio a fechar e como alternativa imediata teve que arranjar uma banca para venda de produtos alimentares no seu quintal como forma de sustento familiar sabido que ela é família de baixa renda. Actualmente faz trabalhos de pesca e machamba e faz a 4 anos, não tendo qualquer formação na área. Emprega um trabalhador e este não tem filhos. Com crédito de 10.000MT pretende comprar e formar novas redes para melhorar o nível de captura. A faína começa bem cedo dependendo do nível do mar, todavia as 7:00 horas inicia a actividade e termina as 13:00 horas e para o local de trabalho desloca-se a pé.

O material de trabalho tem adquirido em Maputo e usa o transporte colectivo de passageiros. Salienta que no verão é período favorável para trabalhar e no meio da semana visto que aos fins de semana dedicam-se ao descanso e Igreja, todavia há constragimentos devido a falta de meios de refrigeração quando a produçao é maior. A Receita média diária é de 250 MT e o produto que dá mais lucro é a Lagosta e possui um livro de registo da captura e entrega ou venda aos revendedores. Existem alguns problemas derivados do barco que está precisando duma reabilitação e também a falta de motor que não permite ir a milhas mais distantes, contudo o estágio da actividae é razoável e a margem de lucro mensal é de 1.000MT, com os rendimentos da actividade usa-os para sustento familiar e poupar algum dinheiro para momentos de crise. No futuro almeja reabilitar o barco e formar outro e ter pelo menos um motor e assim que terminar o presente empréstimo fará outro por forma a dar continuidade ao projecto. O actual empréstimo melhorou substancialmente a actividade porque conseguiu formar novas redes para captura de diverso tipo de peixe e lagosta e está bastante entusiasmada com o trabalho.

loans.use: To buy nets

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: George lives with his wife and his 2 children in the Bekaa. This is the fifth time he is borrowing a loan from Al Majmoua. George sells beauty products and has built an important client network at only 36 years old. He is always striving to innovate his business, diversify his products and is looking for continuous development. He wishes to buy enough merchandise to answer to the needs of his clients in terms of variety and quantity.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for his business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Location: CaT.-Maputo
Client: Lidia T.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 20,100 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 804)
Loan use: Purchase clothing for resale
Start date: 10/08/2007
End date: 01/30/2008

Lidia T., a widow, was born in Maputo on December 16, 1962. She is the daughter of a church pastor father and a dressmaker mother. She spent her childhood in South Africa where her parents lived at the time. She attended school until the 6th grade and got her first job as a servant at the Johannesburg airport (Captain Park), where she worked for 7 years. Later she worked at a detergent factory in the same city. She then left that job when she was able to save enough money to invest in the business of buying and reselling electric appliances.

After marrying, she moved permanently to Mozambique and continued with the business. With the profits she built her own home, which has a 7-room rental annex and a mini-mart.
