Through a church brother she became aware of Hluvuku where she obtained a loan of 20,100 MT to acquire various electric appliances and decorating products for resale. Her future plans include purchasing a mode of transportation, preferably a truck to facilitate the transport of her merchandise and minimize her costs. This would allow her to set more accessible prices and increase revenue by providing transportation services to her business colleagues.

The project has had a positive impact on the community in addition to allowing her to support the 11 people under her care and create 2 jobs.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: CaT.-Maputo Cliente: Lidia T. Actividade: Comércio Valor do Empréstimo: 20.100,00MT (804.00US$) Aplicação do valor : Compra de electrodomesticos para revenda Início: 08/10/2007 Fim: 30/01/2008 Lidia T. viuva, nascida em Maputo, aos 16 de Dezembro de 1962, filha de pai Pastor da Igreija e mãe modista, passou a sua infancia na Africa do Sul onde os seus pais estiveram radicados. Estudou até 6ª clase e teve o seu primeiro emprego como servente no Aeroporto (CAPTIN PARK) em Johanesburg durante 7 anos e mais tarde trabalhou numa fabrica de detergrntes na mesma cidade onde veio a deixar logo que obteve rendimento suficiente para investir no negócio de compra e revenda de electrodomésticos. Depois de casar veio viver definitivamente em Moçambique e continuou com seu negócio e com o rendimento construiu a sua residência que tem como anexo 7 quartos para aluguer e uma mini – mercearia. Atraves de um irmão da igreja veio a conhecer a Hluvuku onde recorrendo a um emprestimo de 20.100,00MT (Vinte Mil e Cem Meticais) para adquirir vários electrodomésticos e produtos de decoração para revenda. Como perspectiva pretende adquirir uma viatura de preferência Camioneta para facilitar o transporte das suas mercadorias minimizando assim os custos de transporte de modo a colocar o seu produto a preço mais acessível e rentabilizar atravês de fretes para colegas de trabalho. O projecto tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois para alem de permitir o sostento de 11 pessoas que estão na sua responsabilidade, garante 2 postos de trabalho.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
Location: Chali neighborhood – CaT.-Maputo
Client: Laura T.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 10,000.00 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 400)
Use: Purchase essential products
Start date: 10/06/07
End date: 03/27/09

Laura T. is 32 years of age and was born in the city of Maputo on February 21, 1975. She attended school until completing the 6th grade. She cares for 2 children and lives with 3 other people. She is married. She grew up with her parents and siblings, and like most rural families they were quite poor. Thus she was forced to spend her free time helping her mother with the housework and farming. She later married and needed to start a small business out of her backyard in order to help her husband cover some of the household expenses.

Currently, besides selling food products, she performs agriculture work, depending on the season and frequency of rain. She has been in business for over 17 years now, without formal training and operating on her own - in her absence, her children take on the responsibility. With the loan of 10,000 meticais she plans to buy rice, sugar, corn starch, oil and other products. Since she operates out of her backyard, she is easily able to open at 7:30 a.m. and close at 6:30 p.m. She purchases products in Maputo and uses public transportation. The winter season and weekends are the best in terms of profitability. Her average daily revenue is 1,200 MT, sugar being the most lucrative product.

The greatest difficulties she faces are the fluctuations in the prices of products and transporting them from the place of purchase to her home. The business is doing well, with a profit margin of 2,000 MT, allowing her to support the family and improve her home. In the future, she aspires to build a grocery store with conventional materials and diversify her product range. She will need a loan in order to move forward with the project. She feels quite fulfilled as every year her sales volume continues to grow.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chali, CaT.-Maputo Cliente: Laura T. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 10.000,00 MT (400.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade Início: 06/10/07 Fim: 27/03/09 Laura T., tem 32 anos de idade, nasceu na Cidade de Maputo aos 21 de Fevereiro de 1975, concluiu a 6ªclasse, sustenta 2 filhos e vive com 3 pessoas é casada maritalmente. Viveu com os pais e irmãos e como a maioria das famílias rurais eram bastante carrenciadas o que obrigava que nos tempos livres ajudasse a mãe nos afazeres domésticos e da machamba e mais tarde veio a casar-se e teve que começar um pequeno negócio no seu quintal como forma de aliviar o marido em algumas despesas domésticas. Actualmente para além de venda de produtos alimentares dedica-se a trabalhos agrícolas dependendo da época e frequência da chuva. A mais de 17 anos que vem fazendo este negócio e não tem nenhuma formação e faz o negócio pessoalmente e na ausência, os filhos é que tomam responsabilidade. Com o empréstimo de 10.000MT pretende comprar arroz,açúcar, farrinha de milho, óleo e outros produtos. Dado que exerce a actividade no quintal abre ligeiramente cedo as 7:30 e encerra as 18:30mn e adquire a mercadoria em Maputo e usa o transportae colectivo de passageiros e período de Inverno e fins de semana são os melhores em termos de rentabilidade e consegue uma receita média de 1.200MT, sendo que o açúcar é que dá mais lucro. As dificuldades que tem enfrentado é de oscilações nos preços dos produtos e transporte dos mesmos do local da compra á barraca. O negócio está num bom nível, e a margem de lucro é de 2.000MT e os proveitos desta actividade usa para sustento familiar e no melhoramento da sua residencia. No futuro aspira construir uma mercearia com material convencional e diversificar com outra gama de produtos e vai precisar de crédito para dar continuidade ao projecto. Sente-se bastante realizada porque cada ano vai melhorando o volume do negócio.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Jossefa Alberto

texts.pt:
Jossefa Alberto M. was born in Incassane-Catembe on June 4, 1980. She is 27 years old, she has finished 7th grade and she lives with and supports 5 people. She is married. She used to live with her parents and siblings and go to school. In her free time she helped her mother with fishing work. The family did without basic necessities due to lack of fishing nets which were constantly destroyed. So she pursued a new source of income selling food from her home.

She began fishing 10 years ago, without any formal training. She employs 2 people, one of whom has children. She intends to buy nets with the loan of 13,000 MT [meticals, the currency of Mozambique]. Her workday begins very early in the morning, depending on the tide, around 3 am and ends at 6pm. She buys nets and equipment in Maputo and brings them home on public transport. Winter is the most productive season with the best catches, and the product doesn't deteriorate as quickly. Her average daily sale is 1,000 MT, with shrimp being the most lucrative catch.

Her biggest challenge is the systematic destruction of nets due to ships and boats, which means the nets don't last as long as one would hope and which affect the size catch and the cost of materials. With her profits, she pays salaries, supports her family and continues with the construction of her home. In the future, she hopes to build a boat, but it will depend on her productivity, as it will only begin after she pays back this loan first. She is happy with her work flow, which has improved since she was able to buy more nets with the last loan.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Jossefa Alberto M., nasceu no bairro Incassane-Catembe aos 04 de Junho de 1980, tem actualmente 27 anos, concluiu a 7ª classe, sustenta 5 pessoas e vive com igual número de pessoas e é casada maritalmente. Viveu num ambiente familiar com os pais e irmãos e frequentava a escola e nos tempos livres ajudava a mãe nos trabalhos agrícolas e que passou necessidades comuns da época, por falta de materiais(redes) de trabalho que constantemente se destroem e por isso criou outra fonte de rendimento de venda de produtos alimentares no seu quintal.

Desenvove a actividade de pesca a sensivelmente 10 anos e não tem nenhuma formação na área. Emprega actualmente 2 empregados dos quais 1 tem 2 filhos e outro não. Com o empréstimo de 13.000MT pretende comprar redes. O período de trabalho inicia bastante cedo dependendo do nível da água, assim as 3 horas da manhã e termina as 18 horas. As redes e acessórios compra-os em Maputo e leva-os no transporte colectivo . A época mais produtiva é a de Inverno onde a captura é maior e os produtos não se deterioram com facilidade. A receita média diária é de 1.000MT e o que dá mais lucro é o camarão e faz o registo só no acto da entrega do produto.

A dificuldade que enfrenta é destruição sistemática das redes por destroços de navios e barcos que leva com que as redes não durem o desejável e acaba afectando o nível de captura e avultados investimentos nos mesmos materiais. Com os rendimentos da pesca paga salários, sustento familiar e continuar com a construção da casa. A perspectiva futura é fazer outro barco e para o efeito vai depender do nível de produção e produtividade que for alcançar, todavia assim que terminar o actual crédito vai fazer o balanço. Está feliz com o nível de trabalho pois com o empréstimo melhorou os materiais (redes) de trabalho.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

payments.comment:
Jossefa has successfully paid back this loan in advance, as intended. She will soon raise a new loan to keep helping her business grow. 

She would like to personally thank Kiva and all her lenders for the support given to her family and her business.

loans.name: Felismina Zefanias

texts.pt:
Felismina Zefanisa M. was born in Maputo on January 22, 1982. Her father was a public servant and her mother a businesswoman. She was raised by her parents and studied until 5th grade in Guachene - Catembe, after which she began to help her mother with seafood sales to ease some of the difficulty of paying for school, and above all, of providing food for the family.

In 1997, at just 15 years of age, she had her first child, when she was still living with her parents. At that point she began investing fully in the seafood business, as it was something that she knew how to do well and continues to do today. She continued in her business despite low earnings, until 2006 when a friend told her about Hluvuku. She obtained a loan for 4000 MT [meticals, the currency of Mozambique] and used it to buy a freezer to store her products. Her second loan of 7000 MT brought more volume and clients to her business. With this loan of 10,000MT, she hopes to increase volume even further, with the aim of providing regular and timely seafood sales for a steadily increasing client demand.

This project has a positive impact on the community, since it guarantees a a seafood supply in the local Maputo market, and her earnings allow her to suppor her 3 children and 5 employees.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Felismina Zefanisa M., nasceu em Maputo – Catembe, aos 22 de Janeiro de 1982, filha de pai Funcionário Público e mãe negociante.cresceu com os pais, tendo estudado até 5ª classe na EP1 de Guachene - Catembe altura em que começou a ajudar a mãe na comercialização de mariscos de modo a minimizar as dificuldades que enfrentava para estudar e sobretudo para alimentar-se.

Em 1997 com apenas 15 anos ficou gravida e veio a ter o seu primeiro filho vivendo ainda com os pais, motivo que lhe fez investir os escassos recursos que a mãe lhe dava no negocio de mariscos como a actividade que melhor sabia fazer e que continua fazendo até então. Continuou com o seu negócio movimentando poucos valores até 2006 quando atraves de uma amiga veio a conhecer a HLUVUKU, onde recorrendo a um emprestimo de 4.000,mt reforçou o seu negócio e com o rendimento conseguiu comprar um congelador para conservar os seus produtos. Recorrendo a um 2º emprestimo de 7.000,00mt aumentou o volume do deu negócio e o numero de clientes. Com o ultimo valor de 10.000,00mt pretende aumentar ainda mais o volume do seu negócio e tem como perspectiva assegurar o fornecimento regular e atempado de mariscos aos seus clientes cuja demanda tende a aumentar.

O projecto tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois para além de garantir o abastecimento em mariscos no mercado local e cidade de Maputo, o rendimento permite-lhe o sustento de seus 3 filhos e conta com 5 pessoas na sua responsabilidade.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S. is 32 years old and married with two children.  He sells watches, small radios, and calculators in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  He could not continue with his education as his parents could not afford the school financial requirements.  His previous loan increased his income and has enabled him to meet his children’s school fee requirements.  Ibrahim needs more loan capital to expand his business.  He successfully met his loan obligations with SMT.

loans.use: Expand his electronics business to attract new customers.

loans.name: Ernesto Antonio

texts.pt:
Ernesto António T. was born in Maputo on December 13, 1977. Due to the financial situation of his parents, he abandoned his studies and began to work at 14 years of age. He began as a walking merchant selling various goods. Later, he was influenced by some photographers that he met at that time and decided to become a photographer. But he didn't have a camera nor money to buy one, so at age 19 he went to South Africa with the idea of getting a job there to save money for a camera. But he couldn't find work there, so he began working again as a walking merchant in South Africa. After 2 years, he was able to buy a camera and returned to Mozambique where he continued as a merchant while learning how to use his camera. Eighteen months later, he began work as a photographer, and at age 23, married his wife, with whom he has a 2 year old son. His wife tends to their mini market stand while he works in photography.

This loan will have a positive impact on his business because it will increase the volume of products he can offer and will allow him to buy another camera without having to go to South Africa for work. In the future he hopes to have his own photo studio.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernesto António T. , nasceu em Maputo aos 13 de dezembro de 1977 onde, devido a debilidade financeira dos seus progenitores foi obrigado a abandonar os estudos e iniciar o negócio com 14 anos. Iniciou como vendedor ambulante onde vendia vários artigos. Algum tempo depois ocorreu lhe a ideia de ser fotográfo influenciado por alguns Fotógrafos que ele conheceu naquela época . Mas , porque não tinha máquina e ném dinheiro para a comprar , teve que partir á África do sul já com 19 anos na perspectiva de encontrar um emprego que lhe podesse garantir o o dinheiro para a compra da máquina fotográfica. Não tendo conseguido o emprego, teve que começar o negócio em regime anbulatório ainda na África do sul. Dois anos depois consegue comprar a máquina e volta Moçambique onde veio continuar com o seu negócio de venda de vários artigos ao mesmo tempo que recebia instruções sobre o uso da máquina fotográfica . Dezoito meses depois inicia o trabalho fotográfico, aos 23 anos junta-se com a sua esposa com a qual tem um filho de dois anos. Quando estiver a trabalhar nas fotografias a esposa é que cuida do negócio do mini mercearia.

O valor de empréstimo teve um impacto positivo no seu negócio uma vez que aumentou o volume dos produtos e comprou mais uma máquina fotográfica sem precisar de ir trabalhar na África do sul. Futuramente pretende obter um estúdio fotográfico e uma cabelaria.

loans.use: To increase stock in his business.

loans.name: Elisabete

texts.pt:
Location: Chali neighborhood – Catembe-Maputo
Client: Elisabete P.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 20,000.00 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 800)
Use: Purchase essential products
Start date: 10/08/07
End date: 01/30/09

Elisabete Paço, 36 years of age, was born in Filipe-Catembe on January 15, 1971. She is married and attended school until the 4th grade. She supports five people and lives with 4. She lived the greater part of her childhood with her mother and attended school at the Chiango Educational Center. In her free time, she would help her mother chop wood for resale. In 1990, she married and moved to the Costa do Sol neighborhood, later migrating to Filipe, Matutuine district. Together with her husband she entered the retail business and also performed some agricultural work. Due to difficulties with her children’s schooling, she decided to move to Catembe where she currently lives.

She operates her retail business from her backyard and has been active for 20 years. Her husband is trained in business administration. They have no employees as they are able to run the business themselves without assistance. With the current loan of 20,000 MT she plans to purchase rice, sugar and corn starch in 50 and 25 kg bags, respectively, as well as other grocery products. The store's opening hours are from 6:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. She purchases goods in Maputo and rents a car to transport them. The business does not enjoy any peak periods; however, during weekends demand is higher. Her daily revenue is 3,000 MT. The most lucrative products are rice, sugar and oil. She keeps a log where she records receipts and sales as well existing stock. Her main constraint is the lack of transportation and conventional installations.

Her monthly profit margin is 12,000 MT, which she uses to support the family, improve the shop and put her kids through school. In the future, she plans to build a conventional store, own a form of transportation and if possible set up a hardware store. This may require an additional loan once the current one has been repaid. The client is very happy with the loan as it has helped her increase her sales volume and diversify her product range.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chali, Catembe-Maputo Cliente: Elisabete P. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 20.000,00 MT (800.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Início: 08/10/07 Fim: 30/01/09 Elisabete Paço de 36 anos de idade, nasceu em Filipe-Catembe aos 15 de Janeiro de 1971, casada maritalmente, estudou até 4ªclasse, sustenta 5 pessoas e vive com apenas 4. Viveu grande parte de sua infância com a mãe e estudava no Centro educacional de Chiango e nos tempos livres ajudava a mãe no corte de lenha para posterior venda, assim em 1990 casa-se e passa a viver no bairro Costa do Sol e mais tarde emigram para Filipe – distrito de Matutuine e juntamenete com o marido abraçam o comércio a retalho e também fazia alguns trabalhos agrícolas. Devido a dificuldades na continuidade dos estudos das crianças decide mudar-se para Catembe onde vive actualmente. Excerce a actividade de comércio a retalho no seu quintal e desenvolve-a a 20 anos e o marido é que tem formação de Gestão comercial, não empregam nenhum trabalhador dado que eles mesmos é que gerem o negócio. Com o presente crédito de 20.000MT pretende comprar arroz,açúcar,farrinha de milho em sacos de 50 e 25 Kgs respectivamente e outros produtos de mercearia. A abertura da mercearia é as 6:30 e encerra as 18:30mn e compra-os em Maputo e para transportá-los aluga um carro. O negócio não tem épocas no entanto aos fins de semana a procura é maior, e receita diária é de 3.000MT, os produtos que dão maior lucro são Arroz, açúcar e Óleo .Tem um livro de registo de entradas e vendas de produtos bem como do stock existente. O maior constragimento é falta de transporte e falta de instalações convencionais. A margem de lucro mensal é de 12.000MT e com os rendimentos usa-os para sustento familiar, melhorar a mercearia e por as crianças a estudar. No futuro a perspectiva é construir uma loja convencional, ter transporte e se possível montar uma ferragem e para o efeito poderá preciasr de outro empréstimo assim que terminar o presente empréstimo. A cliente está bastante feliz com o empréstimo pois ajudou a aumentar o volume de negócio e diversificar ainda mais outros produtos.

loans.use: Increase stock in her business

payments.comment: Elisabete has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance in order to ask for a new loan and keep improving her business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled lives with his wife and his 4 children in the surroundings of Tyre, south of Lebanon. Khaled is a very courageous 39 years old man. His business has been robbed, but that incident did not stop him from starting his business again. He owns a butcher shop where he sells chickens. He needs a refrigerator in which he can stock the chickens for sale. This business is the sole source of income of his family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for his business

loans.name: Thaimu

texts.en: Thaimu is 28 years old and married with a child.  He has never had a formal education due to his parent’s poverty situation.  He started his business 10 years ago on a very small scale and it has not grown due to the lack of capital.  Thaimu’s previous loan increased his stock and income.  According to Thaimu, with his income, he is now able to take care of his family and his elderly parents.  He is requesting for more loans to expand his business.  He sells cosmetics in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.

loans.use: Expand his selection of cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Clara Carlos

texts.pt:
Location: Chali neighborhood – Catembe-Maputo
Client: Clara Carlos N.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 15,000 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 600)
Loan use: Purchase clothing for resale
Start date: 10/6/2007
End date: 1/28/2008

Clara Carlos N. was born in Maputo on July 14, 1979. She grew up without her father, since he and her mother separated when she was only 2 years old. She endured many difficulties due to her mother's inability to provide her and her brothers with basic necessities. This in turned sparked her entrepreneurial spirit - in 2005 she opened a clothing business, servicing several boutiques in the city and some clients in her neighborhood and nearby areas.

She is currently attending the 12th grade, supporting her studies via the business and taking care of five people. The amount of the loan will provide an impulse for her business by increasing her working capital and allowing her to meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she would like to set up a boutique where she can sell clothing and generate a higher revenue. She also plans on opening a beauty salon in her backyard.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chali, Catembe-Maputo Cliente: Clara Carlos N. Actividade:Comércio Valor do Empréstimo: 15,000.00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação do valor : Compra de Roupa para revenda Início:06/10/2007 Fim:28/01/2008 Clara Carlos N., nasceu em Maputo aos 14 de Julho de 1979, não teve o aconchego do pai uma vez que este se separou da sua Mãe quando ela tinha apenas dois anos. Viveu várias dificuldades uma vez que a mãe com a qual ficou a viver não tinha condições para lhe proporcionar uma vida com minimas condicoes junto com os irmãos, facto que lhe despertou o espírito de negócio em 2005. Iniciou o negócio de venda de roupa, negócio que desenvolve até então fornecendo algumas Boutiques da Cidade e a alguns clientes do seu Bairro e zonas a fins. Actualmente está frequentando a 12ª classe suportado os estudos atraves do negócio, e vivendo com cinco passoas na sua responsabilidade. O valor de empréstimo vai empulcionar mais o seu negócio uma vez que ira aumentar o seu capital de giro e que estava débil conseguindo deste modo responder á demanda dos seus clientes. Futuramente pretende obter uma Boutique onde poderá passar a vender as Roupas o que pode lhe proporcionar mais rendimentos tambem tenciona montar um salão de beleza femenina no quintal da sua residencia.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. Murage is 36 years old and is married with two children. He lives in the Embakasi constituency of Nairobi city. John started his business in 2005 after getting his initial capital of Ksh.30,000 (USD 460) from savings, which he earned doing a part-time accounting job at a company known as Georgia Kenya Export.

With the initial capital, John purchased stock for a mini-shop, including items like margarine, flour, sugar, salt, milk, bread, juice, snacks, candies, and cereals such as maize (corn), beans, green grams, rice, etc. Fortunately he did not have to pay rent for the shop because the building belongs to his father and allowed him to operate free of charge. Because of his father’s good will, John was able to stock his shop with goods and also purchase a scale, which is handy in any shop for weighing of items like sugar and cereals.

The business has continued to grow over the last two years and the number of customers has increased as well -- so has the demand for new products like fresh meat, vegetables and dairy products. John has to meet his customers’ demands if he is to remain in business. He has therefore decided to start stocking these items, which are in very high demand in his area. The only impediment to this is a lack of coolers, which he will need in order to keep the products fresh. John is therefore requesting a loan of USD 1200, which will enable him to purchase the two coolers that he needs to expand his business and satisfy his customers' needs. The repayment period for this loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase two coolers

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is married with 5 children.  He sells jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, as well as some perfumes in the outskirts of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  The previous loans from SMT increased his stock and income; and Hassan said he now purchases his goods directly from Guinea and sells them both wholesale and retail to vendors in Magburaka town and surrounding villages.  Before the loan, Hassan could hardly make enough money to meet his families expenses.  His plan is to expand his business and is requesting  a loan of $175.

loans.use: Expand his business selling jewelry and perfumes.

loans.name: Alberto Velasco

texts.pt:
Location: Chali neighborhood – Catembe-Maputo
Client: Alberto Velasco P.
Activity: Retail
Loan Amount: 18,000 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 720.00) Loan use: Purchase essential products and cosmetics
Start date: 10/08/2007
End date: 1/30/2008

Alberto Velasco P., born in Zavala-Inhambane 61 years ago on March 1, 1946, supports 7 people. He is married and attended school until the 2nd grade. He grew up in a family environment with his parents and siblings, going to school and taking care of the animals in his free time. He worked as a machinist for the firm Carmoc in the 70’s and as a motorist in the 80’s. In 1984 he decided to move to Catembe where he purchased a Singer sewing machine on credit, which allowed him to perform small sewing jobs and save some money. He was able to pay off the machine with no problems.

During his time in Catembe, he worked as a guard and a gardener, but his salary was so low that it was not enough to support the family. That is when he decided to begin construction on the grocery store, in 2000, after the floods.

With the little money he earned, he was able to purchase goods for the store and set some money aside for the family ranch, as well as for the children's schooling. With the profits he was able to build a well, buy a freezer, a television set, zinc plates, etc. He currently runs a grocery store where he has been selling a variety of essential products for over 5 years, with no training and no bookkeeping. He does not employ any workers; in his absence, his wife takes care of the business.

With the loan of 18,000 meticais he plans to buy rice, sugar, corn starch, oil and cosmetics. The shop opens at 7:00 a.m. and closes at 9:30 p.m. Business is conducted in the backyard. He purchases goods for resale in Maputo. Like many others, he uses public transportation. There are typically no “peak” periods, but weekends do see an increased demand. His daily income is 500 MT, and he keeps no record of sales. His biggest constraint is the lack of transportation for his goods when he travels to Maputo, forcing him to buy in smaller quantities. Nevertheless, his monthly profit is 2,500 MT. With the earnings from the store he is able to support the family and pay the monthly fees for his children’s schooling.

His future plans involve expansion and an increase in business volume. The business is doing well and he is quite motivated to obtain a little bit of money to purchase a mode of transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chali, Catembe-Maputo Cliente: Alberto Velasco P. Actividade: Comércio Valor empréstimo: 18.000,00MT (720.00US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade e cométicos Início: 08/10/2007 Fim:30/01/2008 Alberto Velasco P., nascido em Zavala-Inhambane a 61 anos aos 01 de Março de 1946, sustenta 7 pessoas , é casado maritalmente e estudou até 2ª classe. Viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais e irmãos, estudava e nos tempos livres cuidava do gado. Trabalhou como maquinista na empresa Carmoc na década 70 e 80 como motorista. Então em 1984 decide passar a viver na Catembe e nessa altura comprou por crédito uma máquina de costura singer que lhe ajudava a fazer pequenas costuras e foi poupando algum dinheiro e outro pagou a máquina sem sobressaltos. Assim durante a sua vida na Catembe, este trabalhara como guarda/jardineiro e recebia pouco salário que não chegava para o sustento da família. É quando decide fabricar blocos para iniciar a construção da Mercearia isto no ano 2000, logo após as cheias. Com o pouco que ganhava repartia algum para compra de produtos para loja e outro para o rancho da família e por as crianças a estudar. Conseguiu com os lucros fazer o poço de água, comprar um congelador,televisor, chapas de zinco, etc. Actualmente tem uma mercearia onde vende produtos diversos de 1ªnecessidade a mais de 5 anos, e não possue nenhuma formação na área e não tem feito registo. Não emprega nenhum trabalhador e na sua ausência a esposa é que fica a velar pelo negócio. Com o empréstimo de 18.000,00MTN pretende comprar arroz, açucar, farrinha de milho, óleo e cométicos. O estabelecimento é aberto as 7:00horas e encerra.se as 21:30mn e desenvolve a actividade no seu quintal, as compras da mercadoria sao feitas em Maputo e usa como outros, transporte colectivo e não há épocas de melhor valia apenas salientar que aos fins de semana a procura é maior. A receita dária é de 500MT e não tem registo. O grande constragimento que enfrenta é falta de transporte de mercadoria quando vai á Maputo, póis é obrigado a comprar em quantidades menores, todavia a margem de lucro mensal é de 2.500MT. Com os rendimentos da mercearia sustenta a familia, paga as mensalidades das crianças na escola. A sua perspectiva futura passa necessariamente na expansão e aumento do volume de negócio. A fase actual do negócio é bom e está bastante motivado a angariar aos poucos dinheiro para compra de uma viatura.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Younes

texts.en: Younes is a 37 year old father of 4 children. He lives with his family in the outskirts of the city of Tyre in the South of Lebanon. The children and young people from the neighborhood get together in his cafe and games center in which they play pool and spend their free time. He wants to expand his business and start buying more games in order to attract more clients. Younes is confident in this new step he is undertaking and is very proud of his initiative.

loans.use: To buy new games

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie K. is married with five children.  Both Marie and her husband are petty traders.  Maries sells used clothes in Magburaka town and has been in business for 10 years.  She said the business was passed on to her by her mother when she was a young girl.  Before the loan from SMT, Marie could only afford to purchase two bales of clothes every month and would earn very little income.  With the loans, she can now purchase 4 – 5 bales and her income has increased.  Marie was able to pay her children’s fees for the last semester without any difficulty.   She plans to increase her stock and also reduce frequent travels to Freetown to purchase the clothes.  She is therefore requesting a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase used clothes via wholesale for a greater profit.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 53-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Tandiika area in Dar Es Salaam city. She keeps poultry--both broilers and layers. She has been in business for the past 7 years and helped her sustain her family with income from her birds. She supplies her poultry to nearby restaurants and individual customers do come to her home. Anna is in need of $550 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: To increase her poultry business

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is 55 years old and has three children.  He runs a stall of used clothing in the Magburaka market.  He tries hard to teach his children about his business and how to be a good business man.  With the previous loan, he purchased 4 – 5 bales of clothes monthly, and the increase in the business is keeping the children busy instead of being idle.  His children sometimes assist in the selling after school and during weekends.  With the profit, Abdul is in a position to meet school expenses.  His plan is to expand the business and train the children to manage it for their livelihood in the future.

loans.use: Purchase additional bales of used clothing at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine Opolla O. is a 37-year-old widower who lives within the Kibera slums. He has four children (one boy and three girls) who depend on him. He also takes care of his sister, who he is supporting in the course of education by paying her school fees. He also takes care of his mother and grandmother back at home. Chrispine Opolla O. runs an automotive paint shop where he sells paints.

Chrispine was encouraged by his sister to get into business -- particularly the paint business, because of its uniqueness -- after studying the area in which he wanted to start the business. He started in 1999 using his savings of Ksh 10,000 (USD 150) from his previous employment at a transport company. His sister also supported him by giving him a grant of Ksh 10,000, which he was not required to pay back. Chrispine is still determined and his business is doing well despite the peak and low seasons that affect businesses.

Now Chrispine wishes to expand his business, and therefore intends to buy a spraying machine and stock of different colors and brands of paint worth USD 1,075. The loan, given in the form of paints and stock, will increase his income level to meet his family’s needs. His customers will be satisfied because they will be able to get a wide range of products and services under one roof, saving them time and energy. The repayment period for this loan will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase a spraying paint machine and assorted paints

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 47-year-old mother of eight, with four children still depending on her. She sells wood, a business she has been doing for the past 6 years. Her suppliers get the wood from Kilwa, southern Tanzania, a forested region. The business is sometimes slow because the government limits the wood-gathering, to prevent deforestation.
She is in need of $425 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Yusifa

texts.en: Yusifa got married at an early age due to death of his father during the civil war in Sierra Leone.  He started his business at the age of 15 and is engaged in the selling of used clothes, specifically trousers because of high demand in the area for these items.  His customers are mainly youth and the previous loans from SMT assisted him in expanding his stock.  Abdul can sell up to five bales of clothes a month as compared to two bales previously.  Abdul takes care of his elderly mother, a sister and brother, plus his own family.  He is now married with two children.  He is requesting a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: Expansion of his clothing business by purchasing more bales of used clothing on wholesale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a 35-year-old resident of the Makangarawe area in Dar Es Salaam city. She has been doing business for the past four years. She runs a restaurant in Makangarawe that prepares local dishes. She wants to expand her restaurant into a bigger one to accommodate more customers. She needs to buy more tables and chairs for her restaurant.  She is in need of $225 to help her boost her business

loans.use: Expand bussiness

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en: Hamis is a 42-year-old father of four and a resident of Tandika. Hamis is a is tailor  and has done this job for the past ten years. He specializes in men’s trousers and making suits. He is a recipient of business training organized by the Youth Self Employment Foundation. He now wants to buy an electronic tailoring machine. He is in need of $350 to help accomplish his plan.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 42-year-old mother of 4 and a resident of the Tandiika area in Dar Es Salaam city. She has been doing business for the past seven years. She runs a restaurant in the area and keeps poultry and plans to open a kiosk. She is in need of $225 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is 55 and a strong and energetic mother of six. She sells charcoal, a business she has been doing for the past three years. She recently obtained business training organized by the Youth Self Employment Foundation. She sells charcoal at her home. She is in need of $225 to help her prosper business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida is a 41-year-old mother of 4 and a resident of the Tandika area. She sells piped water in Tandika, a place in Dar Es Salaam where water supply is a common problem. She also has machines for brick laying. She now wants to buy bigger water storage tanks and another machine for brick making. She is need of $225 to help her accomplish her plans.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Santiqie

texts.en: Santiqie sells clothes in Kabala town, and is 26 years old and married with one child.  He started his business when he was 15 years old but it was destroyed during the civil war.  With a small loan from a friend, he started the business again four years ago, and has expanded it to the current level with several small loans from SMT.  As a young man whose aim is to build a happy family, he is seriously determined to expand his business.  For this purpose he is requesting a loan of $275.

loans.use: Expand his business to take care of his family.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 30-year-old mother of 3 and a runs a small pharmacy in the Tandika area. She is a trained nurse and has been running her pharmacy for the past three years. She is in need of $550 to help her expand and stock more drugs in her pharmacy.

loans.use: Expand

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia, 34 is a tailor doing her business in Tadika area. She has been a tailor for the past two years and has business is growing steadily. She now wants to buy another tailoring machine because of the increasing number of customers. She is in need of USD 225.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: Zawadi is a 39-year-old resident of Tandika.  She runs a restaurant, a business she has been doing for the past 6 years. She prepares breakfast, lunch and supper. She is in need of more tables and chairs for her restaurant to cater to the increasing number of customers. She is in need of $225 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Ziada

texts.en: Ziada is a 27-year-old mother and a resident of the Makangarawe community. She runs a ladies salon. She makes different styles of hair for her customers. Her business always booms during the festival seasons. She has recently received business management training organized by the Youth Self employment foundation.  She wants to buy more equipment for her salon to get prepared for the Christmas season. She is in need of $425 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura is 42-year-old mother of three and a resident of Tandika. She has been doing business for the past six years. She runs a grocery store in the Tandika area.. She now wants to expand her store into a bigger shop. She is in need of $225 to help her boost her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.en: Zulfa is 30-year-old mother of five and a resident of Tandika in the Dar Es Salaam region. She runs a grocery store and sells fresh vegetables. She has been in business for the past six years. She now wants to expand her store into a bigger shop. She is in need of $550 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas is a widowed 47-year-old woman with 6 children, and she takes care of 2 orphans. She is a very strong, determined woman with a lot of business sense. She has been operating a tailoring business for the past 15 years. With her profits she has been able to build a building where she rents 3 store fronts. She is currently adding a second story to her building and adding on in the back. She will use the second story for a tailoring workroom, where she plans to hire additional seamstresses.

With her loan she plans to buy larger volumes of material for her expanding business. A large portion of her business is making sweaters and uniforms for the schoolchildren. In Uganda, you must have a uniform to attend school. So, she offers good pricing which helps many families afford uniforms.

loans.use: Evas plans to use her loan to buy more material and embroidery for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam K. is 26 years old and single. She lives with her family in Koumassi, a populated suburb in the south of Abidjan. She has 3 younger sisters and brothers, and she contributes to their education expenses.

Mariam has been a hair dresser in Koumassi Market since she left school 8 years ago. She also sells hair creams and artificial strands of hair. Mariam is dynamic and courageous. She has benefited from several loans from AE&I that she has reimbursed in good manner. She is actively preparing for the end of the year period (Christmas, New Year, etc.).

loans.use: Mariam Kone will use the loan to purchase strands of hair and hair cream.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 25-year-old single, hardworking man who is paying school fees for his two younger sisters, who are now his responsibility. One is doing her ‘O’ level exams this year and the other is enrolled at a college in Nairobi known as K.C.C.T. Apart from his two sisters, his aging diabetic mother also depends on him in taking care of her medical needs.

Robert started saving money when he was still employed as a clerk at the Metropolitan Hospital in the city of Nairobi. This was in the year 2005; through hard work, sacrifice, and determination, Robert managed to save Ksh 200,000 (USD 3075). With this money he bought two computers, a printer and a scanner; with the remaining money, he rented a stall in the heart of the town centre. He then started operating his computer bureau business in the year 2006, where he provides services in processing documents. Robert is always busy due to the location of his business, and he has managed to attract a large clientele.

In recent times, he has had an increase in the number of customers who need to get photocopies of documents. Unfortunately, Robert has been unable to fulfill their needs, since he lacks a photocopying machine. Robert is therefore kindly requesting a loan of USD 775 so that he can purchase a photocopier. This will greatly boost his business since he will be able to provide photocopying services to his clients who are in great need of this service. Robert intends to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier machine

loans.name: Roció

texts.es:
I dedicate myself to the sale of shoes by mail order catalog. This is my sole income and being a single mother I must provide for my son. I am requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase shoes and invest in my business to increase my earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Me dedico a la venta de calzados por catalogo este es mi ingreso ya que soy madre soltera y tengo que sacar adelante a mi hijo. Solicito un préstamo de $ 500. Dlls. Para la compra de calzado e invertir más para tener mas ingreso.

loans.use:
Merchandise purchase

Comprara de mercancía

loans.name: Rosario Ofelia

texts.es:
I dedicate myself to the sale of prepared snacks at a school in the city of Nuevo Laredo. This is my business in which my mother-in-law and I work. I am requesting a loan of $1,000 for the purchase of a freezer in order to expand the variety of goods in my store.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Me dedico a la venta de alimentos preparados en una escuela de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este es mi negocio en el trabajamos mi suegra y yo. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de un congelador y surtir mas la tienda.

loans.use:
Purchase a freezer and merchandise

Comprar un congelador y mercancía

loans.name: Bertha Gloria

texts.es:
Bertha is a self-sacrificing 47 year old mother, who despite having being abandoned by her partner has been able – with effort and love – to move forward and become both father and mother for her fifteen year old son who helps her in the completion of her daily tasks.

She has two businesses, internet kiosks which are administered by her son and which already cover the costs of his studies, and the grocery store which she runs which covers household bills. Thanks to these activities, Bertha has been able to also contribute to the household expenses of her mother-in-law, in which they still live.

Bertha wants to own her own house in order to be able to move her business and administrate it more comfortably, for this she needs work and money, money she doesn’t yet have but she continues hoping that one day she will be able to make her dreams come true with much effort and work, and leave a legacy for her son to inherit.

Daily she demonstrates devotion and dedication in her work with the hope of realising her ambitions. She now needs a loan of $200 dollars with which she will be able to buy the various tools she needs to renovate and install the internet cabins and her small grocery store. Let us help this mother and son who are fighting to have their own roof over their heads and a promising business.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva volunteer

Bertha es una abnegada madre de familia de 47 años, que a pesar de sufrir el abandono de su pareja ha podido a costa de esfuerzo y amor, salir adelante y convertirse en padre y madre para su hijo de 15 años quien le ayuda en el desempeño de las labores diarias.

Posee dos negocios, las cabinas de internet que está administrada por su hijo ya que a través de el puede costear los gastos de sus estudios y la bodega administrada por ella para cubrir los gastos de su hogar; gracias a estas actividades, Bertha ha podido también contribuir con los gastos de la casa de su suegra, en la que se ubican hasta el día de hoy.

Ella desea tener su propia casa para trasladar su negocio y administrarlo más cómodamente, para ello requiere de trabajo y de dinero, dinero con el que hoy no cuenta pero mantiene la esperanza de poder hacer sus sueños realidad y tener un patrimonio que heredar a su hijo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Diariamente muestran entrega y dedicación en su desempeño con la esperanza de realizar sus anhelos, ahora requieren de un préstamo de 200 dólares con los que adquirirán diversas herramientas para acondicionar e implementaran las cabinas de Internet y su pequeña bodega. Apoyemos a esta pareja de madre e hijo que lucha por tener un techo propio y un negocio prometedor.

loans.use: Renovation and installation of internet cabins and a small grocery store

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Mr. Salvador G. has dedicated himself to food sales for more than 18 years. This has been the primary source of income for my family. My wife and I run the business. We are requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase furniture for our business and merchandise to offer better service to our customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Salvador G. se dedica la venta de comida desde has mas de 18 años. Este negocio a sido la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de mobiliario para el negocio y mercancía para dar un mejor servicio a los clientes.

loans.use:
Purchase of furniture and merchandise

Comprar mercancía y mobiliario

loans.name: Felícita Justa

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicita is 53 years old and spends her time daily in the business of growing and processing wheat in order to prepare it for distribution in the town of Tarma. This helps her husband and family with their daily expenses. Thanks to her work, they have been able to give their children an adequate education, and today 4 of her 6 children work in the city of Lima. Mrs. Felicita now has the desire to give the remaining 2 underage children the same level of assistance towards their education and quality of life in order to set them up for their future. However, even with this desire and her enthusiasm, she has been unable to function with the same strength due to her age and certain financial troubles which have come upon her, due to the fact that prices have fallen, and she hasn't been able to sell larger quantities of her product. Now, after thorough analysis, she is hoping that this loan will help her increase her product and its quality in order to distribute more and generate more sales. This is why she is requesting the sum of $500 USD to invest in improving and increasing her wheat product. With your contribution you will enable Felicita to keep her clients and children happy.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Felicita D. 53 años D. edad, dedica su tiempo al negocio D. la venta D. trigo que ella misma tuesta y muele en su hogar, para distribuirlo en la ciudad D. Tarma y con ello ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera diariamente su familia.Gracias a su actividad pudo ofrecer a sus hijos una adecuada educación y hoy 4 hijos D. los 6 que tiene trabajan en la ciudad D. Lima.Ella ahora mantiene el mismo ímpetu D. antes para ofrecer a sus menores hijos que aún comparten su pequeña morada una educación prometedora y solvente para sus vidas.Pese a sus ganas y su entusiasmo, ella ha dejado D. desenvolverse con las mismas fuerzas, debido a su edad y ciertos malestares que le aquejan sumado al decaimiento D. su situación financiera por la disminución del precio y ventas D. su producto.Luego D. haber realizado un exhaustivo análisis está proyectándose para llevar sus productos con más frecuencia a los mercados, abastecer a más personas y complacerlas con un producto mejorado. Es por ello que solicita la suma D. 500 dólares para invertirlos en la mejora e incremento D. sus productos.Con su contribución harás que Felicita pueda tener contentos a sus clientes e hijos.

loans.use: to increase and improve her wheat crop

loans.name: Pa Chernor

texts.en: Pa Chernor is married with five children.  He owns a small tea and coffee shop in Mabgburaka town.  With his previous loans Pa Chernor was able to purchase more thermos flasks and cups for the business.  He also can now purchase sugar, tea, and coffee on wholesale and this has increased his sales and profit.  He would like to expand his business and rent a decent place for the shop.  Pa Chernor will complete his current loan repayment next month, and is requesting for a larger loan of $175.

loans.use: Increase his stock of tea and coffee to attract additional customers.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim runs a store selling sugar and rice.  Rice is a staple food in Sierra Leone and therefore it has a big market. With the previous loan, 42 year-old Ibarhim increased his business with six bags of rice and reduced time spent traveling to purchase the rice.  Ibarhim is married with three children and plans to expand his business and become one of the leading wholesalers in Magburaka town.  For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Expand his business by purchasing larger quantities of rice for wholesale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu sells utensils in Magburaka town.  She started her business five years ago and has seen her business progress with the previous loans.  She is a 37 year-old widow and has five children.  She is the sole bread winner for the family.  She lost her husband during the brutal civil war in Sierra Leone.  The business provides Isatu with income for the children’s fees and other expenses.  She is requesting for more loan capital for the expansion of the business and she is determined to see her children through their education.

loans.use: Increase her business selling household utensils.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab sells peanuts in the market of Magburaka town.  Before joining SMT, she used to purchase three bags of peanuts monthly.  With her current loan, she can now purchase 10 bags of peanuts a month.  Now she has more time to spend with the children and on business.  Twenty five year-old Zainab is married with three children.  As a young mother with young children, Zainab would like to work with her husband cooperatively and build a better future for their family.  She is requesting more loans to expand the business.

loans.use: Increase her stock of peanuts to create additional income.

loans.name: Maritza Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, a mother is selfless and dedicated to her work selling food and raising guinea pigs to ensure that her children do not go through the hardships that she had as a child. She helps her husband provide for the welfare of their family since he earns a small fixed income. For this reason, Rosa decided to dedicate herself to developing her art of food preparation (cooking) as a source of income for her family, and so far has been able to manage it, despite its enormous dedication. Increasingly their needs are greater and there are few opportunities to grow their business and strive to see the day that this family can finish building their house in order to live comfortably. For this reason, Rosa asks the amount of $100 USD, which will be used to acquire a sales post, so she can stop paying rent, while they finish construction of their little house. We are counting on your help so that Rosa may have an opportunity to realize the yearnings of her heart.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer

Rosa, es una madre abnegada y dedicada a su trabajo de venta de comida y crianza de cuyes con el fin de que sus hijos no pasen las privaciones que ella tuvo de niña y hoy sirve de apoyo a su esposo para juntos otorgarle bienestar a su familia, quien cuenta con un sueldo fijo gracias a su trabajo en el consejo de su localidad; sin embargo dicho ingreso no abastece los egresos diarios de sus miembros.Debido a este requerimiento decidió dedicarse a desarrollar su arte por la comida como una fuente de ingreso para su hogar y hasta hoy ha podido administrarlo y pese a su enorme dedicación cada vez sus necesidades se hacen mayores y son pocas las oportunidades de crecer y poder llegar al día en que esta familia pueda terminar de construir su casa para vivir cómodamente.Por ello Rosa solicita la suma de 100 dólares que le servirán para adquirir un puesto de ventas a fin de dejar de pagar el alquiler y concluir en poco tiempo la construcción de su casita.Contamos con vuestra colaboración para que Rosa pueda tener una oportunidad más para seguir los anhelos de su corazón.

loans.use: To buy a "sales post" where she can sell food

loans.name: Cecilia Nicolasa

texts.es:
Cecilia is 32 years old and is the mother of four young children who are in elementary school in their town. It is because of them that she works eagerly every day on each of the agreements that she has with schools and other clients to prepare delicious, appetizing dishes. This job helps her obtain only a minimal income, but it helps greatly with family expenses. This is also why she has started a new activity, raising rabbits, to generate more income, so she can install basic services in her home, like electricity and water. Due to this still-lacking need, she has had to rent a small room for shelter until she can put fundamental services in her home. To carry out this plan and to offer her children well-being and comfort, Cecilia is requesting a loan of $375 to liven up her place to sell food and to be able to raise her animals. With your collaboration, you will help Cecilia accomplish her life goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia es una señora de 32 años, madre de 4 menores hijos que cursan estudios primarios en un centro educativo de su localidad, por los que día a día trabaja con ahínco en cada uno de los contratos que tiene con las escuelas y con algunas personas para preparar sus riquísimos platos apetitosos, este trabajo le ayuda a obtener un ingreso mínimo pero de gran ayuda para salir de algunos apuros familiares.Así también ha iniciado una nueva actividad, la crianza de cuyes con el que piensa generar mayores ingresos, que pueda servir para instalar en su hogar los servicios básicos que le hacen falta, tanto como luz y el agua. Debido a esta necesidad aún no satisfecha, ha tenido que alquilar un pequeño cuarto donde cobijarse, hasta que puedan habitar su hogar con las instalaciones primordiales. Para llevar a cabo su propósito y ofrecerles bienestar y comodidad solicita 375 dólares para ambientar un lugar para vender sus comidas preparadas y un lugar donde poder criar a sus animalitos.Con vuestra colaboración ayudarás a que Cecilia logre sus planes de vida

loans.use: Adaption of a space for food sales and raising animals

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
This woman is married and has three children, all in school age and they are all in school. The eldest works and helps with a little bit of money, although he has his own family and makes very little money.

The business has been up and running for more than eight years and its located in the Central Market of Chinandenga. It is a small stand where she sells dairy products: cheeses, creams and butter. The stand is made of wood and a black plastic roof, to protect her merchandise and herself from the sun and the rain. Sometimes when it rains very heavily she still gets wet- "it's part of working in the market," she comments.

Her business started with an initial investment of approximately $200, and with some pounds of fresh and dry cheese. All her life, she has worked in the food retail business, selling all kinds of products such as bread, vegetables, pork with yucca, and nacatamales (these two last ones are traditional Nicaraguan dishes).

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es casada, con un total de tres hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran en edad escolar y se encuentran estudiando, el mayor trabaja y le ayuda muy poco, debido a que tiene su propia familia y gana muy poco.

El negocio tiene más de ocho años de existir y está ubicado en el Mercado Central de Chinandega. Consiste en un pequeño puesto de venta de productos lácteos: quesos, crema y mantequilla. El local está hecho de madera y techo de plástico negro para proteger la mercadería y a su persona del sol y la lluvia, aunque cuando la lluvia es muy fuerte ella casi se moja por completo –“es parte del trabajo en el mercado”- comenta ella misma.

El negocio inicia con una inversión inicial de aproximadamente US$ 200 dólares, con algunas libras de queso fresco y seco. Ella ha trabajado toda la vida en el sector comercio, vendiendo todo tipo de productos: Pan, Verduras, cerdo con yuca y nacatamales (los dos últimos son platos típicos de Nicaragua).

loans.use: Compra de productos (leche, queso, crema)

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: Sallay is married with four children.  Sallay sells Potatoes, Cassava and occasionally, cooked food. Sallay is 33 years old and  contributes to  some of the family expenses.  Her husband is also a petty trader in Magburaka town.  She said her main concern is her children’s school requirements.  She would like to expand and diversify her business, and is therefore requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: Expand her business by purchasing more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu, 45 years old, sells dried, smoked fish in the outskirts of Magburaka town.  Married with three children, Isatu invested a portion of the previous loan in the farm her husband manages.  She said the profit from the fish business is for paying the loans and meeting school expenses. They get their food from their farm and sell the surplus for other family expenses as well.  Isatu would like to expand her fish business to earn more profit that can be invested in the farm.  With the farm work, her husband will be self-employed.  She is therefore requesting for a $175 loan.

loans.use: Increase her dried fish stock for sale.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
This is an unmarried, childless woman who has dedicated her entire life to this type of business, owing to her mother’s occupation of raising and butchering pigs.

Currently her mother is old and no longer works and Mrs. A. is her only caregiver. She also supports a nephew, the son of her older brother who lives in Costa Rica due to unemployment, by paying for his education.

She has worked at her current position in the central market in Chinancego for over seven years. Before this she, she sold her wares from her house. She was responsible for buying live animals, butchering them and selling the meat and other parts of the animal. She has worked with CEPRODEL for over 2 years and has a very good credit record with them.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Izmailov, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Esta señora es soltera sin hijos, la cual se ha dedicado toda la vida a este tipo de negocio, debido a que su mamá se dedicaba a la crianza y destace de cerdos.

Actualmente su mamá está ya anciana y no trabaja, doña blanca es su único sostén y es quien mantiene además de su mamá, a un sobrino hijo de un hermano mayor que vive en Costa Rica por la falta de empleo, a quien le está financiando su educación.

El puesto que actualmente ella posee está ubicado en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega desde hace más de siete años, antes de tener su puesto las ventas las realizaba en su casa, ella se hace cargo de comprar el animal en pie, destazarlo y comercializar su carne y otros derivados provenientes del animal. Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace más de 2 años con quien tiene muy buen record crediticio.Purp

loans.use: Purchase of goods (pigs, sausages, fat)

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia is a selfless and noble mother who is 46 years old. She has been doing agricultural work since her childhood. This work has allowed her and her family to subsist on her harvest of beans, corn, and alfalfa all of her life. Nevertheless, many times this sacrifice has not been enough to rise out of the poverty in which they find themselves submerged. They don't even have a house in which they can take shelter peacefully. Many times they have had great difficulties obtaining food for every day. In spite of all of this, Teodocia views the future with optimism, and this is why she has decided to improve the quality of her products so she can take them to the capital city and sell them. With the profits that she makes, she will start a small grocery business with the help and company of her loving family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Teodocia es una abnegada y noble madre de familia, de 46 años, desde su niñez, aprendió a desenvolverse y desarrollar las labores agrícolas, trabajo que le ha permitido a través de toda su vida subsistir con la siembre de habas, maíz y alfalfa a ella y a toda su familia.Sin embargo muchas veces este sacrificio no ha sido suficiente, para poder salir de la pobreza en la que se ven sumergidos, ya que aún no poseen una casa guarecerse tranquilamente; muchas veces han tenido grandes dificultades para conseguir el sustento diario.A pesar de ello, Teodocia ve el futuro con optimismo y es por ello que se ha propuesto, mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que de esta manera pueda llevarlos a comercializarlos hasta la capital, así con las ganancias que obtenga empezar un pequeño de negocio de venta de abarrotes con la ayuda y compañía de su querida familia.

loans.use: To improve the quality of her products for better profitability

loans.name: Valencia Margarita

texts.en:
Because of his work, Valencia Margarita’s husband needed to leave the city for long periods of time, and on occasion did not send her money for weeks, so that, approximately one year ago, she asked her mom (who has a small haberdashery) to sell paper products in her business, in order to attract more clients. Today, this business is already getting a reputation, but the lack of materials is minimizing clients.

Valencia is asking for a credit of US $375 to pay within five months, and with this help she will be able to supply her paper shop with materials like books, stamps, paper, pens, among other things. With your help, Valencia will be able to grow this business and will not have to wait for her husband to return from trips in order to pay household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrew Tsavaris, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

El esposo de Valencia Margarita, por su trabajo tenía que salir de la ciudad por largas temporadas, y en ocasiones no le mandaba dinero en semanas, así que hace aproximadamente un año, ella le pidió a su mamá (quien tiene una pequeña mercería) vender en su negocio mercancía de papelería, para atraer a más clientes. Hoy ya se está dando a conocer este negocio, pero la falta de materiales está restando clientes.

Valencia está pidiendo un crédito de US $375 para pagar en un plazo de 5 meses, y así con esta ayuda ella podrá surtir su papelería, de materiales como libretas, estampillas, papeles, plumas, entre otras cosas. Con tu ayuda Valencia podrá crecer este negocio, y así no tendrá que esperar a que regrese su esposo de los viajes para pagar los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: She needs money to be able to buy mechandise.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
This woman is a single mother and head of her family, she has six children- all married and with children, she supports with their expenditures and she is directly in charge on two of her grandchildren. They stay with her and she pays for their food and studies by the profits of her business. This woman has developed many activities to gain enough money. Before this business she had a store in her home, this helped her to take care of her children while they helped her to take care of the clients. Her business has been in existence since more than nine years ago, she started it with $600 from her savings and some help from her older children while they were still single. Her business was originally made by wood and plastic, but she has slowly made some improvements. She still needs more infrastructure for her business to be able to protect her merchandise and get more products. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and her daily sales are approximately $35.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es madre soltera y jefa de familia con un total de seis hijos todos casados y con hijos, a los cuales ella apoya con sus gastos y tiene directamente a su cargo a dos nietos, los cuales le acompañan y a los cuales ella paga su alimentación y sus estudios por medio de los ingresos de su negocio.

Esta señora ha desarrollado diferentes actividades para ganarse la vida. Antes de tener este negocio tenía una pulpería en su casa lo cual le permitía cuidar de sus hijos, ellos le ayudaban a atender a los clientes. El puesto tiene más de nueve años de existir, el cual inicia con un capital inicial de aproximadamente US$ 600.00 aportado de sus ahorros y con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores cuando aún estaban solteros. El local inicial estaba elaborado de madera y plástico, aunque esta señora ha venido realizando mejoras paulatinas al local, aún necesita proporcionar a su negocio mejoras de infraestructura para proteger la mercadería y mayor surtido de productos. Tiene más de 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y sus ventas diarias son de aproximadamente US$ 35 dólares.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderia para surtir y actualizar inventario

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
A year ago, with the firm conviction to give her youngest son (one of 4) a better future, (since their other three children are already married) Maria Alicia decided to create a small snack shop in her home. The location is great since it's in front of a school, however, she now has a lack of resources and not a great assortment of snacks to offer. So today she is coming to you asking for a loan of $ 250 USD, that she is willing to pay within five months. The loan will be used to buy more products which will help bring in more business, and draw attention to all the students who pass by her house. In your hands is the power to help Maria Alicia.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hace un año, con la firme convicción de darle un mejor futuro al hijo más pequeño de cuatro que tiene (puesto que sus otros tres hijos ya están casados) María Alicia decidió poner un pequeño snak en su casa. Que está en muy buena ubicación ya que tiene enfrente una escuela. Y a falta de recursos no tiene gran surtido de botanas.

Así que hoy está acudiendo a ustedes pidiendo un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de cinco meses. El crédito es para poder surtir su negocio de mercancía que le llame la atención a todos los estudiantes que pasan por su casa. En tus manos está poder ayudarle a María Alicia.

loans.use: To supplement her snack shop

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
35 years ago, Pedro G. German worked on a ranch, where he learned to kill animals for sale to butcher stores, and thus was born the idea to begin saving to buy a cow and a pig in order to put up his own butcher store, which he did and which began growing gradually, along with his grocery business. But since he first opened his butchery, he has not able to change his glass display case and some cabinets, which are badly damaged.

Today he is coming to you asking for a loan of $550 USD to be paid within four months. With the money he plans to buy some new cabinets to improve his grocery store, which will improve the sale of meats. Pedro is grateful for the help you can give him to help him move forward and improve the sales of his business. Thank you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 35 años, Pedro G. A. trabajó en un rastro, en donde aprendió a matar los animales para venderlos en las carnicerías, y así nació su idea para poner una carnicería, empezó a juntar sus ahorros para comprar una vaca y un cerdo, y puso una carnicería, que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, y metiendo venta de abarrotes, para obtener mayores ganancias. Sin embargo desde que puso su carnicería no a podido cambiar su vitrina, la cual ya está muy deteriorada.

Hoy está acudiendo a ustedes pidiendo un préstamo de US $550 para pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, y con el dinero poder comprar unas vitrinas nuevas y surtir mejor de abarrotes. Para mejorar las ventas de su carnicería. Pedro te agradece la ayuda para poder salir adelante y mejorar su carnicería. ¡Muchas gracias por tu apoyo!

loans.use: To buy a glass display case and cabinets for his butcher/grocery store

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Since Bertha Alicia’s husband doesn’t have a stable source of income in the company where he works, she decided to make tamales in her home and sell them. It was five years ago when Bertha Alicia’s cousin noticed that she had an excellent work ethic, so he helped her to move her small business a local market close to her house. Since then she has not had the means to paint the roofless structure where she operates her business. She has also been unable to replace the tarp that covers her place of business. The tarp is so worn out that it practically gives no protection from the sun! Bertha Alicia also needs funds to buy the supplies she needs to make her products. This is why Bertha Alicia is asking for your help. She would like you to help finance a loan of US $500 to be repaid in 6 months. With this loan she will buy supplies for her business, paint the structure that she operates her business out of and to buy a tarp to cover that structure. With your help you will make it so Bertha will be able to improve the appearance of her business and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Ya que el esposo de Bertha Alicia no tenía un sueldo seguro en la empresa donde trabaja, ella se decidió a elaborar y vender tamales en su casa, y con el tiempo un primo de ella, vio que Bertha tenía muchas ganas de trabajar así que le traspasó un local en un mercadito muy cerca de su casa esto hace cinco años y desde entonces no a pintado la estructura de su local y tampoco a cambiado la lona que ya casi no la cubre del sol, además de necesitar material para la elaboración de sus comidas.

Por eso acude a usted para que la puedan apoyar con un crédito de US $500 en un plazo de seis meses para poder comprar material, pintar la estructura de su local y comprar una lona. Con tu ayuda lograrás que Bertha pueda hacer de su puesto un local mejor para atraer más clientes.

loans.use: Paint her restaurant site and buy a new tarp for its cover and also buy ingredients to make the food.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a 63 year old women and even at her age still has the strength and will necessary to continue working in order to meet her personal expenses and to help her children and contribute to the growth and development of her grandchildren.

Thanks to her sales of fish and meet she has been able to meet some of her grandchildren’s needs with the daily earnings from her house’s facilities, and they have become her best company. In a short period they have returned happiness to her life and she now doesn’t feel so alone because every afternoon they wait for her with many stories and gossip relating to their days in the house or at school.

However, recently she has had some aches and pains as a result of her age, which haven’t stopped worrying her and she needs to buy some medicines in order to reduce her discomfort and physical pain.

Thanks to this, she needs to continue working in order to purchase the medicines and continue her treatment. As a result, she is asking for a loan of $375 dollars in order to be able to distribute her products in Huasahuasi and the surrounding area where she will obtain better profits. Help so that a grandmother who hasn’t lost heart or faded as a result of her illness and allow her to continue providing for much longer valuable lessons on life and work to members of her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva volunteer

Hilda es una dama D. 63 años y a su edad mantiene las fuerzas y ganas necesarias para seguir trabajando para solventar sus gastos personales y para servir D. apoyo a sus hijos y contribuir con el crecimiento y desarrollo D. sus nietos.

Gracias a la venta D. pescado y carne ha solventado algunas carencias D. sus nietos con los que comprate día a día las instalaciones D. su casa y se han convertido en su mejor compañía. Ellos en poco tiempo le han devuelto la alegría a su vida y ya no se siente tan sola porque tarD. a tarD. la esperan con muchos ánimos y comentarios respecto al día que tuvieron en casa o en la escuela.

Sin embargo últimamente ha tenido algunos achaques propios D. su edad, que no dejan D. preocuparla y necesita comprarse algunas medicinas para apaciguar sus malestares y dolores físicos.

Debido a ello, necesita seguir trabajando para adquirir sus medicamentos y continuar con su tratamiento, solicita la suma D. 375 dólares para poder distribuir sus productos a la localidad D. Huasahuasi lugar donD. obtiene mayores ganancias.Colabore a que una abuelita no se desvanezca ni se desaliente a consecuencia D. sus malestares y siga otorgando por mucho tiempo más lecciones D. vida y trabajo a los miembros D. su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to consolidate her business

loans.name: Aída Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Aída is 54 years old and is an admirable mother. She has shown a great, diligent spirit and enthusiasm for agricultural work and raising rabbits her entire life. These activities have let her educate her two oldest children. She continues to strive towards providing well-being and education for her youngest child, and also towards being able to cover the expenses that her delicate health demands daily. Her advanced age intensifies her illnesses and makes them more painful and frequent. As a result of this, her work has been very limited, and her profits have decreased notably. Since she now wishes to increase the quality of her products with the purchase of fertilizers with the goal of obtaining a larger income to keep being able to afford her medications and the maintenance of her home, she is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to make her dreams a reality.

We are counting on your kind contribution for the benefit of the health of this diligent lady.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Aída D. 54 años es una admirable madre D. familia, que durante toda su vida, mostró un gran espíritu diligente y entusiasmo en las labores agrícolas y en la crianza D. cuyes, actividades con las cuales pudo educar a sus 2 hijos mayores.Aún ahora sigue esforzándose con el propósito D. otorgarle bienestar y educación al menor D. sus hijos y así también poder cubrir los gastos que sus delicada salud demandan diariamente, ya que por su avanzada edad los males se agudizan y cada vez son más dolorosos y frecuentes.A raíz D. este hecho su trabajo se ha visto muy limitado y las ganancias han disminuido notablemente.
