D. manera que ahora desea incrementar la calidad D. sus productos, con la compra D. abonos y fertilizantes, con el fin D. obtener mayores ingresos para seguir costeando la compra D. sus medicamentos y la manutención D. su hogar, solicita la suma D. 200 dólares, con los cuales convertirá sus deseos en realidad.

Contamos con su gentil contribución en beneficio D. la salud D. una diligente dama

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Delmis Argetina

texts.es:
My name is Delmis Argentina, and I’m mainly involved in commerce. I rely on a small home business selling cosmetics, which I then distribute traveling through my community. I have three years of experience in this line of work, which provides income for me to contribute my family’s expenses. It’s important that I mention I’m a single mother and I have three children that depend completely on my income. With the benefits I see in this work, I have built my life, and little by little, I’m improving it.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombres es Delmis Argentina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de cosmeticos, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, cuento con tres años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia. Es importante mensionar que soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijos los que depende totalmente de mis ingresos. Con las utilidades que persibo de este negocio he contruido mi vivienda, la que poco a poco estoy mejorando.

loans.use: Purchase of body cream, shampoo, salts, lotions, lipsticks, and undergarments.

loans.name: Vilma Del Rosario

texts.es:
Vilma is married and the mother of three children, who are already adults and working. But as is the custom in Nicaragua, she supports her children in raising and educating her grandchildren (which includes taking on some of the expenses).

As a mother, she has been a fighter. For over 25 years she has held a humble position in fruit and vegetable sales, which she began totally in the outdoors, and lately she's been investing in plastic roof parts to protect her self and her merchandise from the sun and rain. Before having a spot in the market, doña Vilma made a living producing and selling Nacatamales (Nacatamales are a typical Nicaraguan food and it fits to mention that their production is very tedious and difficult). Her position began with a small bit of capital, just eighty dollars approximately, selling some vegetables. She has worked with CEPRODEL since a year and a half ago and she has an excellent credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es casada, madre de tres hijos los cuales ya son adultos y trabajan, pero como es característicos en Nicaragua, ella apoya a sus hijos en la crianza y educación de sus nietos (eso incluye el asumir algunos gastos).

Ella ha sido una madre luchadora la cual posee desde hace más de 25 años un humilde puesto de venta de frutas y verduras, el cual inicia totalmente a la intemperie, más tarde fue que se fue colocando techo plástico para protegerse ella misma y a su mercadería del sol y la lluvia. Antes de tener su puesto en el mercado, doña Vilma se ganaba la vida elaborando y vendiendo Nacatamales (el Nacatamal es una comida típica nicaragüense y cabe destacar que su elaboración es muy tediosa y difícil). Su puesto inicia con un humilde capital de aproximadamente US$ 80 dólares, vendiendo algunas verduras. Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace más de año y medio con un excelente record crediticio.

loans.use: Buy products (fruits and vegetables) to replenish her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is a charismatic and lively mother, who devotes her time to the cultivation of gladioli and lettuces in the small kitchen garden that she possesses together with her family and in which she invests all her effort daily in order to harvest the thing that is most important to her of all, her family’s happiness.

Thanks to this effort, one of her children is studying in the university at Huancayo. However the small amount of money obtained isn’t sufficient to completely meet his needs as the production of their crops has been enormously damaged as a result of a lack of fertilizer, which is growing more and more expensive. With the plan of increasing the quality of their products and therefore their commercial value, which would allow them to meet all the family’s needs and thus see them obtain happiness, she is asking for a loan of $275 dollars. Let us contribute to the happiness of this family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana es una alegre y carismática madre de familia, que se dedica a la siembra de gladiolos y lechugas, en el pequeño huerto que posee junto a su familia y en la que invierte todo su esfuerzo diariamente para cosechar aquello que es más importante para ella, la felicidad de su familia.

Gracias a ese esfuerzo uno de sus hijos, estudia en la universidad de Huancayo, sin embargo el poco dinero obtenido, no es suficiente para poder apoyarlo plenamente en lo que necesita, ya que la producción de sus cultivos se ha visto enormemente perjudicada por la carencia de fertilizantes y abonos, que cada vez son más caros.Con el propósito de incrementar la calidad de sus productos, y por ende la comercialización de estos, que le permitirán cubrir todas aquellas necesidades que tenga su familia y así poderlos ver felices, solicita un monto de 275 dólares.Contribuyamos con la felicidad de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Isabel De Jesus

texts.es:
Isabel is a single woman and head of the family for eleven children. All of them have been raised by means of her fish sales, an activity that she has carried out for over 25 years. Of these eleven children she only has one daughter, who is still in school studying in the sixth grade.

She owns a little fish stand located in the central market of Chinandega and she is in charge of five of her grandchildren, who she has studying. One of the main reasons why she is caring for these grandchildren is because her sons live on the sea and are dedicated to fishing. Some of them have their own fishing boat and pass much of their time in the sea fishing, which is why she takes care that the grandchildren are studying. She provides for them with her activity of selling fish.

Isabel has carried out multiple jobs in her life. Before selling fish, she was dedicated to a humble form of domestic agriculture for home consumption, she has worked as a domestic employee and cook among other activities. She has worked with CEPRODEL for more than two years and has a very good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es madre soltera y jefa de familia de 11 hijos, todos ellos criados por medio de la venta de pescado, actividad que ha desempeñado desde hace más de 25 años. De estos 11 hijos ella tiene solamente a una hija a su cargo, la cual está aún en edad escolar estudiando sexto grado de primaria.

Ella posee un pequeño puesto de venta de pescado ubicado en el mercado central de Chinandega y tiene a su cargo a 5 nietos los cuales tiene estudiando. Uno de los principales motivos por los que ella tiene nietos a su cargo es porque sus hijos viven en el mar y se dedican a la pesca, algunos de ellos tienen su propia lancha de pesca y pasan mucho tiempo en el mar pescando, por lo cual para que estos cinco nietos estudiaran, ella decidió llevárselos para Chinandega y ella los mantiene con la actividad de vender pescado.

Esta señora, ha desempeñado múltiples actividades, antes de vender pescado se dedicaba de forma humilde a la agricultura doméstica para autoconsumo, ha laborado como empleada doméstica, cocinera, entre otras actividades. Tiene más de 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, con muy buen record crediticio.

loans.use: Buy fish to sell in her business

loans.name: Soledad Victoria

texts.es:
Señora Soledad is a humble and courageous mother who throughout her life has had to confront many difficulties. She immerses herself in her daily tasks and agricultural activities. She recalls that her husband abandoned her 10 years ago, leaving her to care and maintain their six children.

She continues to work in a self-sacrificing manner, dividing her time between the fields and the care of her lambs and chickens, with which she tries to feed and care for her large family. The truth is that she has often felt ready to give up but because of her immense maternal love she has continued persevering with the struggle.

With this impetus, she wants to increase the quantity and quality of her agricultural products and also be able to acquire more livestock, with which she will increase the household’s income. For this project she is asking for a loan of $375 dollars. Le us help this noble and brave mother to continue along this difficult path.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva volunteer

La señora Soledad, es una humilde y valerosa madre de familia que a lo largo de su vida, tuvo que afrontar muchas circunstancias duras. Sumida en sus quehaceres y actividades agrícolas diariamente, recuerda como hace 10 años su esposo la abandonó, dejándola al cuidado y manutención de sus 6 hijos.

Viene realizando de un modo abnegado y compartiendo su tiempo entre el campo y la crianza de ovejitas y gallinas, con los que trata de alimentar y cuidar a su numerosa familia; la verdad es que muchas veces ha sentido claudicar, pero es por el amor inmenso de madre, que siempre sigue perseverando en esta lucha.

Con este ímpetu desea incrementar la cantidad y calidad de sus productos agrícolas y así también poder adquirir algunos animalitos más, con los cuales aumentará los ingresos de su hogar, para lo cual solicita la suma de 375 dólares. Ayudemos a esta noble y valiente madre de familia a continuar su camino por tan dura senda.

loans.use: Increase her seed and livestock in order to improve sales

loans.name: Ana Baudilia

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Ana Baudilia and I have been working in a small grocery store situated in my home for three years. My income from this business covers my family's living costs as well as other business-related expenses with suppliers. Because of this business, I have been able to move ahead with my two sons. I am a single mother. I need to keep my store well-stocked since the next grand sale is approaching; I would like to offer my customers a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombres es Ana Baudilia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, desde hace tres años, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, Gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos, ya que soy mardre soltera, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta y asi poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice, sugar, soft drinks, dairy products, instant soups, hygiene products

loans.name: Floricelda

texts.es:
Floricelda is married and has two children, who are both school age and are are studying. For more than 17 years she has had a small grocery store located in the Santa Ana Market in the city of Chinandega. She began it with a capital of $80.00 and sold sweets and a few basic grains.

In addition to the grocery store, and because her house is located in this important market, she also has a small shop where she sells sodas, for which there is good demand. Floricelda, apart from providing for her children, also takes care of her parents who are elderly and unable to work. He husband helps her with sales in both the grocery store and the soda shop, which operate in the same place. Both businesses are modest and are this humble family’s source of income. She has been working with CEPRODEL for more than three years and has a very good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta señora es casada con dos hijos los cuales están edad escolar y se encuentran estudiando. Desde hace más de 17 años posee una pequeña pulpería ubicada en el Mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad de Chinandega, el cual inicio con un modesto capital de US$ 80.00 dólares vendiendo golosinas y algunos granos básicos.

Además de la pulpería y por encontrarse su vivienda en este importante centro de compras, opera una pequeña refresquería con muy buena demanda. Doña Floricelda, además de hacerse cargo de sus hijos, tiene a su cargo a sus padres, los cuales están ya ancianos e imposibilitados para trabajar. Su esposo le ayuda con la venta tanto de la pulpería como de la refresquería que opera en el mismo lugar. Ambos negocios son modestos y constituyen el sostén de esta humilde familia. Tiene más de 3 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL con muy buen record crediticio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a small grocery store

loans.name: Isnarda De Concepcio

texts.es:
Isnarda is married and has five children, of whom one has graduated from the University. She has a small clothing shop. Her husband is a taxi driver and she helps him with the household expenses. Her children still live with her and older ones help her with the sales in the shop, which is located in the Santa Ana Market of the city of Chinandega.

Before she had this job, she sold bread as a street vendor. The business has existed for 28 years and it started out on the sidewalks of the Santa Ana market, practically in the open air. After selling on the sidewalk for 10 years, she managed to obtain a spot inside the market and built a small stand from wood and black plastic, which she improved over time. She began the business with approximately $200.00 of capital. Isnarda is a very humble and hardworking person who has had to sacrifice, working in the sun and rain in order to raise and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta señora es casada, tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales una de ellas se graduó de la Universidad. Ella posee un pequeño local de Venta de ropa, su esposo es chofer de taxi y le apoya en los gastos de su hogar. Aún sus hijos están a su cargo y los mayores le ayudan con la venta en el puesto de ventas, el cual está ubicado en el Mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Antes de tener este negocio ella se dedicaba a la venta de Pan de forma ambulante, el negocio tiene más de 28 años de existir y al principio estaba ubicado en las aceras del mercado Santa Ana, con una pequeña mesita, prácticamente a la intemperie, luego de 10 años de vender en la acera, logra ingresar al mercado y construye un modesto puesto con madera y plástico negro el cual fue mejorando con el tiempo. El negocio inicia con un capital de aproximadamente US$ 200.00 dólares. Doña Isnarda es una persona humilde y luchadora que ha tenido que sacrificarse en el sol y la lluvia para criar a sus hijos y darles educación.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory (men's, women's, and children's clothing)

loans.name: Clayton

texts.es:
Mr. B. J. is originally from the Atlantic coast of Nicaragua. He is married and has 6 children, of whom two still live with them and are studying. He says he has been selling basic grains for the last 30 years.

The business is located in his house, which is located on the outskirts of the Santa Ana market in the city of Chinandega. The business is modest and the majority of the sales are small scale. In addition to their children, the couple has four grandchildren in their charge, for whom they pay school fees. They are in primary school. This gentleman is elderly and he and his wife are managing to subsist thanks to this small business. They live in very humble conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Este señor originario de la Costa Atlántica de Nicaragua es casado y junto a su esposa han procreado 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 aún se encuentran a su cargo y están estudiando. Según manifiesta él mismo, se ha dedicado siempre al comercio de granos básicos desde hace más de 30 años.

El negocio opera en su propia casa de habitación, la cual está ubicada en la periferia del mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad de Chinandega. El negocio es modesto y la mayoría de las ventas son al detalle. Además de sus hijos la pareja tiene a su cargo a cuatro nietos a quienes les pagan sus estudios, todos están cursando su educación primaria. Este señor es un señor bastante mayor y que junto a su esposa están logrando subsistir gracias a este pequeño negocio. Ellos viven en condiciones muy humildes.

loans.use: To buy basic grains (rice, beans, corn) to stock his business

loans.name: Eradio

texts.es:
Mr. P. is married and the head of his household. He and his wife have three children, of whom two are in primary school. The third is a baby who is less than one month old. Mr. P. has had his business for more than seven years and it is located on one of the sidewalks in the market of Santa Ana de Chinandega. It consists of a humble stand with a variety of hardware articles (padlocks, electrical plugs and outlets, pliers, etc.).

A very important fact about this young man is that he has worked hard to continue his studies. He is currently in his third year studying law in the Popular University of Nicaragua (UPONIC). His stand is very basic and consists of small table with a small wooden roof and black plastic to protect him a little from the sun and rain. This young couple has fought to get ahead in life and to provide for their children’s necessities. P. began his business with just $25.00, selling thread and needles as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Este señor es casado y jefe de familia, tiene junto a su esposa tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en edad escolar cursando sus estudios de primaria, el tercero es un bebé con menos de un mes de nacido. Este señor tiene más de siete años de tener su negocio, el cual está ubicado en una de las aceras del mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega, este consiste en un humilde puesto de venta de algunos artículos ferreteros en general, conocido popularmente como chinería (candados, enchufes, terminales eléctricas, tenazas, etc.).

Un dato muy importante de este señor, es que se ha esforzado por continuar sus estudios, cursando actualmente tercer año de la carrera de Derecho en la Universidad Popular de Nicaragua UPONIC. El puesto de venta es muy humilde y consiste en una pequeña mesa con un pequeño techo de madera y plástico negro para protegerse un poco del sol y de la lluvia. Esta joven pareja ha luchado por salir adelante y proveerles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. El negocio empieza con apenas US$ 25 dólares, vendiendo hilos y agujas de forma ambulante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ceberina

texts.es:
Ceberina is a hard-working mother of five. Every day she rises early to bake the delicious bread her community enjoys for breakfast. With the family's help, it is distributed to retailers throughout the city. The business is going well, but the family pays a lot of money for rent. They would like to buy their own space for the bakery and a small shop and are working very hard to save up towards this goal. Let us help Ceberina make this dream a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ceberina es una diligente madre de familia, que diariamente se ocupa de brindar y satisfacer a su comunidad con sus deliciosos panes, los cuales son infaltables para un buen desayuno, dedicándose así mismo a las responsabilidades que demanda ser madre de 5 hijos.Diariamente empieza sus labores muy de madrugada junto a su familia, para la preparación de los panes, los cuales elabora de un modo muy especial, para después distribuirlos por todas las bodegas de la ciudad; el negocio marcha bien, sin embargo la carencia de un local propio hace que tengan que pagar una suma de dinero muy grande por el alquiler del local.Por esta razón desea tener un local propio donde trabajar tranquilamente y empezar a ahorrar para poder abrir más adelante una pequeña bodega con la que seguirá apoyando a sus hijos que se han convertido en su fuente de motivación. Ayudemos a que doña Ceberina haga sus sueño realidad

loans.use: To help a family of bakers open their own shop.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is 60 years old. Through her hard work and sacrifice she has raised her children and given them a good education. Today, she continues tirelessly to proviD. for her grandchildren who live with her. She and her daughter-in-law run a small grocery and butcher shop. The daughter-in-law tends the shop while Victoria handles the business of selling meat. Sadly, the family finances have taken a severe turn recently when Victoria's 8-year-old grandson was diagnosed with leukemia. They have exhausted their small savings taking him to Lima for treatment. Victoria has a plan to finance his treatment but needs capital in order to carry it out. With a loan of $375 hopes to bring meat from Tarma to Lima to sell while she stays with him through his treatment. Please help this family as they hope and work for their grandson's speedy recovery and return home.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Victoria D. 60 años D. edad, es una incansable madre D. familia, que con su esfuerzo y sacrificio, pudo brindarles una adecuada educación a sus hijos y ahora continua con ese mismo ánimo diligente apoyando a sus nietos que viven junto a ella. Ella posee una bodega junto a su nuera, quien generalmente la administra mientras ella se dedica íntegramente a la comercialización D. carnes; la realidad cambió drásticamente con la noticia D. que su nieto D. 8 años sufre D. leucemia, por lo cual utilizando los pocos ahorros tuvieron que llevarlo a Lima para su tratamiento.Con este nuevo reto desea comercializar carne en la ciudad D. Lima, llevándolo desD. Tarma, para así poder contribuir con su pequeño nieto, y también visitarlo periódicamente para atenderlo. Para ello necesita la suma D. 375 dólares, con los cuales pondrá en marcha sus planes.Ayudemos a doña Ana para que su pequeño nieto se recupere y pronto pueda regresar a casa con su familia

loans.use: To finance a butcher shop and pay for medical travel.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Fifty years old Angélica has five children, but only two are her dependants. She lives in Poblado Menor de Piscopampa in the Mache district of the Otuzco province in the La Libertad region. Through a partner, she became a member of the Communal Bank “Buen Pastor” of the Manuela Ramos Movement. With her first loan of 300 soles she purchased cereals (wheat, barley, lupin beans, etc.) and with subsequent loans she bought small animals.

She started her business distributing her products among her friends and acquaintances. She was always on the outlook for contacts to increase her clientele and now she sells in Piscopampa, Mache, Julcán and to some Trujillo merchants that go to her community to purchase goods.

The loans are of great help, as they allow her to lead a better life a little better and give her the opportunity to dedicate herself to an activity instead of being a slave of her household. With the recent loan obtained from Manuela Ramos, of approximately $667 and which will be repaid in six months, she will buy cereals, animals and also scrap bronze.

Not having the support of her parents, Ms. Angélica couldn’t finish her studies and was only able to reach fifth grade. She dreams of buying a load cart to be able to distribute her products satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica tiene 50 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos pero sólo 2 dependen de ella. Vive en el Poblado Menor de Piscopampa en el Distrito de Mache de la Provincia de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad. Por medio de una socia se pudo integrar al Banco Comunal “Buen Pastor” del Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Con el primer préstamo recibido de S/.300 soles compró cereales (trigo, cebada, chochos, etc.) y posteriormente con los otros préstamos compró animales menores.

Empezó su negocio distribuyendo sus productos entre sus amistades y a personas que conocía por medio de sus familiares. Buscaba siempre contactos para aumentar sus clientes y ahora vende en Piscopampa, Mache, Julcán y a algunos comerciantes de Trujillo que van a comprar a su comunidad.

Los préstamos le son de mucha ayuda, ya que puede vivir un poco mejor y tiene la oportunidad de dedicarse a algo y no estar esclavizada a su hogar. Con su reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 ($667 aprox.) y que será cancelado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará cereales, animales y también bronce (chatarra).

La señora Angélica no pudo concluir sus estudios porque no tuvo apoyo de sus padres, y sólo estudió hasta quinto grado de primaria. Sueña con comprar un carro de carga para poder distribuir satisfactoriamente sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals, small animals and scrap bronze.

loans.name: Katy Alicia

texts.es:
Katy is 36. She is married and has two small children. The family lives with Katy's mother who has helped them open a small shop in their home. Income from the shop and from the husband's job in public transportation allow them to support their family. Still, the couple dreams of buying a plot of land where they can build themselves a home and open a new shop as well as an auto garage. This would give the family stability and the children a home where they can play and grow up. Katy is striving to give her family a better standard of living and to do so she is asking for a loan to expand the products she sells.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Katy tiene 36 años y junto a su esposo forman un matrimonio joven que hasta hoy ha contado con el apoyo de su madre, ya que los instaló en su casa y los apoyó para aperturar una tienda para que puedan trabajar y solventar los gastos de sus 2 pequeños niños.De esta manera han podido satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos y ha podido adquirir en corto tiempo algunos bienes propios que han podido ser alcanzados gracias al arduo trabajo tanto en su bodega como en el transporte urbano.Pese a tener una base económica, ésta no es suficiente para que comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa a donde podrían trasladar su negocio de abarrotes y abrir una cochera; esto también daría estabilidad a sus hijos además de un inmueble cómodo en el que podrían jugar y divertirse libremente.Ahora ha puesto todo su empeño para incrementar la variedad de productos y acrecentar sus ingresos en pro de mejorar su nivel de vida familiar.

loans.use: To stock a general store.

loans.name: Angelita Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Angelita is 57 years old. She only studied up to 5th grade. She lives in Salpo district of the providence of Otuzco in the community of La Libertad. She has 5 children, but she only supports 2 of them. Before receiving her first loan from the bank she had a small business. She sold some vegetables and fruits. Now she has a stand that sells a variety of items in the providence of Salpo. Thanks to The Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to get money that helped her business out and to help pay for a good education for her children. With her first loan of about $96 she was able to buy a sack of rice, sugar, oil and vegetables and she was able to buy stands to exhibit the items she sells. With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of about $767 that will be paid of in 6 monthly payments. With the money she plans to supply her business and pay for her children’s university education. She dreams to expand her business that way she can convert it to a mini market and have her kids become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Angelita tiene 57 años de edad y estudió sólo hasta 5to. de primaria. Vive en Salpo distrito de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 5 hijos, pero solo 2 dependen de ella. Antes de recibir su primer crédito del Banco Comunal tenía un negocio muy pequeñito (vendía unas cuantas verduras y frutas) actualmente tiene una bodega surtida en el distrito de Salpo. Por medio de una vecina que le comentó que asistía a las charlas del Movimiento Manuela Ramos pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”. Gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos pudo tener un capital propio que le ayudó a ampliar su negocio y sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles una buna educación. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $96) compró un saco de arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras con los siguientes fue comprando otros productos y estantes para exhibirlos. El reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.2,300.00 ($ 767) y que será cancelado en 6 cuotas mensuales, podrá surtir su bodega y matricular a sus hijos en la universidad. Sueña con ampliar mucho mas su negocio para convertirlo en un minimarket y que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.

loans.use: Buy items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Abdulraman

texts.en: Abdulraman is married with six children and four of his children are in school.  Although he started his business more than five years ago, it was at a very small scale.  With his previous loan, he was able to expand the business and can now purchase six bales of clothing a month.  He still needs to expand the business more and is requesting a loan of $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Increase the number of clothing bales he purchases to increase his profit.

loans.name: Sheka

texts.en: F. dropped out of school due to lack of money and his father died when he was young.  He is 22 years old and single and owns a barber shop in the central town of Magburaka.   With the profits from his shop, he assists his mother with some cash for essential items.  He also supports his young sister and brother who are students.  He managed to purchase equipment for his barber shop and this has increased his clientele base.  He is requesting a larger loan of $175 to purchase more needed equipment and also for renting a better space for the business.

loans.use: Purchase additional equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Sra. Eva, 66, was born in Bellavista in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She went to a primary school there but no farther and she was needed by her parents from an early age to help out at home. When she was a young girl, she ran away from her mother's abuse to Huangamarca with the man who is now her husband.

They started from nothing after their families refused further help. They worked buying and selling grain and other foodstuffs but they lacked capital initially so they accepted an invitation from a neighbor to join the Huangamarca community bank. With their first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$96) from Manuela Ramos, they raised enough money to start their business and ultimately earned enough to buy their house and land for farming.

Eva had two children, one of whom died suddently, something that cast her into a deep depression during which she abandoned the business temporarily. She eventually overcame the tragedy, though, and returned to the business with the help of a new loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (about US$333), to be repaid in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy potatoes, wheat and beans that she'll haul to the coast, along with what her husband produces on his plot of land, for sale there.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city where she can quietly spend her remaining years.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Eva tiene 66 años de edad, nació en el caserío de Bellavista de la Provincia de Otuzco en el Departamento de La Libertad y estudió sólo primaria en la escuela de este caserío. Desde muy niña se dedicaba a ayudar a sus padres en la crianza de ganado; cuando era adolescente, debido al maltrato que su madre le propiciaba, abandonó su casa y se fue con el que actualmente es su esposo al caserío de Huangamarca.

Apoyándose ambos iniciaron de cero debido a que la familia les retiró el apoyo, se dedicaron a comprar y vender cereales, debido a que les faltaba capital para su negocio acepta la invitación de una vecina para ingresar al Banco Comunal “Huangamarca” y con su primer crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $96) completó el capital para la compra de cereales, desde ese momento iniciaron una mayor inversión y pudieron comprarse tierras de cultivo y su casa.

Tuvo dos hijos pero uno falleció repentinamente y eso la llevó a una fuerte depresión por lo que abandonó el negocio por un tiempo pero luego de superar esa crisis retomó el negocio y con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ($ 333 aprox.) el cual cancelará en 6 meses comprará papa seca, trigo y habas para llevar a vender a la costa junto con lo que su esposo producen en su chacra.

Su sueño es comprarse una casa en la ciudad donde pueda pasar una vejez tranquila.

loans.use: Buy grain and other foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie is 38 years old and married with three children.  She learned soap-making in one of the CCF skills training centers in Kabala in 2003, after which she obtained her first loan to start the business.  Although her husband works as a community mobilizer, Amine needed to supplement his salary to support the families expenses.  She therefore produces soap and distributes them to various village women on a weekly basis.  Very few people make soap in the district and Amie has an opportunity to increase her production.  She is therefore requesting $250.

loans.use: Purchase soap supplies for increased production.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is married with two children.  She started her business three years ago and has expanded it with the loans from SMT.  She sells her goods on the veranda in the kabala town of Sierra Leone.  Kadiatu, twenty one years old and a young woman, has a long way to go to improve her economic status.  Her dream is to rent a kiosk in the market and is therefore requesting a loan for the purpose and also to increase her stock.

loans.use: Rental of a kiosk to raise the profile of her business and achieve greater profits.

loans.name: Alfa

texts.en: Alfa started his business with the loans from SMT on a very small scale and was selling few tins of lotions, creams, and artificial hair outside the market.  With subsequent loans and profit, Alfa rented a small shop for his business and has had good sales.  He will complete his loan installment next month and he would like to access more loans to increase his stock.  Alfa is 28 years old and married with a child.

loans.use: Increase his stock of cosmetic items for sale to produce additional profits.

loans.name: Umaru B.

texts.en: Umaru is 43 years old and married with a child.  He sells soft drinks and distilled water in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone.  For the last two years, with the loans from SMT, Umaru has been managing his business progression.  He started his business with only five crates of drinks and six dozen distilled water bottles.  Now he has more than 15 crates of soft drinks and also sells the products in both retail and wholesale.  To increase more retail customers, Umaru plans to purchase a refrigerator for cooling the drinks and increasing his stock.  He is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Purchase needed equipment for his soft drink business to generate new customers.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama was trained by Christian Children’s Fund in tie and dye in 2002.  After the training, she obtained a loan of $40 to start the business.  She has been working diligently to improve her economic status.  Her business has increased so much that, with the subsequent loans, Adama can produce and sell five pairs of double bed sheets and materials that can make 12 female suits, per month.  Most of her customers are from Freetown, the capital city.  She needs more materials, caustic soda, and dyes to increase her production capacity and income.  For these purposes, she is requesting a loan of $250.  Adama is 42 years old and married with six children.

loans.use: Purchase materials for the production of her tye and dye items.

loans.name: Tigie Dankay

texts.en: Tigie is married with two children.  When asked as to whether she needs more loans, she said, SMT loans have changed her life for the better and she will be accessing the loans until she becomes financially self-sufficient.  Tigie is thirty five years old and she makes and sells tie dye materials which she started doing two years ago.  She meets her children’s education expenses from the business income.  She plans to increase her production and sell her items in Kenema town in eastern Sierra Leone.  She said a loan of $250 will enable her to increase her stock all at one time.

loans.use: Purchase materials to increase her production of tie and dye textiles.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is 32 years old and married with a child.  He started his business five years ago, and has been with SMT since 2004.  Abdul’s business has expanded since then with small and subsequent loans from SMT.  He sells soft drinks and beer, both wholesale and retail. With the profits, Abdul was able to purchase a refrigerator and a small generator. Moving to the 7th loan cycle, he is requesting a larger loan to expand the business further.  Abdul would like to purchase chairs and tables for customers to sit on while enjoying their cold drinks.

loans.use: Introduce a space for his customers to sit and enjoy his products with the hopes they invest more.

loans.name: Kadi

texts.en: Kadi has been in business for the last 10 years, even during the civil war.  She started the business with capital of $100.  In 2004, she joined SMT, and has been with the program for four years. Kadi was selling local items such as rice, palm oil, and other agricultural products. With the loans from SMT, her business expanded so much that she decided to open a boutique in the town of Makeni.  Kadi would like to establish her business as a wholesale shop and is requesting a loan of  $1050.  Kadi is married with four children.

loans.use: Establish a wholesale boutique.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a single mother aged thirty three with one daughter of eight. She stays in a one-room house. She operates a retail shop where she sells a variety of household commodities like sugar, salt, curry powder, maize flour, rice, sweets, biscuits and drinks. Joyce has been running this business for the last five years. It is her sole source of income and covers the rent and food for the family plus school fees for her daughter, who is in primary level. She would like to borrow $900 to buy more stock to increase her income. This will be an assurance of a meal every day and other basic needs.

loans.use: Purchase of stock

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
Mrs. Jiménez has a small shop located on the edge of the central market of León. The business has been in existence for a little more than six years. She has worked hard and sacrificed, because she previously sold general merchandise (clothing, shoes, gold, etc.), which she brought from Panamá.

Following a very painful event in her life, which was the horrific murder of her only son, she fell into a terrible depression and her business went downhill. After recovering from this difficult loss, she started selling inexpensive clothing and costume jewelry on a sidewalk in the central market with $200.00 of capital. After a year she was able to get into the shop where she is now located. Mrs. Jiménez has two daughters, 20 and 25 years old, for whom she is providing. They are studying Medicine and Pharmacy in the UNAN (National Autonomous University or Nicaragua). She has been working with CEPRODEL for more than 2 years.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta señora posee un pequeño módulo ubicado en las afueras del mercado central de León. El negocio tiene poco más de seis años de existencia. La historia de esta señora ha sido de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, ya que anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a la comercialización de mercadería en general la cual traía de Panamá (ropa, zapatos, oro, etc.

Luego de un acontecimiento muy doloroso en su vida en el cual le asesinan atrozmente a su único hijo varón, ella cae en una depresión terrible y su negocio de viene abajo, luego de reponerse de este duro golpe, ella establece un pequeño puesto de ropa barata y bisutería en la acera del mercado central, con un pequeño capital de aproximadamente US$ 200 dólares. Luego de un año de lucha logra conseguir el local en donde ella ahora se encuentra ubicada. La señora Jiménez tiene a dos hijas a su cargo de 25 y 20 años respectivamente, las cuales cursan sus estudios de Medicina y Farmacia en la UNAN (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua). Ella tiene más de 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (loan of $1900.00)

loans.name: Luisa Julia

texts.es:
Luisa is 56 years old and she completed high school. She lives in the Salpo district, Otuzco province, Liberty state. She has only one son that depends on her. Today she buys basic necessities in Trujillo and also from some carriers that arrive at her locale to supply her store. She also has other businesses: a restaurant, she rents rooms, showers, and bathrooms.

Thanks to the invitation of a friend she joined the Communal Bank "Virgen de las Mercedes," and with the first loan from Manuela Ramos of 200 soles (approximately $96) she bought rice, sugar, and oil in small quantities. She noticed also that the workers in this area didn't have a place where they could meet some of their basic needs; so she decided with the next loans to open a resaturant called "La Amistad" (Friendship), and she arranged her house to rent rooms and bathroom services; recently she installed a phone booth business too.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos of 2300 soles (approximately $767), which will be paid in 6 installments, she will buy 6 beds for the bedrooms and more cell phones for the phone service. Luisa is President of the Mothers Club and belongs to the community health support committee. She dreams of buying a small van to be able to transport the merchandise that she buys outside her district and she hopes to improve the rooms of her house to meet the expectations of whomever wishes to use her facilities, in other words to offer greater convenience and customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luisa tiene 56 años de edad y estudió secundaria completa. Vive en el distrito de Salpo de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene solo un hijo que depende de ella. Actualmente compra productos de primera necesidad en la provincia de Trujillo y también a algunos transportistas que llegan al lugar para surtir su bodega. Paralelamente tiene otro negocio de restaurante, alquiler de habitaciones, de duchas y servicios higiénicos.

Gracias a la invitación de una amiga se integró al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $96) compró arroz, azúcar, aceite en pocas cantidades. Observó también que los trabajadores de la zona no tenían un lugar donde puedan satisfacer algunas de sus necesidades; así que decide con sus siguientes préstamos abrir un restaurante llamado “La Amistad”, y arregla su casa para alquilar habitaciones y servicios higiénicos; recientemente a emprendido el negocio de locutorio.

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela ramos de S/.2,300.00 ($ 767 ) el mismo que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 6 camas para las habitaciones y más celulares para el locutorio. La señora Luisa López es Presidenta del club de Madres y pertenece al comité de apoyo del centro de salud.. Sueña con comprar una camioneta pequeña para poder transportar la mercadería que compra fuera de su distrito y desea mejorar las habitaciones de su casa para cubrir las expectativas de cualquier persona que desea el servicio, es decir brindar mayor comodidad.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and communications equipment.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.es:
This woman owns a small food court in the León bus station market. She works hard to keep her business growing. She started it over 15 years ago with only $150 selling soft drinks, juice and other beverages from a thermos filled with ice.

Nevertheless, with the help of her children, she began preparing meals at home and selling them from her current store. At the time, the conditions were a lot different than they are now, she only had a table and six plastic chairs. Gradually she began seeing the fruits of her labor. With the help of loans granted to her by CEPRODEL, with whom she has worked for more than 3 years, and thanks to the collective efforts of her family, she has made other improvements to her business. Her hard work has allowed her to prepare her children for the working world.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora posee un pequeño comedor ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de León. Esta señora ha luchado fuertemente por hacer crecer su negocio. Ella empieza desde hace más de 15 años con un pequeño capital de US$ 150 dólares vendiendo gaseosas, jugos y otras bebidas con un termo con hielo.

Sin embargo, con la ayuda de sus hijos, empieza a preparar comida, la cual era elaborada en su casa y vendida en el local que actualmente posee (claro que las condiciones del mismo era muy diferente al actual), solamente tenía una mesa y seis sillas plásticas. Poco a poco la actividad fue rindiendo frutos, por medio de los créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL, con quien tiene más de 3 años de trabajar y al esfuerzo conjunto de su familia ella ha logrado realizar otras mejoras a su negocio. Gracias al esfuerzo realizado ella ha logrado preparar profesionalmente a sus 4 hijos.

loans.use:
Purchase of equipment and infrastructure ($3,250.00 loan)

Compra de equipos e infraestructura (prestamo por US$3,250.00)

loans.name: Zenaida Marcionila

texts.es:
Zenaida is 66 years old and has 10 children, but only her daughter and granddaughter are dependent upon her. She completed the third grade in elementary school. She married at 17 years old, and for a while suffered abuse from her spouse. She lives in the Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, Libertad state. She saw herself as obligated to begin a business at 8 years old, selling bread and bananas as she was orphaned without a father. Later she worked selling food in Quiruvilca in the Santiago de Chuco province.

Today she buys and sells fruits and candy, offering her products to all the cars that pass by Agallpampa, and she also raises pigs and sheep. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres del Mañana” (Women of Tomorrow), with her first loan of 300 soles (approximately $96), she began selling fruit and candy to the cars, and left the selling of food in Quiruvilca as it is a mining zone far from her community. With the current loan from Manuela Ramos of 800 soles (approximately $287), which she will pay in 6 monthly installments, she will buy pigs and guinea pigs to raise and sell at Christmas.

Senaida was supervisor of "the glass of milk," an initiative that she administered in the Trujillo province to benefit the children and aged of her community. She dreams that all her children live well economically. In addition she wishes to have an extended business in her home so she doesn't have to go to the sell to the cars because she is suffering from diabetes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zenaida tiene 66 años de edad y tiene 10 hijos pero solamente dependen de ella su hija y su nieta. Estudió hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Se caso a la edad de 17 años, por un tiempo sufrió el maltrato de su esposo. Vive en el Distrito de Agallpampa, Provincia de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad. Se vio obligada a empezar a trabajar a los 8 años de edad en la venta de pan y plátanos debido a que se quedó huérfana de padre. Mas adelante trabajó vendiendo comida en Quiruvilca en la provincia de Santiago de Chuco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y golosinas subiendo a ofrecer sus productos a todos los carros que pasan por Agallpampa y a la crianza de cerdos y carneros. Es socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Mañana”, con su primer crédito de S/.300 (aproximadamente $96) empezó la venta de frutas y golosinas en los carros y dejó la venta de comida en Quiruvilca debido a que es una zona minera alejada de su comunidad. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($.267 aprox.) el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas mensuales, comprará cerdos y cuyes para engordarlos y venderlos en navidad.

La señora Zenaida fue fiscalizadora del vaso de leche que ella gestionó en la provincia de Trujillo para beneficiar a los niños y ancianos de su comunidad. Sueña con que todos sus hijos vivan bien económicamente, además desea tener un negocio más amplio en su casa para no tener que estar subiendo a los carros porque esta padeciendo de diabetes.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Gregoria Daysi

texts.es:
This woman works selling soft drinks, juice and sweets in the León bus station market. She has run this business for more than 30 years, first from the sidewalk outside San Juan church. Fifteen years ago, she moved to the new location (also on the sidewalk) where she could have better sales.

It has been very difficult for her to expand her business, progress has been slow due to her family which depends on her. She has 7 children, the 3 youngest still live at home. She began by selling sweets from a small crate and then successfully added juice and soft drink sales. She is married, and her husband is a security guard. He helps with the family expenses, but his income is low. She has been working with CEPRODEL for more than 3 years.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora posee un pequeño puesto de ventas de gaseosas, jugos y golosinas ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de buses de la ciudad de León. El negocio tiene más de 30 años de existencia ya que originalmente el negocio inicia en las aceras de la Iglesia San Juan, pero luego se traslada a este espacio (que también es en la acera) en donde hay una mayor afluencia de compradores, desde hace mas de 15 años.

A esta señora se le ha dificultado mucho el poder hacer crecer su negocio, su desarrollo ha sido más lento debido en buena medida a la pesada carga familiar que posee, con 7 hijos en total, de los cuales aún tiene 3 menores a su cargo. Ella inicia con la venta de golosinas y un pequeño canasto y posteriormente agrega la venta de jugos y gaseosas, con buenos resultados. Ella es casada, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad y aunque él le ayuda con los gastos de la casa su sueldo es muy bajo. Tiene más de 3 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise to increase inventory

Compra de mercaderia para hacer crecer inventario

loans.name: Samaria Concepcion

texts.es:
Mrs. A. owns a small unisex hair salon. She began this business more than 10 years ago; at first she only had two employees, and the site's conditions were very crude, the floor was slightly covered in cement and the walls did not meet proper working standards.

As time went by, she used the profits from her work to slowly improve the place, hired two new employees (there are now 4 hairdressers), replastered the walls, installed a ceramic floor and improved the entire service area. In addition, Mrs. Alemán put herself in charge of reforming the public restrooms in the bus station, and the little money she makes from that job is another source of income for her family. She has been married for over 4 years, and her husband has a stand where he sells clothes as well as a collective transportation route. They have a two-year-olod son and they would like to continue improving their lives. It is thanks to CEPRODEL that this woman has been able keep growing and improving little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora posee un puesto de servicio de corte de cabello para damas y caballeros el cual inicia hace más de 10 años, al principio ella tenía únicamente dos trabajadores y las condiciones del local eran muy rústicas, el piso estaba ligeramente cubierto con cemento y las paredes prestaban las condiciones mínimas para laborar.

Con el paso del tiempo, producto de la actividad desempeñada se fueron paulatinamente realizando las mejoras del local, se contrataron dos nuevos trabajadores (actualmente hay 4 peluqueros en total) se repellaron paredes, se puso el piso de cerámica y se mejoró el área total de servicio. Además, la señora Alemán, se hizo cargo del acondicionamiento básico de los baños públicos de la terminal, por lo cual cobra un pequeño costo por el uso de los servicios, lo que representa un ingreso adicional para su hogar. Ella tiene poco más de 4 años de casada y su esposo posee un puesto de venta de ropa y una ruta de transporte colectivo. Tienen un hijo de dos años y esperan poder ir mejorando sus condiciones. Es gracias al apoyo brindado por CEPRODEL que esta señora ha logrado ir creciendo poco a poco.

loans.use:
Purchase of hair-cutting materials

Compra de productos para barberia

loans.name: Mercedes De Los Sant

texts.es:
This lady is the owner of a small fruit and vegetable stand in the León bus station market. The makeshift stand only has a plastic cover, and she displays the products in the crates they are transported in. Her husband helps her with the supply and transport of the merchandise. Her three children are still living at home.

Thanks to a lifetime of effort dedicated to this business, she has been able to build a modest home. Nevertheless, she has to keep struggling to be able to meet one of her main goals: providing an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora posee un pequeño puesto de venta de frutas y verduras ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de buses de la ciudad de León. El puesto es improvisado, cuyo techo este hecho totalmente de plástico y el producto se exhibe directamente en los canastos donde es transportado. Su esposo es quien le ayuda con el abastecimiento y transporte de la mercadería. Tiene un total de 3 hijos los cuales están aún a su cargo.

Gracias al esfuerzo de toda una vida dedicada a este negocio ella logra construir su humilde vivienda. Sin embargo, aún necesita seguir luchando por brindarles educación a sus hijos, uno de sus principales objetivos.

loans.use:
Purchase of produce for her business

Compra de productos perecederos para retroalimentacion de su negocio

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela A. M. is married and has 7 children, ages 28, 27, 26, 25, 26, 25, 24, 23 and 17. The eldest 5 have jobs and families of their own. She began her dairy product sales (cheese, cream, butter, etc.) over 7 years ago with only 1,000 Córdobas or $53 USD, selling hard and fresh cheeses.

Previously she sold seafood in the bus terminal market, but found that job to be unprofitable for her. Because of their age, she and her husband work together. He is in charge of buying the products and setting up the stand, and, when she has to step out, he also helps sell the products. The stand does not have a fixed site, but only a table for displaying the products and a black plastic cover. She told us that one of her greatest desires would be for the stand to have its own plot of land, since they currently set it up on the sidewalk.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora es casada, con un total de 7 hijos, todos con edades seguidas (28, 27, 26, 25, 26, 25, 24, 23 y 17 años de edad), ya los mayores trabajan y formaron su familia, exceptuando a los dos menores. Ella inicia el puesto de venta de lácteos (queso, crema, mantequilla, etc.) hace más de 7 años con un reducido capital de trabajo de C$ 1,000 córdobas, vendiendo quesos duros y frescos.

Anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a la venta mariscos en el M. de la terminal, pero esa actividad no le era rentable. Su esposo trabaja con ella por ser ambos ya personas un tanto mayores. Él se encarga de las compras y la instalación diaria del puesto, también le ayuda con la venta cuando ella tiene que salir. El puesto no posee un local propiamente dicho, únicamente tiene una mesa en donde coloca el producto y un techo hecho totalmente de plástico negro, ella nos manifiesta que uno de sus mayores deseos en cuanto al negocio se refiere es tener su propio tramo, ya que actualmente se encuentra ubicada en la acera.

loans.use:
Purchase of goods and ingredients.

Compra de mercaderia e insumos

loans.name: Selmira María

texts.es:
Selmira has a small outpost selling perishable goods, fruits and vegetables located in the market inside the León bus terminal. She has fought all of her life looking for ways to provide for her family. She is a single mother of four. Previously she ran a small sowing shop out of her home, which helped her afford sending three of her four children to graduate school to earn Law and Engineering degrees. Her other child has stayed with her to help with the store.

Her sowing business failed because of the rise in cost of raw materials, which made businesses like hers no longer competitive with their primary rival: used American clothing. So, with the savings and capital she had previously invested in her clothing business, she was able to purchase a site for her sales post. Her store has been in business four years now and has grown in size and variety, Selmira says.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Esta señora posee un pequeño puesto de venta de productos perecederos, frutas y verduras ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de buses de León. Esta señora ha luchado toda su vida por buscar formas de proporcionar todo lo necesario para su familia. Siendo madre soltera con cuatro hijos, anteriormente tenía un pequeño taller de costura que operaba desde su casa, con el cual logró proporcionar educación superior universitaria a tres de sus cuatro hijos quienes se recibieron de Ingenieros y licenciados, solamente uno de sus hijos el cual es aún soltero se quedó con ella laborando y asistiéndole en su puesto.

El negocio de costura fracasó debido al aumento de los precios de materias primas, los cuales vuelven no competitivos estos tipos de negocios frente a su principal competidor: La ropa usada americana, con quienes no pueden competir por precio. Sin embargo, con unos ahorros y el capital que antes estaba invertido en la ropa, logró comprar el local en donde está ubicado el puesto de venta. El negocio tiene más de cuatro años de existencia y ha venido creciendo de tamaño y variedad de productos según manifiesta su propietaria.

loans.use: Purchase perishable goods

loans.name: Eufracina Salisa

texts.es:
Salisa es una madre, que juntamente a su esposo se dedica al desarrollo de actividad diligentemente para brindarle bienestar y satisfacción a su única hija, Katy, que hoy tiene 20 años y tuvo que interrumpir sus estudios de industrias alimentarias en la capital debido a su delicada salud.Por este hecho sus padres se sienten muy angustiados, porque la salud de su única hija, quién ha estado llevando un tratamiento muy largo le está propiciando grandes inversiones de tiempo y dinero no previstos en su economía, sin embargo están dispuestos a salir adelante mostrando entereza y optimismo para mejorar su situación y brindarle mayores atenciones a su estrellita. Y ahora Katy, después de su parcial mejoría ha decidido trabajar en el extranjero para poder ayudar a sus padres y más adelante regresar y prepararse profesionalmente.Sin embargo los gastos para los trámites y demás requerimientos son costosos y su querida madre ha tenido que invertir los pocos ahorros que obtuvo con mucho esfuerzo, los mismos que pensaba invertir en esta última siembra para mejorar sus productos agrícolas y sus ventas; para que pueda lograr lo que se propone esta joven muchacha.Pese al apuro que tiene, también le embarga la pena de ver partir a su hija hacia tierras muy lejanas, pero sabe que todo cuanto puede hacer es únicamente para verla contenta y satisfecha.Ahora y con un proyecto a cuestas Salisa solicita la suma de 275 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para las pequeñas parcelas de cultivo que mantiene en el pequeño huerto de su hogar a fin de obtener hermosas zanahorias y rocotos.Con su colaboración podremos dar una sonrisa a una madre que sufre por la pronta partida de su hija.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Salisa is a mother, who together with her husband diligently began the development of this venture in order to provide for the wellbeing and happiness of their only daughter, Katy, who today is 20 years old. She recently had to interrupt her college studies in Lima due to poor health. Because of this, her parents have been very concerned, because her long and intensive treatments have cost them large amounts of time and money that they were not expecting. However, they are determined to continue on, showing optimism that their situation will improve and they will provide better care for their precious daughter. Now, Katy, after partially recovering, has decided to find work to help her parents pay the bills. The costs of transportation are expensive and they have begun to dip into their savings in order to continue improving the quality of the agricultural products they sell, in order to continue to be able to provide for their young daughter. All of these issues have weighed heavily on their family, but they are determined to do whatever it takes to be able to take care of Katy. Now Salisa is asking for a loan of $275 to invest in the purchase of fertilizers for the small parcels of land that she maintains in the small orchard near their home where she grows carrots and other root vegetables. WIth your cooperation we'll be able to put a smile on the face of a mother who has sacrificed a lot to provide for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
This is the story of Fredy who, at the young age of 24, has managed to make a path for himself, working the lands he inherited from his parents, with great effort but, above all, with great love, as the lands constitute his patrimony. In spite of being already independent and not having responsibilities towards others, he wishes to increase his production, so that, when he decides to start a family, he’ll be able to offer them financial stability and a cozy place where to share many happy moments. He saves everyday toward this end, and remains a good son to his mother, helping her out financially whenever necessary and providing a little extra money for his younger brothers’ well-being. In this way, Fredy helps his loved ones and works to ensure a promising future for himself. In order for his dreams and wishes to come true, he needs the support of your generous heart. With it, he’ll be able to improve his products and increase his income and savings to then start his family. With your collaboration he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta es la historia de Fredy, un joven de tan solo 24 años que, a su corta edad, ha podido abrirse paso en la vida trabajando las tierras que le heredaron sus padres, con mucho empeño pero más que nada con mucho cariño, por ser parte de su patrimonio.A pesar de ser ya independiente y de no tener responsabilidades con otras personas, el desea hacer crecer su producción para que, cuando decida conformar su familia, pueda ofrecerles estabilidad económica y un lugar acogedor para compartir muchas alegrías. Es por ello que ahorra diariamente y no deja de ser un buen hijo para con su madre, ayudándola económicamente todas las veces que sea necesario y aportando un dinerito extra para el bienestar de sus hermanos menores. De esta manera, Fredy ayuda a sus seres queridos y trabaja para forjarse un futuro prometedor. Para que sus sueños y anhelos se hagan realidad requiere del apoyo de su generoso corazón. Con él podrá mejorar sus productos e incrementar sus ingresos y ahorros para luego conformar su familia.Con su colaboración podrá cristalizar en poco tiempo sus anhelos.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Isaura Margarita

texts.es:
Isaura's small business selling fruits and vegetables is located in the outskirts of the market inside the León bus station. The post is along the sidewalk under a black plastic roof, with the products displayed in the baskets they are transported in. She is married and has three kids, all of whom are studying education.

The business has been around 11 years, always located in the same place. Her husband works as a security guard, but his income isn't enough to cover all the household expenses. In spite of their modest means, the family owns a home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El pequeño negocio de venta de frutas y verduras que esta señora posee está ubicado en las afueras del mercado La estación de la ciudad de León. El puesto se encuentra sobre la acera bajo un techo improvisado hecho totalmente de plástico negro y donde el producto se exhibe en canastas en los cuales se transportan los productos. Ella es acompañada y tiene un total de tres hijos todos ellos estudiando el ciclo básico.

El negocio tiene más de 11 años de existir, siempre ubicada en el mismo lugar. Su pareja labora como guarda de seguridad pero sus ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir todos los gastos familiares. Tiene un total de 3 hijos todos ellos están cursando su ciclo básico de educación. A pesar de lo modesto de sus ingresos ella posee su humilde vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa is 53 years old and despite her advancing age she still counts on her energy and strength to continue doing business making delicious cheeses, which she produces in her small home. She transports her cheeses, along with other products (such as meats and vegetables) from her town, to the country's capital every two weeks and sells them in markets where many families go to shop and can enjoy her products. Her cheese business has enabled her to improve her childrens' quality of life, and now she's helping her grandchildren too, who have become her greatest joy and who live in her home. One of the ways she's looking to improve her situation is to sell more cheese and products and make enough money to expand the size of her house. She promises to continue to work hard in order to grow her business and improve their quality of life. With your help we pray that these loving grandparents can continue with their hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa tiene 53 años a pesar D. su avanza edad aún siguen contando con suficiente vitalidad y fuerza para seguir comercializando, los deliciosos quesos que preparan en su modesta casita.Estos quesos son ofertados quincenalmente en la ciudad capital D. su país, los cuales son llevados desD. su modesta localidad, conjuntamente con otros productos como carnes y verduras, para poder ofrecerlos en los mercados para deleite D. las familias limeñas. Con esta labor a lo largo del tiempo han podido otorgarle bienestar y alimento a cada uno D. sus hijos. Y ahora también se lo brindan a sus pequeños nietos, quienes se han convertido en su mayor alegría, ya que viven con ellos en la casa que se ha convertido en recinto D. una numerosa familia.Para seguir contribuyendo con su bienestar desean incrementar el capital D. su negocio y prometen trabajar arduamente con el fin D. generar mejores ingresos económicos para su familia. Con su contribución lograremos que estos abuelitos cariñosos sigan con las mismas ganas D. trabajar.

loans.use: Incremental capital to be used to grow her small business of making and selling cheese.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa has a small fruit stand located in the outskirts of the market inside the old railroad station in León. The post is simple, covered with a black plastic roof to protect from the strong sun. She has had the post for more than 20 years, before which she made and sold nacatamales, a popular regional dish, but it was very hard work and she cooked with firewood so the earnings were very small.

Rosa is a single mother of three, all of whom are now making a living on their own. Her oldest son migrated to Costa Rica due to the lack of gainful employment in his home country, leaving his son in the care of Rosa, his grandmother. Her humble business earns her enough to keep going. After years of hard work, she also has her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Esta señora posee un pequeño puesto de Venta de frutas ubicado en las afueras del mercado de la antigua estación del ferrocarril de la ciudad de León. El puesto es sencillo improvisado con techo de plástico negro para protegerse de los fuertes rayos solares. El negocio tiene más de 20 años de existir, según manifiesta, antes se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales (plato típico nicaragüense)pero esta actividad es más sacrificada porque se cocina con leña y sin embargo las ganancias eran muy pocas.

Ella es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, los cuales ha sacado adelante sola. Su hijo mayor tuvo que migrar a Costa Rica, por la falta de oportunidad de empleo que hay en el país, de este muchacho ella tiene un nieto a su cargo. Su negocio es muy humilde y le permite asegurar su subsistencia. Ella luego de muchos años de esfuerzo logra poseer su pequeña y humilde vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Rosa Filomena

texts.es:
Rosa is a senior citizen, who has worked in the same sector since she was very young. She says she has been in business for more than 50 years. She started out making her own plastic bags since those were the market conditions at the time. That later become impossible after big business exerted control so that now plastic and other raw materials can only be bought wholesale and in large quantities. So she decided to become a middle-man, since that had more possibilities.

Thanks to the sale of plastic bags, Rosa has been able to raise 11 children, 8 of whom are still alive and have their own families. She has a grandson under her care, and he helps her at her sales stand located in the market inside the old train station in León. Her children, she says, help her when they can, but she essentially runs her business and her grandson's. Thanks to her hard work she owns her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Esta señora es una anciana, quien desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en este mismo tipo de negocio. Según manifiesta, el negocio tiene más de 50 años de existir. Al principio ella elaboraba sus propias bolsas porque las condiciones del mercado así se lo permitían, sin embargo, luego se hizo imposible, debido a que las grandes empresas ejercieron un control tal que ahora el plástico y otros insumos derivados solamente se puede comprar al por mayor y en fuertes cantidades, por lo cual se vio en la necesidad de ser una simple intermediaria detallista, lo cual es más acorde a sus posibilidades.

Gracias a la venta de bolsas plásticas ella ha logró criar a sus 11 hijos de los cuales 8 viven, ya son adultos y tienen su propia familia. Ella aún tiene a un nieto a su cargo el cual le acompaña y le ayuda con la venta en el puesto, el cual está ubicado en el mercado de la antigua estación del ferrocarril de la ciudad de León. Sus hijos, manifiesta ella ,le ayudan en lo que pueden, pero prácticamente ella se mantiene así misma y a su nieto de su propio negocio. Producto de su esfuerzo ella posee su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase plastics

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha runs a small grains store located in the market inside León's old train station. She ran a convenience store out of her home for a number of years, but due to low sales she was forced to look for other options. After a lot of hard work she got the opportunity to get this simple stand in the popular market about six years ago. Because of low capital, it was very difficult for her at first because her earnings were insufficient to buy her own food and for a time she was malnourished.

This humble business has allowed Martha to support her husband and educate her children. Her husband works as a security guard at city hall, but his salary is insufficient to cover all the family's needs. She has three children, two of whom are in high school and one in elementary school. After years of very hard work she was able to get her own home. Rosa and her family continue their "fight" to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Esta señora posee un pequeño negocio de abarrotería (Venta de granos básicos), ubicado en el mercado de la antigua estación del ferrocarril de la ciudad de León. Ella trabajó por varios años con una pulpería en su casa de habitación y ante las bajas ventas le sobrevino la necesidad de buscar otras opciones de trabajo o negocio presentándose luego de mucho sacrificio la oportunidad de obtener este sencillo local a manera de caseta en este populoso mercado desde hace 6 años aproximadamente y por ser un capital reducido al principio fue muy difícil porque lo que vendía no le alcanzaba ni para su propia comida y en ocasiones no se alimentaba bien.

Este humilde negocio le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo en la formación y educación académica de sus hijos. Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad en la alcaldía de León, en donde el salario no le permite por sí solo solventar todas las necesidades de su familia. Ella tiene un total de tres hijos, de los cuales dos estudian en secundaria y uno en primaria. Tras el esfuerzo de muchos años logra obtener su humilde vivienda. Ella junto a su familia continúa su lucha (expresa ella) por sobrevivir y por buscar la mejoría de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase rice, corn, beans, etc.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
This woman has a small sales business of basic grains located in the market at the old railway station in the city of Leon. She has had her business for a little longer than 8 years, which began with a small amount of capital when she was faced with the hardship of supporting her family. The business began with the sales of corn and wheat, but the result of her efforts as a entrepreneur helped her to add a greater variety of products to her business. However, before increasing her market, she sold the corn and wheat on the street. Even before selling the basic grains, she used to sell bread from her bicycle.

She is a single woman and doesn't have any children. She lives with her parents who are old and cannot work. For that reason she is the main support for the family. In addition to her parents, her grandmother also lives in the same home and is very old. As one can see, the case of this woman is full of struggle and the search for different ways to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora posee un pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos ubicado en el mercado de la antigua Estación del ferrocarril de la ciudad de León. Ella tiene poco más de 8 años de tener el negocio el cual empezó con un modesto capital ante la necesidad de apoyar a su familia, el negocio inicia con la venta de un par de sacos de maíz y trigo, pero producto del esfuerzo la microempresaria fue agregando una mayor variedad de productos. Sin embargo, antes de ingresar al mercado, ella vendía maíz y trigo en la calle e incluso antes de los granos básicos ella vendía Pan en una bicicleta de forma ambulante.

Ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, a pesar de esto vive con sus padres los cuales son mayores y no pueden trabajar, por lo cual ella se constituye el sostén de su casa, además de sus padres habita en la misma casa su abuelita, la cual está ya muy anciana. Como puede observarse el caso de esta señora está lleno lucha y la búsqueda de diferentes formas de ganarse la vida.

loans.use: Compra de granos para retroalimentar su negocio

loans.name: Karla Martina

texts.es:
This woman owns a modest clothing stand selling used American clothes (known in Nicaragua as "pacas;" or "bulk clothing.") She has had this business for a bit longer than 12 years, she started it with $105 and the purchase of a small package of bulk clothing. She initially began by informally running her business out of a room of her house, and later moved to the market and began to show her merchandise in a small hut made of wood with a black plastic roof. With the inclement sun in the city of Leon (one of the hottest cities in Nicaragua,) she began to invest in the purchase of the small bulk packages of clothing. Thanks to God (she said herself,) the sales went well enough at first. She had little competition, an inexpensive product, a good location, etc.

The competition increased later on, however, which made things more difficult despite her efforts and sacrifice. Mrs. A. managed to make gradual improvements to her small sales stand, changing the plastic roofing for Zinc to protect her merchandise from the rain. In order to offer better service for her customers, she expanded her space for sales and with some loans she made provisions for her business, little by little. There are still many aspects to improve, however, if we review her business history, the improvement is obvious. Mrs. Karla has 2 children, both are school-aged and studying. Her husband works as an electrician, but it is not a stable job which is why Mrs. Karla's business is the primary source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora posee un modesto puesto de venta de ropa usada americana (conocida en Nicaragua como pacas) desde hace poco más de 12 años, el cual inició con aproximadamente US$ 105 dólares y la compra de una pequeña paca (paquete de ropa usada), de manera informal en su casa de habitación, luego se traslada al mercado y empieza a exhibir su mercadería en una pequeña caseta hecha de madera y con el techo construido con plástico negro, con el inclemente sol de la ciudad de León (una de las ciudades más calientes de Nicaragua) en ese momento invertía en la compra de dos pequeños paquetes, gracias a Dios (expresa ella misma) la venta le fue bastante bien al principio, poca competencia, un producto barato, buena ubicación, etc.

Sin embargo, luego que la competencia aumentó las cosas se hicieron más difíciles, a pesar de esto producto del esfuerzo y sacrificio por sobrevivir, la señora A. logró ir haciendo mejoras paulatinas a su pequeño puesto de ventas, cambió el techo de plástico por zinc, sobre todo para proteger la mercadería de la lluvia y ofrecer un mejor servicio, amplió el espacio de venta y con varios créditos fue surtiendo poco a poco su negocio. Aún le quedan muchos aspectos por mejorar, sin embargo, si revisamos su historia la mejoría ha sido notoria. Doña Karla tiene dos hijos, ambos en edad escolar y estudiando, su esposo labora como electricista, pero no de forma estable, sino por trabajo.
