Esto ocasiona que su negocio sea el principal sostén de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (bulk packages of used clothing)

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es:
Ms. Grimaldina belongs to “Las Victorias” Communal Bank and lives in the San Martín region of the Mariscal Cáceres province of the Juanjui district. Her business is located in her own home, as she has a large stretch of land, suitable for her activity of raising animals (pigs, sheep, goats and chickens). In parallel, she has been venturing in the sales business, selling clothes, sneakers and sandals, for which she first looks for interested clients. In both business, she counts with the support of her children, who are in charge of procuring the food for the animals, as well as looking for merchants for the sale of her apparel and shoes.

With the latest loan of $667, obtained from Manuela Ramos and which will be repaid in four months, she will buy merchandise from the coast, specifically six dozens of sneakers of different types, sandals and packs of blouses and polo shirts. In this opportunity, she will only bring orders and other things that will sell quickly.

Ms. Grimaldina is 55 years old, and a single mother of seven children who still depend on her, but help her on both businesses. Years of experience have turned her into a wise and perseverant woman, willing to forge ahead and help others; an example of constant fight and great generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Grimaldina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Victorias y vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui. Su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio, ya que cuenta con un terreno grande, apropiado para la crianza de sus animales (cerdos, ovejas, cabritos y gallinas) actividad a la que se dedica. Paralelamente está incursionando en el negocio de la venta de mercadería como ropa, zapatillas y sandalias, para lo cual, primero busca clientes a quienes colocar la mercadería. En ambos negocios cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes se encargan de conseguir el alimento para los animales y buscar comerciantes para la venta de la mercadería.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 667.00), el cual será pagado en un plazo de 4 meses, comprará mercadería de la costa, que consistirá en 6 docenas de zapatillas (diferentes tipos), sandalias y paquetes de blusas y polos. En esta oportunidad solo traerá pedidos y algunas cosas más que se venderán rápidamente.

La señora Grimaldina tiene 55 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos que aún dependen de ella. En el negocio de la crianza y venta de animales cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, así como en el negocio de la venta de mercadería. Los años de experiencia han hecho de ella una mujer sabia, perseverante y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar al prójimo, ejemplo de mujer de lucha constante y con una generosidad grande.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (clothes and shoes).

loans.name: Ylemis Jean

texts.en:
Ylemis, 34 years old, is a very dynamic and ambitious woman. She is married, with four children (3 girls and a boy). She is from Haiti, the neighbor country of the Dominican Republic and has been living in our country for more than fifteen years. Ylemis is member of a group called Mujeres Inmigrantes de San Cristobal. The group is formed of women and young girls who all are professionals in the area of sewing. They have rented a locale where they run their workgroup.

Recently, Ylemis has gotten a contract with a small company which needs some uniforms for the employees. The entrepreneur needs a loan in order to buy cloth, thread and other raw materials so that she can satisfy her new client's demand. That way, Ylemis will increase her income and will be able to continue improving her family's life.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of cloth, thread, zippers and other raw materials to continue producing clothes for her business

loans.name: Gudelia Satalaya

texts.es:
Gudelia lives in the San Martín area of the Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui district. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers). Her business is located in market number 1 and she sells merchandise such as clothing, CDs, DVDs, perfumes, shampoo, etc. She has experience in business, since she was very young she worked in various stores and this motivated her to have her own business which permits her to improve her family’s economic situation and educate her children.

With the loan from Manuela Ramos of 2500 soles (approximately $833), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more products to broaden her merchandise business (clothing by the dozen, CDs and DVDs by the hundred, perfumes, shampoos in cases, etc.), and keep her well-stocked so that her clients find in one place all that they need and they don’t have to go to another store because here they find what they are looking for -and therefore she improves her sales.

Gudelia is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children who depend on her and her spouse. Previously she had 2 merchandise businesses bigger than what she now has, but her spouse’s poor administration made the business decline and was left with nothing. Along with the economic situation, her relationship with her husband grew worse. But thanks to her perseverance and the desire to succeed she did not despair, and with the little that was left and with the support of Manuela Ramos, she was able to begin anew from zero and arise little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gudelia vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Trabajadoras. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Nº 01 de la zona y se dedica a la venta de mercería (ropa, CD, DVD, perfumes shampoo, etc), ya contaba con experiencia en el negocio por que desde muy joven trabajo en varias tiendas y eso la motivo a tener un negocio propio que le permita mejorar la situación económica de la familia y educar a sus hijos.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($ 833.00) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará más productos para ampliar el negocio de la mercería (ropa por docenas, CD y DVD en cientos , perfumes, shampoo en cajas , etc), y mantenerla surtida de todo para que así sus clientes encuentren en un solo lugar lo que necesiten y no tengan que acudir a otro sitio por que aquí encontraran lo que buscan y así mejorar las ventas.

La señora Gudelia tiene 44 años, esta casada y cuenta con 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella y de su esposo, en tiempos anteriores ya contaba con 02 negocios de mercería más grandes de lo que ahora tiene, la mala administración del esposo hizo que el negocio decayera y quedara en nada, la relación con su esposo empeoro así como la situación económica, pero gracias a la perseverancia y a las ganas de sobresalir no se dejo vencer y de lo poco que quedó y con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos logró empezar de nuevo desde cero y a surgir poco a poco.

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise products (clothing, perfume, etc.)

loans.name: Carlos Eliseo

texts.es:
Carlos is a very diligent and creative person. His talent and his vocation for music have led him to offer his services in a unique way. He plays in a cemetery, providing music for the dead and providing comfort to those who have lost loved ones. 7 years ago, on the advice of one of the American priests in his local parish to observe the innate talent he had, he began. The years have passed and he has progressed even more, becoming one of the most sought after singers for masses and funerals.

On a day of low demand, Carlos had 5 engagements, and he is busiest on the weekends. He works in the general cemetery in Huancayo, and is always ready to provide his services to those who request it. He accompanies his songs with his melodious and unique guitar. He is dedicated to this activity and its development. Even though for some it is not very significant, for him it is the only way he makes a living.

Carlos does it all for the well being of his 2 children, who study at the university. This brings him great satisfaction as his children are the love of his life, and he will continue to make a great effort every day. His goal is to acquire a collection of musical instruments in order to have a complete band. He is saving for this, but the costs of education for his children are much greater, and he has fallen behind on his payments. For this reason he is requesting a loan of $200 which he will invest in other instruments and an organ. With your support we can help this responsible father, providing for his children and singing for both the living and the dead.

Carlos es una persona muy diligente y creativa, su talento y vocación por la música lo han llevado a ofrecer servicios musicales de responso a los muertos en los cementerios hace ya más de 7 años por consejo de uno de los padres americanos de su parroquia, al observar el talento innato que posee; pasaron los años y progresó aún más; convirtiéndolo en uno de los cantores más cotizados en el ámbito musical tanto en las misas de funerales como en los responsos (canto a los muertos).El día de menos demanda Don Carlos hace 5 responsos y son los fines de semana en los que más trabajos realiza; ahora su centro de trabajo se ha constituido en el cementerio general de Huancayo y siempre está presto a brindar sus servicios a todo aquél que lo solicite, adicionalmente ofrece acompañar sus cantos con su melodiosa y única guitarra.Él ha encontrado y se dedica a la actividad que le agrada desarrollas y aunque para muchos no es tan significante para él es un medio de vida, todo lo hace por el bien de sus dos hijas que actualmente estudian en la universidad y esto lo llena de mucha satisfacción y por ellas que son el amor de su vida seguirá esforzándose cada día más.Su próximo deseo es adquirir toda clase de instrumentos musicales para tener una banda musical completa, ha estado ahorrando para ello, pero los gastos de educación de sus hijas son grandes y han retrasado un poco su cumplimiento, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares los cuales invertirá en el arreglo de su guitarra y la compra de un órgano. Con tu apoyo haremos que un padre responsable siga desarrollándose y cantándole a la vida y a la muerte.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USED TO BUY SEVERAL MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS FOR HIS BAND

loans.name: Antonia Peña

texts.en: Antonia is 43 years old, married, with three children.   Her husband has a small hardware store which he runs in the same township.  Antonia operates her business very differently from other businesswomen.   She sells almost all her clothes upon request.  The first two weeks of the month are dedicated to gathering up the orders of her well-established clientele.   Afterward, she takes the clothes to every customer's house.  She gets the products wholesale from a merchant ship, since Haina has a wharf which is frequently visited by merchant fleets. A bale of clothing costs approximately US $300.   Antonio earns about US $230 from a bale. The entrepreneur is requesting a loan so that she can satisfy her customers' needs for the present month.  Given this loan, she will increase her income.   That way, she'll contribute better to help her husband deal with  family needs.

loans.use: To buy a bale of clothing in order to satisfy her customers' demand

loans.name: Ibon Elda

texts.es:
Mrs. Ibon lives in the San Martin region of the Mariscal Caceres province, in the Juanjui district. She belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras (Working Women Communal Bank). She works selling basic items, beauty products, phone and cell phone services and is starting to go into the business of internet services. She started her business with the goal of improving the financial situation of her family, since she has two children whom she is solely responsible for as a single mother. The idea for the business came to her thanks to her previous experience in other jobs and a business her parents had in the past. She had always dreamed of having her own business and she worked hard and persevered until she did. In addition, she has an internet business she intends to expand.

With the loan of $933.00 recently obtained from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in 6 payments, she bought 2 computers (PCs) to expand the small internet locale she has, in which she had started with 2 computers and now has 4 PCs. In addition, she will invest in expanding and maintaining the inventory of products she sells in her general store, since she has regular clients. She also gives service to teachers and retired people to whom she sells on credit and who pay what they owe at the end of each month.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ibon vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, productos de belleza, locutorio (Telefono fijo y celurar) y actualmente esta incursionando en el negocio de Internet, comenzó el negocio con el fin de mejorar la situación económica de su familia, ya que cuenta con dos hijos a los que debía de sacar adelante como madre soltera que es, la idea del negocio surgió gracias a que ya contaba con experiencia de trabajos anteriores y de un negocio que en su momento tuvieron sus padres, siempre soñó con tener un negocio propio por el que lucho y persevero hasta conseguirlo, además cuenta con un negocio de Internet el mismo que piensa en ampliarlo.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,800.00 ($ 933.00) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará 02 maquinas (PCs) para ampliar la pequeña cabina de Internet que tiene, en el que empezó con 02 maquinas, actualmente cuenta con 04 PCs, además ha invertirá en ampliar y mantener surtido el negocio de la venta de abarrotes, ya que cuenta con clientes asiduos que son sus caseritos, atiende a profesores y jubilados a quienes les vende a crédito y cada fin de mes le cancelan por lo consumido.

La señora Ibon tiene 27 años y 02 hijos que dependen de ella por los que lucha, persevera y sale adelante para hacer que a sus hijos no les falte nada y les pueda dar una educación sólida.

loans.use: Buying computers and buying products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana lives in the San Martin region of the Mariscal Caceres province in the Juanjui district. She belongs to the communal bank Las Trabajadoras (the working women). Her business is located in the No. 1 Market in the region and she works selling food. In addition, she has a small musical group called Corazon Selvatico (Jungle Heart) that works in the whole region making dance shows. Both businesses proviD. her with enough income to cover the household expenses and support her daughter in college.

The recent loan for $567.00 received from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid back in 4 months, will be invested in buying materials for producing and selling food in great quantities (a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, and 20lt. of oil), and also to invest in her musical group to buy some accessories such as more potent sounds system, microphones, and so on, because the competition is stronger every day and they have to offer a good service to get contracts.

Mrs. Juana is 73 years old and is a widow. She has 7 children, 5 of them independent and 2 still depending on her. She has one daughter in college whom she supports in the city of Lima in a private university, and her other son lives with her, works, and helps out with some expenses. Within her plans, she hopes to be able to have the capital that will allow her to live her old age without worries and to be able to rest.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juana vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres distrito D. Juanjui, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Trabajadoras. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Nº 01 D. la zona y se dedica a la venta D. comida, además cuenta con una pequeño grupo musical denominado Corazón Selvático que trabaja en toda la región realizando show bailables, ambos negocios le rinden ingresos como para poder solventar los gastos del hogar y mantener a una hija universitaria.

El reciente crédito recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1700.00 ($ 567.00) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. víveres para la venta D. comida en grandes cantidades (1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, y 20lts.D. aceite), además D. invertir en su conjunto musical para comprar algunos accesorios como parlantes más potentes, micrófonos y otros, por que la competencia día a día esta más fuerte y hay que ofrecer un buen servicio para que los vuelvan a contratar.

La señora Juana, tiene 73 años es viuda y cuenta con 07 hijos, 05 D. ellos independientes y 02 aún dependen D. ella, tiene una hija universitaria a quien mantiene en la ciudad D. Lima en una universidad particular su otro hijo vive con ella trabaja y la apoya con algunos gastos, dentro D. sus planes está el poder contar con un capital que le permita vivir su vejez con tranquilidad y pueda descansar.

loans.use: Buying materials to produce food for sale.

loans.name: María Altagracia

texts.en:
From the past five years, Maria has been one of the most successful businesswomen of her community. She sells clothes, tablecloths, curtains, shoes, and also natural medicines. She has been separated from her husband for six years. Since then she has had to struggle to provide education and food for her only child, a16-year-old son.

As she lives close to a wharf, Maria buys clothing in bulk from merchant ships at very good prices and resells her products some distance away, so that the business can generate good profit. With money earned from her sales activity, she pays for her rented house, goes shopping, and buys books and notebooks for her son. The entrepreneur has requested a loan to buy bulk clothing because she is presently in short supply and her customers need clothes. The loan will help this 47- year- old woman continue with her business so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of bulk clothing in order to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita belongs to the Banco Comunal Virgen de las Mercedes, and she lives in the region of San Martín in the province of Mariscal Cáceres in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in her home because she has several hectares of land which she makes the most out of for her business. She has been dedicated to fish farming for three years now, thanks to the idea that came to her after seeing her in-laws work in this business. Since she saw that she had adequate land for this business, she decided to try it, and that is how she currently has two pools that yield between 500 and 1000 kilograms of fish every three months, depending on the season. The fish farming business is generating good income for Margarita, which allows her to support her family and a daughter that is in college.

With the recent credit that she received from Manuela Ramos of 1,800 nuevos soles ($600.00) to be paid in a term of 4 months, Margarita will buy the necessary raw supplies for fish production, 2 motors to pump water to the pools and to wash the pools every so often, a 150 meter fishing net, and food to provide a balanced diet for the fish. She will also increase the amount of fish and number of breeds.

Margarita is 39 years old, is married, and has four children that still depend on her and her husband. Her oldest daughter is at college, and her other children are still in high school. The income that this fish farming business generates is giving Margarita great satisfaction because it allows her to help her husband and family with the expenses of the home. One of Margarita's upcoming projects is to increase the number of pools to five.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de las Mercedes, vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio ya que cuenta con un terreno de varias hectáreas el cual aprovecha para el negocio. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la piscicultura, gracias a la idea que le surgió al ver como sus suegros trabajaban en este negocio, como vio que contaba con un terreno adecuado decidió probar y es así que actualmente cuenta con 02 piscinas las mismas que le rinden entre 500kg. en una temporada baja y hasta 1000kg. de pescado en una temporada alta, esto cada tres meses: El negocio de la piscicultura le esta generando buenos ingresos que le permiten apoyar a su familia y a una hija que esta en la universidad.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,800.00 ($ 600.00) para ser pagados un plazo de 4 meses, la señora Margarita comprará los insumos necesarios para la producción de pescados, comprará 02 motores para bombear el agua hacia las piscinas y lavar las piscinas cada cierto tiempo para incrementar los peces y la raza, una red de pesca de 150mts, y alimento balanceado para los peces.

La señora Margarita, tiene 39 años, está casada y cuenta con 04 hijos que aún dependen de ella y de su esposo, una de sus hijas la mayor esta en la universidad y los demás aun están en el colegio, el ingreso que le genera el negocio de la piscicultura le esta dando grandes satisfacciones por que le permite apoyar a su esposo y familia con los gastos del hogar. Dentro de sus proyectos más cercanos está el incrementar las piscinas en un número de 05.

loans.use: Purchase of food and supplies for the production of fish.  Purchase of machinery.

loans.name: María Flor

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the Flower Communal Coffee Bank . It is designated for the sale of grocery products and spices such as coriander, chili, special liquified garlic, seasonings such as cumin, oregano, etc. Also sold in her post are any chopped vegetables you may have in the local market, which is the district Soritor Province of Moyobamba, San Martín region.

Maria decided to start her business to support the financial responsibilities of her home, to move ahead with her family, generate her own income and grow as a person. With the being requested by Manuela Ramos (which comes to approx. $ 225.00 USD., and which will be paid in four months), Maria will buy rice, sugar sacks, oil, milk, tuna and boxes of condiments like cumin, pepper, sillao, vinegar, ajinomoto, etc. She hopes to grow her business so she can meet the needs of her customers and the local market.

Maria is 53 years old and has 4 children, is happy with what she does and pleased with the results so far. Now that she has increased her customer base, her goal is to expand and implement more business, and rent another post which will be larger and safer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor del café. Se dedica la venta de abarrotes y especies como culantro, ají especial, ajos licuados, condimentos como cominos, orégano, guisador, etc., molidos, también verduras picadas en su puesto que tiene en el mercado de su localidad que es el distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba, Región San Martín. Decidió iniciar su negocio para apoyar en la economía de su casa, sacar adelante a su familia, generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona. Con el reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela ramos de S/. 700.00 soles ($ 233.00 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite, leche, y atún en cajas , condimentos como cominos, pimienta, sillao, vinagre, ajinomoto, etc. y demás abarrotes para surtir su negocio y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y del mercado local. Tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, está contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos hasta la fecha, su clientela aumentó, su meta es ampliar e implementar mas su negocio, alquilar otro puesto con mayor espacio y mas seguro.

loans.use: To buy necessary products to grow her sales (rice, sugar, oil, milk, tuna, condiments, spices, etc.)

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Sra. Raquel belongs to the El Abiseo community bank. She lives in Juanjui, a city in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of San Martin. She sells poultry in a local market and she's recently started selling other merchandise--clothes, shoes, CDs, DVDs, earrings, etc.--as well. The businesses generate enough income to pay Raquel's household expenses and educate her children. Thanks to her persistence and drive to get ahead, she's managed to get the things that she's dreamed of.

With a recent loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.3,000 (3,000 Peruvian soles or about US$1,000), to be paid over 4 months, Raquel will buy a flock of 200 chickens--along with feed and other supplies--that she will raise and eventually sell. By supplying her poultry-selling business herself, she will no longer have to spend as much to buy from middle men. She will also invest half the money in expanding her other business, thanks to the huge demand for her products.

Sra. Raquel, 38, is married and has 5 children who depend on her and her husband. Her oldest daughter is in college and the rest are in high school.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Raquel pertenece al Banco Comunal El Abiseo, vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Nº 01 de la zona y se dedica a la venta de pollos y gallinas visceradas, actualmente esta incursionando en el negocio de mercería ( venta de ropa, zapatos, CD, DVD, aretes, etc. ) ambos negocios le generan buenos ingresos como para poder solventar los gastos del hogar, educar a los hijos, gracias a la perseverancia y a las ganas de salir adelante ha podido lograr tener las cosas que siempre ha soñado.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000.00 ($ 1,000.00) pagadero en un plazo de 4 meses comprará un galpón de 200 pollos y gallinas para criar y los insumos necesarios para la alimentación y de ahí poder abastecer su venta de pollos y gallinas visceradas y ya no estar comprando a terceros; además invertirá la mitad del dinero en ampliar el negocio de mercería; todo esto gracias a la gran demanda

La señora Raquel, tiene 38 años esta casada y cuenta con 05 hijos que aún dependen de ella y de su esposo, una de sus hijas, la mayor, está en la universidad y los demás aun están en el colegio.

loans.use: Buy flocks of chicken for poultry business, along with other merchandise for resale.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Maria is a young native of Hualhuas, with big dreams and a desire for self improvement. Every day she works in her family's brick shop, together with her parents and her brothers. Thanks to this work, she has been able to finish her secondary education and is planning to study at a prestigious university in her city. Although she is not yet sure which profession she will choose, she will choose soon. Maria knows very well the process of making bricks, and because of that her parents have delegated to her the responsibility of managing this business. One of her goals is to grow this business for her own development and her family's. She is requesting a loan of $500 to invest intelligently in the supplies needed to make bricks. With your support, we can help this talented and motivated young woman improve her life, and secure the well being of her family.

María es una joven natural de Hualhuas con grandes deseos de superación, cada día trabaja en la ladrillera familiar junto a sus padres y hermanos, gracias a esta actividad pudo terminar su educación secundaria y está en proyecto de estudiar una carrera profesional en las aulas de una prestigiosa universidad de su hermosa ciudad y aunque todavía no tiene en mente que carrera va a elegir esta pronto a escogerla.María conoce perfectamente el proceso de fabricación de los ladrillos y es por ello que sus padres le han delegado la responsabilidad de administrar este negocio familiar. Como parte de sus deseos de superación es que María quiere hacer acrecentar este negocio para su desarrollo y el de su familia, solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares para invertirlos inteligentemente en la compra de los insumos para la fabricación de los ladrillo.Con tu valioso aporte haremos que un joven talento salga adelante y procure bienestar a su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES FOR THE PRODUCTION OF BRICKS.

loans.name: Lisbeth Rossana

texts.es:
Lisbeth is a young mother of 3 who occupies herself everyday to give the best to her children. After staying a widow for six months, she decided to devote herself to work she was familiar with - brickmaking. Despite the fact that time has passed, she still cannot forget the difficult times when her husband was alive and mistreated her. In spite of it, she always was optimistic that things would change; it was by him that she was able to advance and devote her energy to her work to educate her oldest child, who is 5 years old. The second is 2 years old and the last is just 1 month old. Each one of her children follows her optimism in life. She desires that they have better opportunities for their future. For this reason, she wishes to increase the quantity of bricks that she makes with her family. For this goal, she seeks a loan of $375 that will use to invest in more supplies and resources for her brickmaking. We hope that your valuable support can improve the quality of life for this mother and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Lisbeth es una joven madre de 3 hijos que se desempeña cada día a fin de darles lo mejor de sí, es así que tras quedar viuda hace seis meses decidió dedicarse al negocio familiar que consta en la fabricación de ladrillos; a pesar del tiempo transcurrido ella todavía no olvida los momentos difíciles que vivió cuando su esposo estaba en vida y la maltrataba, a pesar de ello siempre mantuvo el optimismo de que las cosas cambiarían es por ello que sigue adelante y trabaja poniéndole el mejor de los esfuerzos para educar al mayor de sus hijos que tiene apenas 5 años, el segundo tiene 2 y uno que hace un mes acaba de nacer.Ahora cada uno de ellos se ha convertido en su razón de vida y quiere verlos en caminados hacia un futuro mejor y con mayores oportunidades de crecimiento.Es por ello que quiere incrementar el negocio de ladrillos que está llevando a cabo en sociedad con su familia y para este propósito solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares los cuales invertirá en los insumos para su ladrillera.Esperamos tu valioso aporte hagamos que una madre y sus hijos incrementen su calidad de vida

loans.use: to buy supplies to make more bricks

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
After taking a photography class, Maria de la Luz S. became interested in starting a very modest photography studio in her own home. Things in her home were not going so well, because her husband is a laborer and does not make enough money to support the expenses of their daughter and the household.

However, buying the photography materials on retail is very expensive for Maria, and as a result she is forced to charge higher prices for her work. This is why she is requesting a loan for US$1000, to be paid in a 6-month time frame. With this money, Maria will be able to buy materials wholesale and offer her photos at a lower price.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Después de haber tomado un curso de fotografía María de la Luz S., se interesó en poner un estudio fotográfico, muy modesto, en su casa. Puesto que las cosas en su casa no iban tan bien, porque el esposo quien es obrero, no gana lo suficiente para pagar los gastos de su hija y del hogar.

Sin embargo comprar los materiales a menudeo le sale muy caro a María, y a consecuencia tiene que dar los precios más altos. Por eso está solicitando un crédito de US $1000 para pagarlos en un plazo de seis meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar los materiales por mayoreo y dar a más bajo costo las fotografías.

loans.use: Buying photography materials wholesale.

loans.name: Delia María

texts.es:
Delia is a courageous woman who, after a slip in her life and becoming pregnant, and facing the irresponsibility of her partner, has been able to succeed by selling kitchen articles, then spare parts, and nowadays imitation jewelry. Every so often, Delia travels to Lima to buy wholesale the most exclusive designs in jewelry, so she can then sell them retail in different places in her city, offering them to people who walk on the streets. In this way she has been supporting her daughter, who is the light of her life and her reason of being.

She always works to give the best to her little girl and this is why she works very hard to cover the costs of her education with the goal of preparing her to face life. Delia works constantly and would like to be able to set a stand where she can offer her products more formally.

She is asking for a loan of US $375 to greater quantities and variety of merchandise with the goal of taking advantage of Christmas sales.

She is committed to return this money in a responsible way and thanks those people who decide to support her in solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Delia es una mujer valiente que tras un desliz en su vida al salir embarazada y ante la irresponsabilidad de su pareja, ha podido salir adelante con la venta de diversos artículos de cocina luego de repuestos y en la actualidad de bisutería.Cada cierto tiempo Delia viaja a Lima para comprar al por mayor los más exclusivos diseños de bisutería que pueda encontrar para luego venderlas al por menor en diferentes lugares de su ciudad ofreciéndolas de manera ambulante a las personas que transitan por las calles de esa manera hace 5 años sostiene a su hija que es la luz de su vida y la razón de su existir. Siempre trabaja para darle lo mejor a su pequeñita y es por ello que labora diligentemente para cubrir los costos de su educación con el objetivo de verla mejor preparada para enfrentar a la vida. Delia trabaja constantemente y desea poder establecerse en un stand para hacerlo de manera más formal.

Solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares para comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería a fin de aprovechar la campaña navideña.

Así mismo se compromete a devolverlos responsablemente y agradece a aquellas personas que solidariamente decidan apoyarla.

loans.use: Buying merchandise and setting up sales stand.

loans.name: Sonia Marlene

texts.es:
Sonia is a hardworking woman who can adapt to every kind of job for the good of her children who give her the strength to keep going every day. Some years ago, she and her husband worked in everything involved with sales and repair of cars, but 11 months ago they decided to rent a locale independently. This small space has been giving fruits, since their hard work and the quality of their service has increased their clientele day by day. By the side of her husband, Sonia works as a team; her husband works on auto repair and she works on selling spare parts. In this way they manage to have a solid income that enhances the quality of life of their little ones. She is very happy and wishes to some day be able to own her own house, since right now they live in the same shop where they offer their services so they can cut on costs and consolidate their business. Part of the project they have started includes buying more merchandise to allow them greater sales, and so she is requesting a loan of US $ 375. Make up your mind to support an enterprising woman, keeping in mind that you are not only supporting her, but a whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Sonia es una mujer diligente y siempre se adecua a todo tipo de trabajos por el bien de sus dos hijos que cada día la mantienen con fuerzas para seguir adelante.Hace varios años que ella y su esposo trabajaban en todo lo que se refiere a la venta y reparación de autos pero deciden independizarse alquilando un local ya hace 11 meses, este pequeño espacio de ventas está dando sus frutos ya que su esfuerzo y la calidad de su servicio hacen que cada día cuenten con más clientes en sus instalaciones.A lado de su esposo Sonia ha logrado desarrollar un trabajo en equipo, su esposo se dedica a la reparación de autos y ella a la venta de los repuestos, de esta manera logran tener un sólido ingreso que incrementa la calidad de vida de sus pequeños niños.Está muy contenta y anhela algún día poder tener su casa propia ya que ellos viven en el mismo establecimiento en el que ofrecen sus servicios para abaratar los costos y consolidar su microempresa.Parte del proyecto que está emprendiendo contempla la compra de más mercadería que le permita mayores ventas y es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares.Decídete a apoyar a una mujer emprendedora, recuerda que no sólo la estás apoyando a ella sino a toda una familia.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for their family business.

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es:
Silvia Maria works by going from house to house selling products out of catalogs. She began this business when she met with a group of neighbors who were selling the same types of items, and now she is an independent salesperson. This is how she has grown her business with much hard work and today is convinced that by incorporating new shoes into her product offerings, she will increase sales.

Silvia Maria needs your help with a loan of $425 USD, with the firm promise that she will repay within a period of 5 months. Silvia appreciates your help in growing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Silvia María trabaja de casa en casa vendiendo productos por catálogo, empezó en este negocio cuando se unió con un grupo de vecinas que empezaron a vender estos productos, y ahora está como vendedora independiente. Y así a ido sumando con mucho esfuerzo un catálogo nuevo en sus productos y hoy está convencida de que incorporar nuevos zapatos le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas.

Silvia María necesita tu ayuda con un crédito de US $425 con el firme propósito de terminar de pagar en un plazo de 5 meses. Silvia te agradecerá tu colaboración a que pueda incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell to the public (shoes) and grow her catalog sales

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
After becoming unemployed, and with one son and a wife to support, Rodolfo Qiuñon, decided to go to work as a taxi driver and to sell shoes door to door. Four years later and after much hard work, Rodolfo has gained many clients and has found a way to make a better life for his family.

Today is he is asking for a loan to establish his business in a central market location. This way he will be in a set location where old clients can find him, and new clients can get to know him and buy from him. With your help Rodolfo will continue to help meet the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Después de quedar desempleado y con un hijo y esposa que mantener Rodolfo Qiuñon, decidió salir a la calle como taxista y a vender zapatos casa por casa. Cuatro años después y con mucho esfuerzo, Rodolfo ha ido ganando clientes y buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia.

Hoy está solicitando un préstamo para poder establecerse en con un local en un mercado rodante. Para así tener un punto en donde lo puedan localizar sus clientes y que pueda atraer más clientela. Con tu ayuda Rodolfo podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell (shoes)

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura has three children for whom she needs to provide an education so they can grow to be fine men. In order to help them succeed, she dedicates herself to selling through catalogs, which brings in extra money to help her husband who works as a bricklayer. In order to grow her product supply, Rosaura is asking for a loan to buy more products and offer a larger selection to her customers. With your help, Rosaura will be able to provide an education to her sons.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Rosaura tiene tres hijos a los cuales necesita pagar sus estudios para que sean hombres de bien. Para poder sacarlos adelante, se dedica a vender productos por catálogo y así tener unos ingresos extras a los que gana su esposo quien trabaja como albañil.

Para poder tener más productos que vender, Rosaura está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar productos y así tener más variedad en sus ventas. Con tu ayuda Rosaura podrá darles estudio a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase products from catalogs and sell to the public

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Delia G. dedicates herself to selling costmetics and shoes through catalogs. She began to sell these items when a group of her neighbors began asking her to become involved and sell to them. And it was then that she began to take an interest in this business. Today she is an independent sales person, however in order to grow her business, she is applying for a loan of $425 USD (which she will pay in 5 months), so that she can offer a greater product selection through catalogs. Alma thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Alma Delia Gutiérrez se dedica a vender cosméticos y zapatos por catálogo. Comenzó a vender estos artículos cuando un grupo de vecinas empezaron a pedir productos para vender. Y fue entonces donde ella comenzó a interesarse por este giro. Actualmente ya se encuentra como vendedora independiente.

Sin embargo necesita seguir creciendo por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito por US $425 para pagarlo en un plazo de 5 meses y así poder tener más productos por catálogos que ofrecer. Alma te agradece tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell (cosmetics and shoes)

loans.name: Erika Damaris

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Erika. My principal activity is making clothing, and I have a small shop in my home. I have been a seamstress for two years, and this generates income with which I can contribute to my family's household expenses. Thanks to this profession I can generate income and take care of my family. Now I need to be ready with fabric and sewing accessories as the vacation breaks and Christmas are approaching, as there is greater demand for services during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Erika, mi actividad principal es la confección de ropa, cuento con un pequeño taller en mi casa de habitación, tengo 2 añod de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos, con los que puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia. Gracias a esta actividad que realizo puedo generar ingresos y cuidar a mi familia. Actualmente necesito preparme con tela y accesorios de costura ya que se aproximan las clausuras y la Navidad, tomando en cuenta que esta epoca hay mayor demanda

loans.use: Purchase fabric, sewing accessories and telephone cards

loans.name: Ni Made Gelis

texts.id:
Ni Made Gelis day to day lives with her child I Wayan Nuarta who is already in 3rd Grade school. Gelis husband passed away, so now Gelis is a widow. But Gelis won't give up, Gelis works hard to fulfill family needs, and pay for her child education by raising pigs. With a capital of Rp 800,000 (about US$88), Gelis raisea 1 mother pig. After raising for 6 months, mother pig gave birth to 8 piglets. Price for one piglets is Rp250,000 (about US$27.50). Gelis spent feed expenses of Rp10,000 (about $1.10)/day. Profit is used to pay for family expenses. Her house is build on own land, with a quite simple building. Dinari's laon would be usesd to buy pig's feed and increase pig's population.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Made Gelis dalam kesehariannya hanya ditemani oleh seorang anaknya I Wayan Nuarta yang sudah duduk dikelas 3 Sekolah Dasar. Gelis sudah ditinggal mati oleh suaminya, sehingga sekarang Gelis berstatus janda. Tapi Gelis tidak mau berputus asa, Gelis bekerja keras untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan membiayai pendidikan anaknya dengan memelihara babi. Dengan modal awal Rp. 800.000 Gelis memelihara 1 induk babi , setelah dipelihara dalam 6 bulan, induk babi melahirkan anaknya 8 ekor. Harga perekor anak babinya Rp. 250.000.- Gelis mengeluarkan biaya pakan sebesar Rp.10.000.- perharinya. Keuntungan yang dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup sederhana dan pinjaman dari Dinari dipakai untuk membeli pakan ternak dan menambah populasi ternaknya..

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed to increase animal population for increase production

Membeli pakan dan bibit babi untuk menambah populasi ternaknya untuk peningkatan hasil produksi

loans.name: Jero Puri

texts.id:
Ms. Jero Puri, a mother works hard to help her husband I Gst Made Rupa who works as a tenant farmer. Jero raises pigs to increase her income, since she is responsible for education expenses for her 3 school aged children. With an initial capital of Rp800,000 (about US$88), Jero bought 1 mother pig. After raising for 6 months, it gave birth to 8 piglets. Price per piglet could reach up to Rp250,000 (about US$27.50). Jero Puri fed her pigs 2x/day, mornings and evenings. Before feeding, the pigs are cleaned, also the stalls are watered until clean. Besides feeding rice shell clippings, Jero Puri also fed greeneries like banana and tals leaves, and banana tree trunk. Profit were used to pay for daily expenses and education of her 3 school aged children. Her house is build on own land, and the building is quite permanent. Her hope is that with Dinari's loan ger business could increase, also the family could have a better life.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ibu Jero Puri ,seorang Ibu Rumah tangga yang ulet bekerja sambil membantu suaminya I Gst Made Rupa yang bekerja sebagai petani, Jero memelihara babi untuk tambahan pendapatannya,karena Jero harus menanggung pendidikan ketiga anaknya yang masih sekolah. Dengan modal awal Rp.800.000 Jero membeli 1 induk babi ,setelah 6 bulan dipelihara, babinya mempunyai anak sebanyak 8 ekor. Harga per ekor anak babinya mencapai Rp.250.000. Jero Puri memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari pada pagi hari dan sore hari,sebelum diberi makan babinya dibersihkan dan juga kandangnya disiram sampai bersih.Disamping memberi dedak ,Jero Puri juga memberikan hijauan seperti daun pisang, daun talas dan batang pisang. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan juga pendidikan ketiga anaknya yang masih sekolah.Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen .Harapannya dengan pinjaman dari Dinari usahanya lebih meningkat dan juga kehidupan keluarganya lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig feed

Membeli pakan babi

loans.name: I Made Rai Artika

texts.id:
I Made Rai Artika lives in Blimbingsari village, West Bali, his birth place. But before Made Rai opened this business in this village, Made Rai immiragted with his family to Dili, East Timor, and opened a workshop there for about 6 years. Because Made Rai graduated from Technical Middle school, he works persistently and with dicipline, since this is his expertise and hobby. Made Rai's work is good and strong, so that within a short time he had many customers. However after the incidents in East Timor, Made Rai and family immigrated back to his birth village, Blimbingsari. Made Rai did not want his unfortunate situation to haunt him. Made Rai raised and worked for his family's well being. In this village Made Rai started from scratch again. Because of his deep expertise, and his satisfactory work, Made Rai immediately has again many customers. Because of the many orders he has to fulfill, often Made Rai has no capital left to buy raw materials, like iron, and other welding equipments. From Dinari's loan, Made Rai would buy raw materails and other welding equipments, so that all his customers orders could be finished on time. Made Rai likes to serve his customers as best as he could, so that his customers would be satisfied with his work and service.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

I Made Rai Artika tinggal didesa Blimbingsari, Bali barat. Desa ini merupakan tempat kelahirannya. Namun, sebelum Made Rai membuka usahanya didesa ini, Made Rai merantau bersama keluarganya ke kota Dili, Timor – Timur dan membuka usaha bengkel las disana selama kurang lebih 6 tahun. Karena Made Rai lulusan STM Teknik, pekerjaan ini dilakukannya dengan tekun dan disiplin, disamping sudah menjadi keahlian dan hobinya. Hasil pekerjaan Made Rai sangat rapi dan kokoh, sehingga dalam waktu sekejap sudah memiliki banyak pelanggan. Namun setelah ada kerusuhan di Timor – Timur, Made Rai beserta keluarganya mengungsi kembali ke desa kelahirannya, Blimbingsari. Namun, Made Rai tidak mau terlarut dalam kesusahannya. Made Rai ingin segera bangkit dan bekerja untuk kesejahteraan hidup keluarganya. Di desa ini Made Rai membuka usaha dari awal lagi. Karena sudah pengalaman dalam pekerjaannya dan hasil kerjanya yang memuaskan, Made Rai segera memiliki banyak pelanggan. Karena begitu banyaknya pesanan yang harus dikerjakannya, seringkali Made Rai kehabisan modal untuk membeli bahan baku yang berupa besi dan peralatan las lainnya. Dengan pinjaman dana dari DINARI, Made Rai membeli bahan baku dan alat – alat las, sehingga semua pesanan pelanggan bisa diselesaikannya tetap waktu. Made Rai ingin melayani pelanggan dengan sebaik – baiknya sehingga semua pelanggan akan mendapat kepuasan dari hasil kerja dan pelayanannya.

loans.use:
To buy rwas materials like iron, and other welding materials

Membeli bahan baku berupa besi dan alat - alat kelengkapan las

loans.name: Ni Made Wardani

texts.id:
Retail stall was started by Ni Made Wardani after marrying I Putu Tantra. With the capital she had at the time, her retail stall was not complete. She sold items needed for daily lives of sorrounding citizens, like: rice, selection of light food, selection of drinks, etc. With Dinari's capital help, and support, Ni Made Wardani could add more and better variation to her retail stall. Ni Made Wardani also adds writing materials needed by school children. Her income increased compared to before. Today income could reach Rp200,000 (about US$22), for a nett profit of Rp50,000 (about $5.50). Ni Made Wardani hopes business would be better so that she could fulfill family needs and pay for children's school expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha Warung ini sudah dimulai oleh Ni Made Wardani sejak menikah dengan I Putu Tantra. Dengan modal yang dimilikinya saat itu, belum dapat melengkapi isi dari warungnya. Barang yang dijual yaitu barang keperluan hidup sehari - hari yang sangat diperlukan oleh masyarakat sekitarnya seperti beras, aneka macam makanan ringan, aneka macam minuman dan yang lainnya. Dengan bantuan modal dan pembinaan dari Yayasan DINARI, Ni Made Wardani dapat melengakapi warung dengan variasi lebih lengkap dan lebih banyak lagi. Ni made wardani juga menyediakan peralatan alat tulis yang sangat dibutuh anak – anak sekolah. Pendapatan setiap harinya juga meningkat dibandingkan dari sebelumnya. Saat ini pendapatan setiap hari mencapai Rp. 200.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp.50.000,-. Ni Made Wardani berharap usaha dapat semakin maju sehingga dapat memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan dapat membiayai sekolah anak

loans.use:
To add sales item so that it would be more complete

Menambah jumlah dagangan agar lebih lengkap

loans.name: Ni Wayan Candri

texts.id:
Buy & sell cocoa seeds around is Ni Wayan Candri main profession, besides a mother of 3 children. After preparing household duties, especially needs of her 2 children to go to school, Ni Wayan Candri hurrily use her bicycle to buy chocolate seeds from citizens homes. With help and loan from Dinari, Wayan Candri could expand her business. Every day Wayan Candri could buy about 100 kg of cocoa, at a price of Rp11,500 (about US$13)/kg. After enough collected, Ni Wayan Candri would sell to a distributor at Rp12,000-13,000 (about US$13.20-14.50) depending on dryness level. daily nett profit could reach Rp50,000 (about $5.50). Ni Wayan Candri's hope is that her business could expand, so that she could fulfill family needs, and replace her bicycle to a motor cycle, since distances dhe has to cover is now farther away.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Membeli dan menjual biji Coklat ( cacao ) keliling bagi Ni Wayan Candri adalah pekerjaan utama selain sebagai ibu rumah tangga dengan 3 orang anak. Setelah selesai mempersiapkan keperluan rumah tangga terutama keperluan kedua anaknya untuk berangkat sekolah, Ni Wayan Candri bergegas mengambil sepeda gayung untuk berangkat mencari dagangan yaitu biji coklat di rumah para penduduk. Dengan pembinaan dan bantuan dana dari Yayaan DINARI Wayan Candri dapat mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih besar lagi. Dalam satu hari Wayan Candri dapat membeli coklat sekitar 100 kilogram dengan harga Rp.11.500,- per kilogramnya. Setelah terkumpul cukup banyak, Ni Wayan Candri akan menjualnya kembali ke pengepul dengan harga Rp.12.000,- s/d Rp. 13.000.- tergantung dari tingkat kekeringannya. Keuntungan bersih setiap harinya dapat mencapai Rp.50.000,-. Dengan pekerjaan yang ditekuni saat ini harapan Ni Wayan Candri usaha dapat berkembang sehingga dapat memenuhi kehidupan keluarganya dan dapat menganti sepeda gayungnya menjadi sepeda motor karena jarak yang ditempuhnya kini semakin jauh.

loans.use:
To increase capital

Menambah modal usaha

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat M., 40, a professional seamstress by training, is married and has 4 children. She lives in Kurgan-Tube. Muhabbat sells clothing for children at the town’s central market, where she rents a trading spot. Muhabbat has been selling for 5 years. In preparation for the Fall season, Muhabbat plans to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of seasonal clothing. She buys her inventory at a wholesale market in Dushanbe, which is located 100 km away from Kurgan-Tube. Muhabbat sells at the lowest prices making her products more attractive to low-income customers. Muhabbat plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоева Мухаббат, возраст – 40 лет, образование среднее техническое, по профессии – портниха, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Живет в городе Курган-Тюбе. Мухаббат занимается торговлей детскими вещами, для этого она арендует торговую точку на Центральном рынке города Курган-Тюбе. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже в течение 5 лет. Так как начинается осенний сезон клиент на полученный кредит хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товара в большом количестве, чтобы часто не ездить за товаром. Клиент приобретает товар на оптовом рынке в городе Душанбе, который находится в 100 км от города Курган-Тюбе. Привозя товар она продает его по более низким ценам в отличие от своих конкурентов. Таким образом Мухаббат дает возможность местным жителям приобрести товар по более низким ценам, что делает ее товар более доступным для людей с низким уровнем дохода Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory of clothing

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  He and his family were relocated to Baku as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  He now lives in a dormitory with his family, which consists of his wife and two children.  He trades fruit and vegetables in front of the dormitory.  He has been in this business since 1994 when he moved to Baku.  Before, he applied to Normicro Baku branch and borrowed $300.  He buys goods from wholesellers that bring goods from other regions.  Now he needs a loan of $500 to invest in his business and increase his working capital.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en: Novruz in an Internally Displaced Person from the Zangilan region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  He fled to Baku in 1993 as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan conflict over Garabagh.  He is married and has two children.  He has a food market and he has run this business since 1997.  Before, he borrowed two loans from Normicro Baku branch for expanding the business and successfully repaid them.  Now he has applied for his third loan to buy an air conditioner for the market.

loans.use: To buy an air conditioner for his food market

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Egunans

texts.en:
Egunans is the treasurer of her lending group, the Nsambya Developmental Group. She is widowed with 5 children and 2 dependent children. On the day we visited the Nsambya Village, she was a most gracious and welcoming host. We visited ten businesses in her group and all were a delight. Egunans is known throughout her community.

Egunans has a small retail and telephone “airtime” business located at the entrance to her village. She has been at this location for one year. She has received 4 previous loans and has had no problem in making repayments.

Egunans plans to use her loan to stock her business with sodas, eggs, braids, and candies for the children. She is right next to the school and the children play in front of her shop. Egunans dreams of one day owning her own plot of land and building her own home.

loans.use: Egunans plans to use her loan to stock her business with soda, eggs, braids and candies for school children

loans.name: Saydy

texts.ru:
Saydy B., 23, is single. He lives in the village of Kalfisabad in Yavanskiy region and works on the local oil processing plant. In addition to his job, Saydy raises cattle at home. He has a roomy farm and enough food to be successful in his cattle farming business. Saydy has been raising cattle for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 animals and enough food to feed them for 3 years. Every 40-45 days, Saydy sells some animals and purchases younger ones earning an extra income. He plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоёров Саъди, возраст – 23 года, образование среднее, не женат. Саъди живёт в Яванском районе в кишлаке Калфисабад, работает на маслажир комбинате рабочим. Помимо своей основной деятельности клиент также занимается разведением домашнего скота у себя дома, для этого он имеет вес необходимые условия: большой коровник, корм для его содержания. Этим видом деятельнолси он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. На полузченный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 3 головы крупного рогатого скота и необходимое клоличество корма для их откормки. 3 лет. Через каждые 40-45 дней клиент продаёт скот и покупает другой более молодой. Тем самым клиент получает дополнительный доход, так как заработная плата получаемая им на маслажиркомбинате не слишком высокая. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase 3 animals and food for them

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en: Nubar is an Internally Displaced Person from the Jabrail region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She and her family were relocated to Baku in 1993 as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  She now lives in a dormitory with her family and four children.  She trades fruit and vegetables in front of the dormitory.  She has been in this business since 1994 when they were relocated to Baku.  Once she applied to Normicro Baku branch and borrowed $450. She buys goods from wholesalers that bring goods from other regions.  Now she needs $900 to invest in her business and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale to increase her working capital

loans.name: Jacent

texts.en:
Jacent B. is a strong women of 45. Jacent has a small restaurant where she specializes in chicken and beef roasted on skewers. She also serves beer and sodas to her customers. Her business depends on being able to purchase large bags of raw, cleaned chicken and beef which she prepares over her small outside charcoal stove. The items are delivered to her via a "boda boda", a motorcycle.

Jacent is married and has 13 children. Yes, as the the neighbors laughingly confirm, 13 children and four dependent orphans. She is a very strong, determined woman who give selflessly of her heart to those in need. With her loan, she will buy more sacks of cleaned beef and chicken which will enable her to serve more customers and increase her income. She dreams of one day owning a boda-boda to cut down on the costs of deliveries.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of cleaned beef and chicken.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is 40, married with five children and one dependent child. She is the owner of the Shina Shina Salon. The women in the villages take great pride in getting their hair done and the styles vary greatly. Annette's clients value her professionalism and knowledge of hair styles and cosmetics. Salons serve an important role in the community as a place of social gathering and keeping up self-esteem.
 
Annette has been in business at this location for ten years. She will use her loan to buy mores shampoo, braids, dyes and cosmetics. This will be her fourth loan and she never had a problem with repayment. Annette dreams of one day owning her own plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more shampoos, braids, dyes and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Everyone knows Rose. Rose is the commanding owner of the Mirembe Hotel and Restaurant. She is a large woman with a strong presence and a big, welcoming smile. Her business is on the main path, and she can often be seen in front, with cleaver in hand, chopping meat on a plank of wood. She towers over her “domain”, but have no fear, her smile welcomes all.

Though her hotel only has one room, her outside restaurant is usually packed with eight to ten people sitting on benches under a lean-to. She serves sweet potatoes, posho, g-nuts, fish, beans, etc.

Rose is 45 and married with three children and two orphaned children. She has been in business for ten years. With her loan she wil buy more foodstuffs, enabling her to serve more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more matooke, posho, g-nuts for her restaurant

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a very hardworking man. He is 30 years old and married with three children and two dependents. He operates a battery recharging business out of a tight two and half foot front. It’s actually a space he converted between two buildings. But he secured it by putting in a locked door and a tin roof. And, he even has a light which is powered by a battery. Because there are regular electrical outages in the villages, a battery recharging business is very important.

Francis has received three previous loans and always repayed promptly. With this loan he will buy more used batteries. One day he hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more used batteries

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old, married, and has five children. She also cares for five dependent children. She has a produce stand on the main path of her village which she has owned for the past 5 years. Today, she is selling: dried fish, tomatoes, onions, g-nuts, passion fruit, ginger, bananas, avocados, and peppers.

Sarah is very hard working, and will use her loan to buy more produce for her stand. The more items she offers her customers, the more income she earns. She dreams of buy a plot of land and building a house.

loans.use: To purchase more avocados, bananas, tomatoes, dried fish for her stand.

loans.name: Bude

texts.en:
Bude is 38 years old and married with five children. She is also raising two orphans. She operates a small restaurant in her village of Nsambya just on the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in business for the past seven years. The main dishes she serves are Matooke, rice, posho, potatoes and cassava, all cooked on a small charcoal stove.

This will be her first loan and she will use it to buy charcoal, a sauce pan and cups.  She is very business oriented and has developed a plan to grow her business. She knows exactly what she needs for the next three loans, but first she says she needs to buy basic restaurant materials.

One day Bude would like to be able to afford a small plot of land to build a home. She knows that if she can own rather than rent, she will be able to save more money.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, sauce pans and cups for her restaurant.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 yeas old and married with four children. For the past four years she has operated a small, retail beverage business. She also collects used bottles for resale. This will be her first loan and she will use it to buy more stock.
 
Joyce lives in the Nsambya Village on the outskirts of Kampala. Her store is located where two paths join and her business offers an open area where her customers can sit and visit. This adds to their relaxation and enjoyment of their drink.

Joyce dreams of one day buying a boda-boda, motorbike, so that she can cut her distribution costs of receiving the sodas.

loans.use: To purchase sodas and beer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old and single with four children. She has a very good business and likes to keep a good supply of items. She sells matooke--plantain or unripened bananas-- firewood, and Irish potatoes. Matooke is a major staple food for Ugandans, as the diet of most villagers has little variety. But the food is always fresh and there is always variety in the produce used. The firewood is used in small hotels and charcoal is used for cooking.

Ruth is a main wholesale supplier for matooke and firewood to her village of Nsambya, just on the outskirts of Kampala. With her loan she will increase her stock of potatoes, a fairly new product for her business. She is always thinking of new ways to improve her business and her income.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of Irish potatoes for her wholesale business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 33 years old and married with six children and two orphaned dependents. She has a tailoring business on one of the paths in her village of Nsambya. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design.  She is very organized and with a good head for business. She has had this business for one year and this is her first loan.
 
With her loan, she will buy more material and embroidery. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

loans.use: To purchase more material and embroidery for her tailoring business

loans.name: Aida Aly

texts.pt:
Aida is married and she is the mother of 4 children. All her children are in school. Aida's husband is a driver and his income is very low; that is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. She joined the program this year. She wishes to apply the money on the purchase of more clothes and shoes to fill up her store. If business progresses successfully, she will eventually restore her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Aida e casada e mae de 4 filhos. Todos os filhos de Aida estao a estudar. O marido de Aida e motorista o salario dele e baixo, por isso Aida resolveu iniciar tambem um negocio para poder apoiar o marido nas despesas da casa.Ela entrou para o Programa este ano. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de mais roupa e calcado para rechear a sua banca.Se o negocio correr bem, ela pensa mais tarde reabilitar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Aida wants to use the money to purchase clothing in Maputa for her retail business.

loans.name: Ana Paula

texts.pt:
Location: "A" Sector, Namaacha / Client: Ana Paula C. / Type of Business: Retail / Loan Amount: 32.000,00Mt (US$1,200.00) / Type of Investment: Merchandise Purchase / Repayment Period: 11/10/07 - 05/10/08

Ana Paula was born in 1970, in Namaacha. She grew up with her parents and she started her education in Escola Primaria do Mugado (Mugado's Elementary School). When she was on the 7th grade, at the age of thirteen, she became pregnant and married the baby's father in the same year. She lived with him for 13 years and they had 3 children together. After their separation in 1996, she started selling cigarettes and beer out of her house to create a source of income for her children. She was able to rent the cafeteria at the Namaacha High School with money she made from those sales. In 1999 she opened a store in the local market called Shoprite.

In the following year, she took over the cafeteria at the Graça Machel de Namacha Elementary School. She was not successful at that location though, for she could only be present during mornings hours and expenses there were too high. At the end of the same year, one of her brothers, who owned a small store in the Sector "A", moved away and allowed Ms. C. to take over it. She, then, backed out of the Graça Machel School cafeteria deal and move her merchandise over to her brother's former store. In 2006, she rented the district's administration social center. This made her become the owner of a chain of retail outlets that was too big, thus, causing merchandise stock levels to fall to skimpy proportions. She has decided to request a loan in the amount of 32.000,00mt from Hluvuku - Adsema. She became aware of this opportunity on the community's radio station.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Localização: Bairro “A” - Namaacha. Cliente: Ana Paula C. Actividade: Comercio Valor do emprestimo: 32.000,00Mt ( 1.280 .00US$ ) Aplicação: Compra de mercadoria Inicio: 11/10/2007 Fim:05/10/2008 Ana Paula C., nesceu em Namaacha em 1970, cresceu com os seus pais e iniciou os seus estudos na Escola Primária do Mugado. Quanto frequentava a 7ª classe esta fica grávida com seus 13 anos, teve que interromper os estudos e juntou-se com o seu marido no mesmo ano, com o qual viveu 13 anos e tiveram 3 filhos. Apois a separação de ambos em 1996, começa com o negocio de venda de cigarros e cervejas na sua casa para seu sustento e o dos seus filhos. Com o rendimento daquele pequeno negocio consegue alugar uma cantina na Escola Secundaria de Namaacha. Em 1999 abre um pequeno estabelecimento comercial no mercado informal ( shoprite ). No ano seguinte aluga uma outra cantina na Escola Primaria Graça Machel de Namacha, na qual não teve muito sucesso porque só trabalhava de dia e a renda era muito elevada. No fim do mesmo ano um dos seus irmãos que era proprietário duma pequena loja no bairro A, decide mudar de residência e deixa o estabelecimento com ela. Assim ela fecha a cantina da Escola P. G. M. N e transfere os produtos para loja. Em 2006 aluga o centro social da Administração do distrito, assim fica com varios estabelecimentos comerciais e volume de mercadoria ja era menor. Decide pedir um financiamento na Hluvuku – Adsema no valor de 32.000,00MT que soube da sua existência através da rádio comunitaria. Actualmente encontra – se a gerir 3 estabelecimentos e emprega tres trabalhadores, todos jovens. Futuramente pretende construir uma loja e bar no bairro 25 de Junho e fechar os outros estabelecimentos, uma vez que quando ficar velha não conseguirá gerir muitos estabelecimentos de pequena escala.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Essineta Jose

texts.pt:
Location: Namaacha's Border Sector/ Client: Essineta Jose S./ Amount Requested: 15.000,00mt (US$600,00)/ Investment Type: Construction Material Purchase/ Repayment Period: 10/01/07 - 11/24/08

Essineta Jose S. was born in 1956, in Gaza. She grew up with her parents and she started her education in the Province's Elementary School. She dropped out when she reached the forth grade due to her parent's poor financial resources- back then they relied solely on their small cropping business for survival. In 1976, she married her husband, who worked at the Commercial Investments Bank (BCI). A year later, he was transfered to Namaacha and they relocated there. They lived together for 8 years and had 3 children together. Her husband passed away in 1984 and she was hired to work as a janitor at the same bank. She was let go after 9 years of employment when internal shifts were made and her position was branded unnecessary.

The toughest period of her life had arrived leading her to unsuccessfully sell tomatoes in the streets' corners. Her children were not allowed to attend school anymore because they did not have uniforms to wear nor notebooks to take to class. They could not afford the registration fee either. Essineta, then, borrowed some money from family members and started to cross the border to Swaziland to purchase oil that would be sold in Maputo. Gains achieved with that venture were used to re-enroll their children in school.

In 1997, her deceased husband's bank called her in to present documents that would make her entitled to a pension to help support their children. She was awarded the pension in that same year and with that money she built a small house on the border's sector. Subsequently, she concentrated her efforts to expand it to better accommodate her children. They were then attending school outside the district and expenses were high. Two of her children have become professionals: a nurse and a teacher. The youngest is on the 12th grade at the Namaacha's High school.

By speaking to friends at Women's Savings Planning meetings, she discovered the Hluvuku –Adsema's program and requested a loan in the amount of 6.000,00Mt, which were applied on the production of building blocks. After having successfully repaid the first loan, she got motivated and decided to request a second loan in the amount of 12.000,00, that will be applied to build additions to her house. In the future she plans on furnishing the house to provide better comfort to her children and also build a small store in the same location to increase the family's total income.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Localização: Bairro da fronteira- Namaacha Cliente: Essineta josé S. Actividade: Habitação Valor solicitado: 15.000,00MT( 600,00US$ ) Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 01-10-2007 Fim: 24-11-2008 Essineta José S., nasceu em 1956 em Gaza , cresceu com seus pais, iniciou os seus estudos numa Escola Primaria da mesma Província, abandona os estudos na 4ª classe , devido a ma condição financeira dos pais, estes que só trabalhavam na machamba . Em 1976 contraiu matrimónio com o seu marido, este que trabalhava no Banco Comercial de Investimento (BCI). Um ano depois mudam de residência para Namaacha devido a transferência do seu marido no serviço, com o qual conviveu apenas 8 anos e tiveram apenas 3 filhos. Em 1984 o marido perde a vida, um ano depois ela é chamada para trabalhar como servente no serviço do marido onde trabalhou durante 9 anos e tendo sido desvinculada devido a reetruturacao, pois o nome dela constava da lista de mao de obra excedentaria. Assim, entra na fase mais difícil da sua vida, tentou vender tomate na esquina, na sua residência, e não teve nenhum sucesso. Face a essa situação os filhos foram expulsos da Escola pois não tinham uniforme, cadernos, nem dinheiro de matricula. Depois consegue um valor emprestado num dos seus familiares e inicia com o negocio transfronteriço de compra de óleo na Swazilândia e revenda em Maputo, e com o rendimento desse negocio consegue matricular os filhos e estes retomam os estudos. Em 1997 é chamada no Banco para tratar documentos para passar a receber uma pensão do seu falecido marido para assistência dos filhos, e começa a receber no mesmo ano .Com essa pensão consegue comprar um terreno no bairro da fronteira e constrói uma casa tipo1, assim a sua grande preocupação era ampliar a sua casa o que já não era possível porque os filhos já estudavam fora do distrito e os gastos eram elevados. Encontra-se actualmente com os seus 2 filhos a trabalhar, um como professor e outra como Enfermeira. Tendo a mais nova sobre sua responsabilidade que frequenta a 12ªclasse na Escola Secundaria da Namaacha. Num encontro de grupo de mulheres de poupança (chitique) em conversa com as amigas soube da existência da Hluvuku –Adsema, desta forma aproximou-se e adquiriu um empréstimo no valor de 6.000,00mt para o fabrico de blocos. Tendo terminado de reembolsar este 1° empréstimo sem nenhum problema, uma vez ter gostado dos serviços, recorre ao 2° empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00mt para a ampliação da sua casa. Pretende futuramente mobiliar a sua casa para dar conforto aos seus filhos e fazer uma pequena loja no mesmo local para aumentar a renda familiar.

loans.use: To buy materials to build her house

loans.name: Laura Maria Luciano

texts.pt:
Laura is a mother of 5 children and she lives with her children's father. She joined the credit program in 2006. She prepares meal in a parking lot for travelers and she has seen her business grow steadily. She uses the profits from it to help her husband pay for heir living expenses. She also pays for their children education cost since they all go to school. He future plans include opening up her own restaurant if business continue to grow in the same manner.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

laura e solteira e mae de 5 filhos. Ela vive com o pai dos seus filhos.Laura entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Ela confecciona refeicoes numa praca de autocarros para os viajantes.O negocio dela esta a crescer.Cm os rendimentos ela ajuda o marido a pagar todas as despesas da casa. Ela paga tambem a escola dos seus filhos pois que todos eles vao a escola. Ela pensa no futuro abrir um restaurante se tudo continuar a correr como tem corrido ate entao. mas isto e um plano de futuro.

loans.use: Laura wishes to purchase products to prepare more meals.

loans.name: Atalia Eugenio

texts.pt:
Location: "B" Sector, Namaacha/ Client: Atalia Eugenio J./ Type of Business: Retail/ Loan Amount: 5.000,00Mt (US$200.00)/ Repayment Period: 10/23/07 -10/17/08

Atalia Eugenio J. was born in 1982 in Namaacha's Sector "B". She spent her childhood in Maputo with an aunt where she attended school until the 6th grade. When she was on the 7th grade, another aunt of hers passed away and she was forced by the aunt she lived with to marry the widow. She refused and decided to move back to her mother's home in Namaacha - she dropped out of school to do this.

Due to her mother's poor financial condition she could continue her education. In 2000, she married her first husband with whom she had one child. Shortly after, though, she found herself divorced again. After the separation she started working at a local retail establishment to support her child. Two years had passed and she was now working as a cashier at the social center.
