In 2003, she got married for the second time. This husband, however, forced her to quit her job to take care of the house duties. She had another child with him right before he separated from her. Faced with this situation, she began selling imported clothing to support her children.

Her venture had a positive impact in the community because it allowed customers to make purchases without leaving the comfort of their homes.

She learned of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA through her mother who had attended the program's awareness meetings, and decided to request a loan in the amount of 5.000,00Mt to increase stock volume. In the future, she plans on building her own establishment and sell her products from there.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Localização: Bairro B , Namaacha. Cliente: Atalia Eugenio J. Actividade: Comercio Valor do emprestimo: 5.000,00MT (200.00US$ ) Aplicação: Venda de roupa. Início :23/10/07 Fim:17/10/08 Atália Eugénio J., nasceu em 1982 no bairro “b” em Namaacha, passou a sua infância na cidade do Maputo com a sua tia, onde estudou até 6ªclasse. Em 1999 quando frequentava a 7ªclasse, uma outra tia perde a vida e a tia com quem vivia obriga-lhe a se casar com o tio viúvo. Ela recusa -se, decide voltar para casa da mãe em Namaacha e interrompeu os estudos. Devido a má condição financeira da mãe não consegue dar continuidade dos seus estudos. Em 2000 junta-se com o seu 1° marido teve um filho e separaram-se pouco depois, começa a trabalhar num pequeno estabelecimento comercial para poder sustentar o seu filho, dois anos depois muda do emprego e trabalha no centro social como caixa. Em 2003 junta - se com o seu 2°marrido, este obriga - lhe a deixar de trabalhar para tomar conta da casa, teve mais um filho e um ano depois o marido lhe abandona. Face a essa situação ela decide começar com o negócio de venda de roupa estrangeira para o sustento dos seus filhos. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade, pois fornece roupa de qualidade a várias pessoas sem precisar de deslocarem – se. Soube da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA através da sua mãe que participou numa reunião de sensibilização, e resolve pedir financiamento no valor de 5.000,00MT para aumentar o volume de roupa encomendada. Futuramente pretende construir o seu próprio estabelecimento para venda dos seus artigos e produtos.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Diogo Manuel

texts.pt:
Diogo is married and is the father of 7 children. He lives in Hemoine, one of the districts of the Inhambane province, located in the south of Mozambique. He joined the program in 2006 and this is his sixth cycle. He sells kitchenware, book bags and shoes. His business has done so well that he was able to conclude the construction of his third house, which was interrupted for a long time due to lack of funds. All but three of his children are in school because they are not old enough. His wife looks after their crops, takes care of the house duties and helps him out with the sale of their products.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Diogo e casado e pai de 7 filhos. Ele vive em Homoine um dos distritos da Provincia de Inhambane que se localiza na zona sul de Mocambique. Ele entrou para o programa em 2006.Ele esta no sexto ciclo. Ele vende louca, pastas escolares,e calcado.O seu negocio esta a crescer de tal forma que ele conseguiu ja concluir a sua obra de construcao de sua residencia que estava parada ja ha muito tempo por falta de fundos. Os seus filhos estao a estudar com a excepcao dos 3 mais novos que ainda nao tem idade escolar. A sua esposa cuida da machamba e dos afazeres domesticos, mas as vezes apoia o marido na venda.

loans.use: Diogo wants to use the money to purchase more merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ganvoy

texts.en: Ganvoy is 58 years old.  He is a refugee from the Zangilan region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  Right now he lives with his family, which consists of his wife and four children in Baku.  He started his business of food trade in 1993, right after being relocated, because he had to earn a living for his family.  At the beginning he applied to Normicro Baku branch, borrowed his first loan and started the business.  He has since built a booth of his own.  Now he wants to buy a counter-regrigerator to store meat and diary products.  To do this, he has applied for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To buy a counter-refrigerator to expand his business

loans.name: Rena

texts.en: Rena is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She, the family of her husband and her four children were relocated to Baku as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  She runs a construction materials shop together with her husband.  They have been in this business since 1993.  Since then she has developed the business, but now she is a bit short on inventory to be sold.  She wants to increase the number and variety of inventory.  She has applied for a loan in the amount of $700.  This is her second loan from Normicro Baku branch.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to grow her construction materials business

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero O. is a 43 year old married woman with 4 children and lives in Benin City.  She operates a bar business where she sells drinks and pepper soup.  She is requesting a loan to enable her to grow her business. She has been in this business for 1 year and she is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, meat & pepper soup

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal is 26 years old.  He is a refugee from the Aghdam region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan, which is now the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone.  He is not married and right now he lives in Baku.  He has built a booth where he trades food stuff.  He started his business of food trade in 1999.  At the beginning he applied to Normicro Baku branch, borrowed his first loan in the amount of $500 and started the business.  Now he wants to buy a counter-regrigerator to store meat and diary products.  He has now applied for $800 for his second loan.

loans.use: To buy a counter-regrigerator to expand his business

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: A 35 years old woman, Mrs. Happiness E. is married with 3 children and lives in Benin City Edo State.  She is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase food items, provisions, baby items and ladies clothing for re-sale. She has been in this business for 12 years.

loans.use: To buy more food items, provision, baby items & ladies clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Mrs. Juliana U. is 35 years old, married to Mr. U. and has 7 children.  She lives in Benin City with her family. She is requesting a loan of US $400 to enable her to buy drinks, provision and bread for re- sale.  She has been in this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provision, & bread for re-sale

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Mrs. Charity Ugeg is 42 years old, married with 5 children; she lives in Benin with her husband.  She learned her business for 6 months before she got into production of ice cream in 2000.  She produces and supplies in wholesales and retail to people living in her community.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to buy more ice material for production and sale.  She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream material

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Ehinmwinose, 55 is married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City.  She sells provision, drinks and foodstuff to people living her community. She is seeking for loan amount of $400 to enable her buy more provision and drinks for sale. She is a dedicated member of our LAPO. She has been business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provision, & foodstuff

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Mrs. Edith E. is 45 years old, married with 8 children and lives in Benin City. She rears and sells pigs and she is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more pigs and feed. She has 5 years experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy more pig and feed

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy Ogieriakhi is a 40 years old, divorced mother with 8 children.  She lives in Benin City and sells food and drinks.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more drinks and foodstuff for re-sale.  She always goes to the village to buy foodstuff and sells it in the city.  She has been in this business since 1987 and is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & foodstuff

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Mrs. Joyce Bakare is a 36 years old woman, married with 3 children. She sells provisions and snacks to the people of her community in a semi-urban area of Edo State. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to enable her to buy more provisions. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in this business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy more provision & snacks

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Mrs. Lola E. operates a beer bar where she sells all kinds of beers, gins and pepper soup for people around in her neighborhood. She is 42 years old, married with 5 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. According to her, if given a $250 loan she will be able to buy more drinks and pepper soup ingredients. This she believes will help her serve her customers better. She has 4 years experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more dry gin, beer & soup ingredients

loans.name: Vekini

texts.en: Mr. Velaini A. a professional typewriter engineer. He sells and repairs typewriters. He is 49 years old, married with 4 children. He has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years and has been in the business since 1977. He is in need of $625 loan to enable him buy more typewriters for sale.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts & typewriters for sale

loans.name: Warde

texts.en: Warde lives with her husband and her 3 children in Ain El Deleb, in Saida (South Lebanon).  Warde is a very well respected lady in her community being the wife of the village's priest but she is also respected for her handicraft.  Warde is a perfectionist when it comes to her accessories and her craft work.  She needs 300$ to purchase the necessary material for her creations.  Warde is part of a group with other women from the same village who will all benefit from this loan.

loans.use: buy material for her handicraft work

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Benin City with her 2 children, married to Mr. O.. She sells provisions & dry gin to the people in her neigborhood. Mrs. Juliet O. said that, if the sum of $800 can be given to her, it will enable her to buy more provisions and gin for sale. She has been in this business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & dry gin for sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Mrs. Marina O. sells bread both wholesale and retail. She is soliciting a loan of $400 to buy more bread to supply to her customers and make more profit. She is a widow with 6 children, 47 years old, and lives in Benin City. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in this business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a mother of 2 children. She lives in a village just outside of Saida in the South of Lebanon. Mariam is very skilled with her embroidery work. She currently needs a loan to purchase fabrics and accessories. Mariam is part of a group of women who took the initiative to open a shop where they all exhibit their work. This project has turned out to be a success. Mariam and her family are proud of her involvement in the village's economy. Mariam is asking for this loan, not only to benefit herself, but to help the entire group of women and the village itself.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery work

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. sells bread to people.  She solicits a loan of $250 to buy more bread for sale. She is married with 2 children, 40 years old, and lives in Benin City. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence Osagile sells kerosene. She is married with 5 children and is 41 years old and lives in Benin City. She is in need of $1175 to buy more kerosene for sale. She has been a faithful client and leader of her union and  has been in this business since 1996.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sale

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is a 47 year old woman who lives in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. She creates artificiA. flowers, decorates potteries, and paints fabrics. Claudette is part of a group of woman who opened a shop in which they exhibit their products. They are proud that they no longer have to sell thier products from thier homes. Claudette needs a loan of USD 300 to purchase materials for her handicraft work. Claudette is head of a group who will all benefit from this loan. Group loans are a very powerful tool for women's economic empowerment.

loans.use: Buy material for her handicraft work

loans.name: Rachdiye

texts.en:
Rachdiye has an impressive business history. She started with loans of $200 for more than 5 years with Al Majmoua. Today she needs $900 to buy merchandise to increase and diversify the home products she sells from her shop.
Rachdiye developed her business progressively and is now the owner of the shop.
Rachdiye is a successful entrepreneur, with an excellent history of on time  repayments within the Institution. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in Saida, South Lebanon.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to increase the inventory in her shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence O. sells food items, provisions and drinks. She is soliciting the above amount to improve her business, which she started in 2000. She is married with four children and lives in Benin City. She is 45 years old and is a faithful member of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria O. is 44 years old, married to Mr. O., with 7 children. She lives in Benin City. She started her business selling yams, garri and other foodstuffs in the year 1990. She is requesting $250 to enable her buy more yams, garri & starch and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more yam, garri & starch for sale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia E. a 48-year-old woman, a widow with 7 children. She lives in Benin City and sells provisions and drinks to people living in her community. According to her, if loan of $400 is given to her, it will enable her buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She has been in this business since 2000 and she is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Mrs. Caroline I. is 31 years old. She lives in Benin City and is married with 3 children. She is a professional hairdresser. She learned her business for a year and 6 months after which she started her own salon in 2006. According to her, if the loan amount of $475 is given to her, it will go a long way to improve her business. "I will be able to buy more wave-on, hair creams, relaxers & drinks for sale. I will also buy a generator, which will be very useful to my business."

loans.use: To buy a generator, wave-on, hair creams, relaxers & drinks for sale

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili is the 38-year-old mother of 3, a resident of Vingunguti, a Dar Es Salaam city suburb. She owns a salon in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam's busiest trading area. Recently she bought modern equipment for the salon on loan, and has now expanded it to cater to more customers than before. She has also opened up a cosmetics shop alongside her saloon, to ensure maximum resources for her customers. She is in need of USD 1100 to help pay for equipment and expand her cosmetics shop.

loans.use: Expand salon

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. sells yam. She lives in Benin City and goes to the villages to buy yams from farms and sells them to retailers in the open market. She is 56 years old, married with 8 children. She is soliciting the loan amount of  $800 to buy more yams for sale. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in this business since 1985.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: "I will be glad," says Mrs. Anna O., who deals in yams. She goes to the villages to buy yams from farmers and sells to retailers in Benin City. She is married with 7 children; she is 59 years old. She is soliciting the loan amount of $800 to buy more yams for sale. She has been in this business since 1987.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: 52 years old, Mrs. Helen U. is a married mother with 5 children, who sells yams. She learned her business for 3 years before she started her own business in 1987. She will be glad if the loan of $800 is given to her; it will enable her buy more yams for sale.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace E. is 48 years old, married to Mr. E. with 6 children. She lives in Benin City and she sells yams. She is a faithful member of LAPO and has been in this business since 2004. She solicits a loan of $800 to enable her buy more yams for sale.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 35-year-old business woman, a resident of Vingunguti in Dar Es Salaam city. She owns a butcher shop in the Vingunguti area, Dar es Salaam’s animal (cows and goats) slaughter area. She gets the cows up-country, slaughters them and sells them to meat suppliers in Dar Es Salaam city, who then supply them to the smaller butchers. She is in need of USD 1200 to help her boost capital.

loans.use: Expand working capital

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Mrs. Ayo A. is 45 years old. She sells rubber shoes and has a milling machine for the milling of garri. She is married with 5 children and lives in Benin City. She started her business in 1976. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more rubber shoes & wrappers for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more rubber shoes & wrappers for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris Iyekekpolar lives in Benin City. She is married to Mr. I. and they have 5 children. She buys foodstuffs from the villages and sells them in the city. She has been in this business since 1989. She is soliciting  a loan of $400 to enable her buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs & drinks

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: 48 years, Mrs. Grace E., who deals in women's cloths and baby wear, lives in Benin City. She is married with 8 children. She learned her business for 3 years & started her own shop in 1988. According to her, if the loan of $475 is given to her, she will be able to buy wrappers and baby wear for sale. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers & baby things

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Adesuwa O. is 38 years old. She is married with one child and lives in Benin City. She deals in necklaces and rings. She needs the loan of $550 to enable her buy more jewelery for sale. She is a dedicated LAPO client. She has 2 years experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more jewelery

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: Nuru, 33, is a resident of Vingunguti in Dar Es Salaam City. She owns a salon and a cosmetics shop in the area. She has been in business for the past 4 years. She is a recipient of the organized business management trainings organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. She now wants to open a cosmetics shop alongside her salon to ensure maximum services for the customers. She is in need of USD 750 to help her with this new business.

loans.use: Open a cosmetics shop

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget I. is 55 years old. She sells wrappers and jewelery and lives in Benin City. She is married with 6 children, and she started her business in 1986. She will be glad if the loan of $400 is given to her, to enable her to buy more wrappers & jewelery. She is a faithful member of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers & jewelery

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Q. lives in her parents' house in the Las Lomas area, located in the northeastern side of the city of La Paz, with her 5-year-old daughter. Mrs. Maria is an elementary school teacher in a school in the outskirts of the city of La Paz, and she also works as an artisan, making decorations for the celebrations in our city. They currently live in a room and a kitchen built with loans previously obtained from our organization.

Because of the age of the construction, the front wall made out of adobe is in bad shape and risking collapse, thus urgently requiring repairs. The loan requested will be used to remove the current adobe wall and build a new one out of bricks. This is the sixth time they have requested a loan. Maria has been a client of IMPRO since 2002 and the previous five loans have been paid very well. The socioeconomic analysis made qualifies her favorably and approves her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva translator volunteer.

La señora Maria Q. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Las Lomas ladera noroeste de la Ciudad de La Paz y su hija de 5 año de edad. La señora Maria es profesora de ciclo primario en una unidad educativa de la zona periférica de la ciudad de La Paz y realiza trabajos de artesanía, elaborando adornos para las fiestas de nuestra ciudad. Actualmente ocupan una habitación y una cocina realizada con créditos anteriores en nuestra institución. Por la antigüedad de la construcción, el muro frontal de adobe se encuentra deteriorado y en riesgo de desmoronamiento, por lo que se hace urgente un trabajo de refacción. El crédito solicitado será destinado a derrumbe del muro frontal de adobe y a la construcción de un muro de ladrillo. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicitan un préstamo. Maria es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002 y los cinco créditos anteriores han sido pagados en forma excelente. El análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: building a wall

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice is married with 4 children. She is 35 years old and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. This was a business she started 8 years ago. She is requesting a loan of $175 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuffs

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Mrs. Amen Asonrenemen operates a provision and drinks store. She lives in Benin City. She is 42 years old, married with 8 children. She started her business in the year 1992. She is soliciting a loan of $250 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She is one of the leaders of a group in LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks

loans.name: Fany Guadalupe

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Fany Guadalupe and I sell used clothing. I've made my living with this business for some years and it generates enough income to cover family expenses. Indeed, it's a family business that my husband and I operate together. We now need to stock a bit extra because the coming months are when we can expect to sell the most, a time that we have to use to the utmost. In that way, we'll improve our earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Fany Guadalupe, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, ubicada en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, tomando en cuenta que este es un negicio familiar el que es atendido junto con mi esposo, actualmente necesitamos surtir un poco mas ya que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta, la que debemos aprobechar al maximo. logrando asi mejorar nuestros ingresos y por ende las utilidades.

loans.use: Buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fanny Yaniret

texts.es:
My name is Fany Yanireth and I sell used clothing. I've worked at this business for some years and I depend on it to pay my family's expenses and other commitments. Thanks to this business, I can earn an income and care for my son. I don't have enough capital now to stock my business sufficiently for the coming months, when sales are normally best.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fany Yanireth, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos. gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos y cuidar de mi hijo, actualmente no cuento con el capital suficiente para surtir mas mi negocio, tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Guldara

texts.ru:
Guldara R., 36, is married and has 5 children. She is a professionally-trained seamstress. Guldara has a sales spot at the central market of Nurek, where she sells clothing and shoes for women. She has been in business for 7 years. Guldara plans to use this loan to refresh her inventory and add seasonal items. Nurek is located 80 km from Dushanbe, and it is difficult for many of Nurek’s residents to travel the distance to buy warm clothing there. With the help of this loan, Guldara will be able to offer a collection of seasonal clothing at the local market. Guldara plans to repay this loan with 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Розикова Гулдара, возраст – 36 лет, образование среднее техническое, закончила училище по спциальности - швея, замужем, имеет 5х детей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке города Нурека по продаже женских вещей и обуви . Этим видом предпринимательской деятельности занимается уже в течение 7 лет. На сумму кредита планирует увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара, а именно закупить перед началом холодов осеннюю женскую одежду. Город Нурек находится в 80 км от города Душанбе и его жители не всегда имеют возможность выехать за пределы города, для того чтобы приобрести себе одежду, поскольку большинство из них работают на Нурекской Гидроэлектростанции. Получив данный кредит Гулдар сможет обновить свой ассортимент товра, что позволит ей увеличить объем продаж и прибыль и соотвественно даст возможность жителям Нурека приобрести необходимые им сезонные вещи на центральном рынке своего родного города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Refresh inventory and add seasonal items

loans.name: Glenda Amaridis

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Glenda Amaridis, I am a businesswoman, and I have a used clothing store called "El Panpanito," located in the center of my city. I am a single mother and thanks to this business I have helped my children be successful, and with the income that I generate I can cover my family's expenses and other obligations. Today I need to increase my inventory in order to be able to offer my clients a variety of products and I don't have enough capital to do so, therefore I am asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Glenda Amaridis, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada, llamdo "EL PANPANITO" el que esta ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, soy madre soltera y gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos, ya que con los ingresos que me genera puedo cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos y no cuento con el capital suficiente, razón por la cual solicito su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase 2 bundles of  American-Classified Clothes

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina S. D. Oré belongs to the village bank “Alondras,” which is a Spanish word meaning “Larks.”

Agripina is involved in three different types of businesses. The majority of her time is spent making “papas rellenas,” which are small, fried mashed potato croquettes. Every day Agripina makes 500 of these, which she then sells to five different school cafeterias. Each cafeteria buys one hundred papas rellenas for 3 soles, or about $1.00.

In addition to making papas rellenas, Agripina also makes “queso,” or cheese. Twice each month she prepares a batch of roughly 12 kilos of cheese. She has regular customers, professors and office workers, to whom she sells, and she also sells the cheese door-to-door in her community. On top of these two activities of papas rellenas and queso, every spare moment of Agripina’s time is spent weaving and knitting. She can complete up to three beautiful large tapestries each week, which she then sells every Sunday at the local market.

Agripina is happy to be in her village bank because it has helped her to save her money and it is also a place where she can meet with friends and chat. Agripina will devote the majority of this $500 loan to her business in artesanías, buying colorful threads and fabrics to weave into beautiful tapestries. She will spend the rest on food materials for her additional two businesses.

loans.use: Agripina will devote the majority to her business in artesanías, buying colorful threads and fabrics to weave into beautiful tapestries. She will spend the rest on food materials for her additional two businesses.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita C. C. belongs to a village bank called “Sumaqcha,” which is Quechua (native language) for “Beautiful Bank.”

Anita is a business woman. She sells a variety of different products to a variety of different clients, enabling her to capitalize on several markets. Anita sells clothing, ice cream, cigarettes, and coca leaves. Coca leaves are a very important part of Andean culture here in Ayacucho, Peru. They are used to make a tea or simply chewed and are known for their many medicinal benefits including alleviation of hunger, facilitation of metabolism, and help with altitude sickness. In addition to all of this, Anita also sells fresh fish by the box once every month to individual customers and restaurants.

For ten years, Anita has been running her own business, but the truth is that her experience goes back much, much further. Her mother also sold coca leaves, as well as fruit, in the local markets, and Anita grew up watching and learning. Just as she helped her mother, today Anita’s four children also help her in the markets. One daughter is in charge of selling clothes, another is in charge of ice cream, and the other two help where they can. However, because Anita insists that school comes before anything else, they are only allowed to help on Saturdays and Sundays.

Everything Anita does, she does for her children’s future. When her husband left the five of them some years ago, Anita had no choice but to work twice as hard to provide for her family as a newly single mother. Her goal is to see all four of her children through to professional degrees. As a means to accomplish this, Anita’s professional goal is to open up her own small grocery store. She has plans to sell her car in order to invest the money in a store. She also hopes to take out loans from her village bank to facilitate the growth of her business. This is why, she says, she loves to be a part of her village bank. She gives thanks that it has inspired her to be more responsible. Anita is hoping to receive a loan of $1,000, with which she will be able to buy larger quantities of goods and also work towards her goal of opening a grocery store.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of goods and also work towards opening a grocery store

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina P. L. belongs to the village bank “Desarrollo,” which mean “Development” in Spanish.

Dina owns and runs her own store of “abarrotes,” which is the general name given to the bulk supply of staple foods such as rice, flour, eggs, butter, etc. Six years ago, Dina didn’t have her own source of income. Her husband owned a car and made a living as a taxi driver in order to support t Dina and their four children. Dina decided that they needed a second source of income and wanted to become more independent in her contribution to the family. She opened a small candy store. The candy store grew into abarrotes, and now Dina serves much of the community, including many children and adults. In addition to the store, Dina and her husband also travel to the “fiestas patrias,” or national celebrations, to serve cervezas. Because they live well outside the city limits of Ayacucho, Peru, in the rural community, Dina’s husband must drive her into the city once each week to buy food supplies and stock her store.

As a professional goal, Dina hopes to continue growing her business, stocking more products and reaching more customers. For this reason she feels very happy to be a part of her village bank because it has helped immensely and has taught her how to save her profits and earn interest. Dina is requesting a loan of $500, with which she will be able to buy more supplies for her store and service the family car to aid in her transportation to the city.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her store as well as service the family car to aid in her transportation to the city

loans.name: Felícitas

texts.en:
Felícitas L. D. G. is part of the village bank “Arco Iris,” which means “rainbow” in Spanish.

Felícitas has been selling fresh meat door-to-door in her community for the past forty years. Her mother had been selling meat for as long as she is able to remember, and when she was very young she began to learn the ins and outs of the business. Eventually, when her mother grew too old to continue, Felícitas took over the business, and today it is her principal source of income. Every Tuesday she travels several hours outsiD. the city limits into the countrysiD. of Ayacucho to buy her weekly supply of meat. Her Wednesdays and Fridays are dedicated to the sale of the product.

As an additional source of income, Felícitas and her husband also sell “papas secas,” or dried potatoes, which are a popular and very traditional staple among the highlands of Peru, as they keep for a very long time without spoiling. These she prepares in her home through a process that begins with cooking a large batch of potatoes. After they are done cooking and have cooled, her husband cuts them into thin slices and lays them under the sun to dry. These she then also sells door-to-door throughout the local community.

Felícitas says she is very happy to be a part of her village bank because it has helped her very much with both of her businesses. Through the profits she has earned and the savings she has accumulated, Felícitas is able to care for her large family of five children. With the $1,000 loan she is asking for, Felícitas will be able to buy larger quantities of meat to sell, as well as pay for the transportation that takes her into the countrysiD.. She will also be able to buy larger quantities of potatoes to dry and sell.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of meat and potatoes to sell, and pay for transportation into the countryside

loans.name: Elizabet Maribel

texts.en:
Elizabet Maribel Q. B. belongs to a village bank called “Tu Angel Lucy,” which is Spanish for “Your Angel Lucy.”

Three years ago, Elizabet worked for a company in Ayacucho. Realizing the benefits of owning one’s own small business, she quit her job and opened a small store. Known as “Servicios Comerciales,” or “Commercial Services,” Elizabet’s store supplies office materials of all types to those in her community. Located in the heart of the town center, Elizabet’s customers can find pencils, paper supplies, and folders, as well as a photocopier. In addition to providing her individual clients with office supplies, Elizabeth also sells her materials to various businesses in the local area.

Elizabet says she feels grateful to be a part of her village bank because it has taught her how to save money, and more importantly it has taught her self-esteem. She hopes to continue growing her business in order to provide for her two children, Gabriel and Vivian, ages five and one. She says her goal is to own a solid business that is able to generate its own capital without the necessity of taking out loans on a regular basis. With the $700 loan Elizabet is asking for, she will buy a more up-to-date copy machine that includes a scanner.

loans.use: To buy a more up-to-date copy machine that includes a scanner

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
The education she received from her parents taught her to work hard, and that has been very important since from the age of 10 she learned how to repair blenders expertly and efficiently.

She has become a courageous woman who is always looking for the best way to offer security to her children. And so it is that 5 years ago she independently formed her own repair shop and store selling replacement parts. Unfortunately, she had to close her business for health reasons; she had surgery twice and as a result was bed-ridden for two years.

This situation left her in a great financial crisis, which she managed to overcome thanks to the support of her family and husband.

Some time later, Ana decided to devote herself again to repairing blenders, going to her clients' homes. Up until now she has offered her services to acquaintances because she does not have a commercial locale. It is her hope to have one so she can expand her business. All her efforts are directed to making improvements for her beloved family, who day to day give color to her life. As part of this dream, she requests a loan of US$200 to buy blender replacement parts wholesale.

With your valuable contribution Ana will be able to continue working for the good of her children.

Translated by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

La educación que recibió de sus padres le enseñó a trabajar esforzadamente y eso le ha sido muy importante ya que desde los diez años aprendió a reparar licuadoras con suma destreza y rapidez.

Se ha convertido en una mujer valiente que siempre ve la mejor manera de ofrecerles bienestar a sus hijos; así hace 5 años se independizó y formó su propio taller de reparaciones y ventas de repuestos que lamentablemente tuvo que cerrar por motivos de salud; fue operada en dos oportunidades y a consecuencia de esto estuvo postrada en cama por dos años.

La situación por la que atravesó la ha sumado en una inmensa crisis económica que ha podido superar gracias al apoyo de su familia y el de su esposo.

Tiempo después Ana decide dedicarse nuevamente a la reparación de licuadoras a domicilio y hasta ahora siempre brinda sus servicios a personas conocidas porque todavía no tiene un local comercial, su deseo es poseer uno para acrecentar su negocio y todo su esfuerzo está orientado a generar mejoras para su querida familia, que cada día le dan color a su vida, como parte de ese anhelo solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares para comprar al por mayor repuestos para licuadoras.

Con tu valioso aporte Ana podrá seguir trabajando por el bien de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying replacement parts to increase volume and income.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary has been creating embroideries since she was 12 years old. Through all these years she has perfected her technique to be able to make the best embroideries and become one of the most sought after embroidering ladies in her town.

The great motivation for which she works with such dedication is being able to offer security and education to her young 5-year-old boy. Her husband has temporary jobs and many times their home finances have been affected negatively. This is why day to day she has increased her production capabilities and additionally started in the business of raising animals at home, with the goal of generating more income to improve their quality of life.

Her main concern is to offer always the best to her little guy, and this is why she hopes to, in the future, own a locale where she can sell the work she does so majestically.

It is because of this that she wants to increase even more her production of embroideries and she requests a loan for US $375 to buy cloth, thread, new needles and other materials that will allow her to continue her work every day.

Translated by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Mary se dedica a realizar bordados desde que tenía 12 años y a lo largo de todo estos años ha perfeccionado su técnica para realizar mejores bordados y convertirse en una de las damas más solicitadas de su localidad.

El gran motivo por el que se desempeña con mucho ahínco es para brindarle bienestar y educación a su pequeño niño de cinco añitos; su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales y muchas veces la economía de su hogar se ha visto afectada; es por ello que día a día ha ido aumentado su capacidad de producción y adicionalmente ha emprendido el negocio de la crianza de animales en casa a fin de generar mayores ingresos que le ayuden a incrementar su nivel de vida.

Su principal preocupación es brindarle siempre lo mejor a su pequeñín y es por ello que desea en un futuro poseer un local donde comercializar los trabajos que realiza con tanta majestuosidad.

A raíz de este hecho es que desea incrementar aún más los bordados que produce y solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares para adquirir telas, hilos, agujas nuevas y demás artículos que le servirán para seguir desempeñando su labor diariamente.

Apoyemos el noble deseo de una madre que con esfuerzo borda un futuro mejor para su hijo.

loans.use: Buying raw materials to produce excellent embroideries.

loans.name: Rosalinda Inés

texts.es:
Rosalinda is a dedicated and hard-working woman who works making embroideries every day. She learned this noble trade since she was a child, thanks to her beloved parents. She has been supporting her four children with her work in this craft. She is willing to continue working hard so that she can offer her children security and comfort, so they can be able to continue their studies and in the future will become good men who contribute to society. In addition, not long ago she opened a small locale and bought small animals to raise them and later on offer them at the market. In this way, this noble woman has been generating additional income for her home with the goal of satisfying her family's needs. Rosalinda would like to keep making her beautiful embroideries and so she requests a loan for US $200, which she will invest in buying the cloth and thread necessary for her work. With your valuable contribution Rosalinda will continue in the path of progress.

Translated by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalinda es una mujer diligente y empeñosa que día a día trabaja bordando; desde su niñez aprendió esta noble labor gracias a las enseñanzas de sus queridos padres.Con su desempeño en este oficio ella viene sosteniendo económicamente a sus 4 hijos y es por ellos que está dispuesta a seguir esforzándose a fin de generarles bienestar y comodidad para que sigan estudiando y en un futuro puedan desenvolverse en su sociedad como hombres de bien. Adicionalmente aperturó hace poco una pequeña bodega y compró pequeños animalitos para criarlos en casa para posteriormente ofrecerlos en el mercado al mejor postor; de esta manera esta noble dama ha ido generando ingresos adicionales a su hogar con el objetivo de satisfacer plenamente las necesidades que requiera su familia.Rosalinda desea seguir realizando hermosos bordados y es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares que invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos indispensables para su trabajo.Con tu valiosa colaboración Rosalinda seguirá por el camino del progreso.

loans.use: Buying cloth and thread.

loans.name: Alicia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alicia is a loving mother who dedicates herself to the embroidering of all types of clothing. She has six children, and even though they are grown, she has continued to tend to them with tenderness. With the objective of caring for them, she decided 30 years ago to dedicate herself to embroidery at the advice of an aunt as a method to gain additional income and care for her children in her small home.

This activity has allowed her to raise her family's standard of living and after many years has become the principle economic support of her home. Now she continues working in the company of her husband, and she hopes for the future with great longing that she may be able to open a small general store in her home. To reach this goal, she will continue creating beautiful and quality embroidery.

For this purpose she requests a loan of $375 which will be wisely invested in the purchase of the materials that she needs to continue her work. Remember that your support is very valuable and important for Alicia and she thanks you in advance for your help.

Translated by Katie Sheaffer, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Alicia es una amorosa madre que se dedica laboriosamente a bordar todo tipo de trajes típicos, tiene seis hijos y aunque han pasado los años y ya han crecido ella no deja de observarlos con ternura; con el objetivo de tenerlos siempre a su cuidado ella decide hace 30 años dedicarse a realizar bordados por consejo de una de sus tías como alternativa para generar ingresos económicos adicionales y cuidar de sus hijos en su pequeña morada. Esta actividad le ha permitido incrementar el nivel de vida de su familia y hace muchos años se ha convertido en el sostén económico principal de su hogar; ahora viene desempeñándose en compañía de su esposo y espera su futuro familiar con grandes anhelos pues desea aperturar pronto una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad en casa y para conseguir su objetivo ella seguirá incrementando su esfuerzo para seguir elaborando hermosos y finos bordados. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares que serán sabiamente invertidos en la compra de los materiales que necesita para continuar con su labor; recuerda que tu aporte es muy valioso e importante para Alicia y te agradece por anticipado tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to continue embroidering.

loans.name: Elena Áída

texts.es:
Elena is young and very enterprising and enthusiastic. She is the next-to-last of six children and her desire desire has always been to become an excellent nurse. However, because of the little money that her parents earned, she has, since she was young, felt obligated to work and abandon her dreams.

Her older sisters taught her to embroider fine works in many styles and to use many colors to increase their value.

Embroidery became a very good option that helped her gain her own income and cover the expenses of her education, and now she again yearns to pursue her dream which has become more feasible.

Day after day Elena diligently embroiders beautifully and responds to the requests of her dear mother. She is very happy and satisfied with her compensation with which she can help raise the quality of life of her beloved family. Now she asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of more work materials.

Support this talented young woman so that she can succeed in becoming an excellent nurse.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Sheaffer, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Elena es una joven muy emprendedora y entusiasta. Es la penúltima de 6 hermanos y su deseo siempre ha sido el de convertirse en una excelente enfermera pero por el poco dinero que percibían sus padres con el desarrollo de su labor desde muy niña se vió obligada a trabajar y a truncar sus sueños. Por esta razón es que sus hermanas mayores de enseñan a bordar finos trajes de diversas maneras y utilizando innumerables colores para incrementar su valor. Se convirtió en una muy buena opción que le ayudó a generar sus propios ingresos para costear los gastos que demandaba su educación y ahora sus deseos por iniciar a concretar su anhelado sueño se incrementa y se hace más factible. Día a día Elena diligentemente se dedica a realizar bellos bordados y también apoya con las solicitudes de su querida madre. Está muy contenta y satisfecha con su desempeño ya que con el puede contribuir a incrementar el nivel de vida de su cariñosa familia.Ahora ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de más materiales de trabajo. Apoya a este joven talento para que logre convertirse en una excelente enfermera.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to continue embroidering and support her ambition of becoming a nurse.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne is 35 years old and is the mother of three children. She worked for a company but they terminated her position for gender-based reasons. Since then, she has decided to own her own business. For this purpose, she needed financing, but no institution wanted to lend her capital. Only Manuela Ramos had faith in her. That's why, together with her husband, she was able to buy a small piece of land and decided to plant camu camu (a fruit of the zone).

With the recent loan (approximately US$333.00) given by Manuela Ramos that will be repaid in five months, she will buy two sacks of seeds, set up two nurseries, and maintain the land.

She is very happy to depend on her business and, despite the fact that most of the work in the region is done by males, she can demonstrate that women are also capable.

Now, with her husband, she is germinating camu camu seeds to start planting.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Sheaffer, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

La señora Ivonne al Banco Comunal Las Lomas de Yarina, del Jr Octavio Monteverde Nro. 153 el Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 3 hijos. Trabajó en una empresa donde por razones de genero decidieron sacarla, desde ese entonces decide tener un negocio propio, para ello necesitaba financiamiento, ninguna institución le quiso prestar dinero para capital, solo Manuela Ramos confíó en ella, por eso conjuntamente con su esposo compraron un pequeño terreno y decidieron sembrar camu camu (fruta de la zona) Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), que cancelará en 5 meses, comprará 2 sacos de semillas, instalar 2 almácigos y dará manteniendo al terreno. Ella esta muy contenta de depender de su negocio y a pesar que este trabajo en la Región, en su mayoría, es realizado por varones, ella puede demostrar que también las mujeres pueden. Ahora conjuntamente con su esposo realizan todo el proceso de germinación del camu camu terminando en las plantaciones.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and land maintenance.

loans.name: Armida Victoria

texts.es:
Armida and Sósimo are parents who have worked long and arduously in diverse activities, with the goal of being able to educate their five children. Armida initiated her intense cosmotology studies and thanks to her committment and dedication learned the skills for this position very quickly and opened a beauty salon next to her small grocery store. Her continued effort prompted her older children to complete their studies and now carry out their respective profesions in order to procure for themselves the family well-being that had just come about, having their parents as a recurring model based on the values that they instilled in them since childhood. However the task has not concluded because they will have to continue striving with the purpose of education for the last of their children, who is 23 years old and studies accounting at a city university. For this reason, this noble woman desires to increase the products in her grocery store and establish her beauty salon, with the objective of realizing the goals of her beloved child.

Contribute so that she can finish satisfactorily with her duty as a mother and have economic solvency in future years.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Tom, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Armida y Sósimo, son unos padres que a lo largo de sus vidas han trabajado arduamente en diversas actividades, con el fin de poder educar a sus 5 hijos.Armida entonces inició sus estudios intensivos de cosmetología y gracias al empeño y dedicación aprendió los gajes de este oficio muy rápido y abrió su salón de belleza a lado de su pequeña bodega.Su continuo esfuerzo hizo que sus hijos mayores concluyeran sus estudios y ejerzan ahora sus respectivas profesiones para procurarles bienestar a la familia que acaban de conformar teniendo como modelo recurrente a sus padres basados en los valores que les inculcaron desde niños.Sin embargo la tarea no ha concluido debido a que aún tienen que seguir esforzándose con el propósito de educar al último de sus hijos, quien tiene 23 años y cursa estudios de contabilidad en una universidad de su ciudad.Por esta razón esta noble mujer desea incrementar los productos en su bodega y ambientar su salón de belleza, con el objetivo de concretar los anhelos de su querido hijo.

Contribuyamos para puede concluir satisfactoriamente con su deber de madre y pueda tener solvencia económica para sus años futuros.

loans.use: Buy basic materials for a small grocery store and implementation of a beauty salon.

loans.name: Celia Zenaida

texts.es:
Celia is 64 years old and since she was very young she has gotten ahead through a lot of effort and sacrifice. She worked on several jobs so she could offer well-being and education to each of her children.

In spite of having to take the roles of father and mother, she did not let the circumstances, fear, or insecurity, defeat her. On the contrary, she built an armor in her heart and her body to fight and not allow herself to be defeated.

With her young girl in arms, she went out every day with meat and cheeses, which she obtained in small production centers, to sell them in the markets of the city. Everything that she gave to her little ones have good results and now she is very satisfied when she watches them working in different activities in their community.

For different reasons her children had to go away and now she has been left alone at home, and she keeps working with the same dedication to satisfy her needs and to not feel alone. She now works selling cosmetics and this gives her great satisfaction and helps her not feel lonely because she has found company in each one of her clients.

Thanks to the vitality and strength that characterize her, she still has several dreams she would like to see come true. The first of these is to renovate the small sales stand she has in a very busy market, to which she would like to add new merchandise.

You can make the wishes of this dedicated woman come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Celia tiene 64 años y desde muy joven ha sabido a costa de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio salir adelante; trabajó en múltiples labores con el fin de proporcionarles bienestar y educación a cada uno de sus hijos.

A pesar de tener que asumir roles de padre y madre no dejó que las circunstancias, el temor y la inseguridad la vencieran por el contrario construyó un armadura en su corazón y en su cuerpo para luchar y no dejarse vencer.

Con su pequeña niña en brazos diariamente salía a vender carne y quesos que adquiría a pequeños centros de fabricación para comercializarlos en los mercados de diversas ciudades.Todo cuanto sembró en sus pequeños han rendido frutos muy buenos y ahora muy satisfecha los observa desempeñándose en diversas labores dentro de su comunidad.

A razón de este hecho y por diferentes circunstancias tuvieron que alejarse y ahora se ha quedado sola en casa y sigue trabajando con las mismas fuerzas para satisfacer sus necesidades y no sentirse sola, la venta de cosméticos rubro al que ahora se dedica la llena de mucha satisfacción y le ayuda a no sentirse sola porque ha encontrado en cada una de sus clientas compañía.

Y debido a la vitalidad y fuerza que la caracteriza aún desea cumplir varios sueños y el primero de muchos es ambientar el pequeño puesto de ventas que adquirió en un mercado muy concurrido al que desea adicionarle artículos de mercería.

Tú puedes hacer que esta diligente mujer pueda cumplir su anhelado sueño

loans.use: Renovating and creating a small sales locale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make further improvements to her home and to purchase more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise and a display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more products and help her business grow

loans.name: Raisa María

texts.en:
Raisa is about to reach one of her great dreams: to contribute to the entertainment of the young people of her sector. She always has felt pain for the boys of Haina; she sees them without any activity to enjoy themselves. For more than two years she has been saving money to open a video game center. She has already acquired a TV, 2 computers, many CD games, joysticks and a Super Nintendo. Currently, she is selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetics products. She makes a weekly profit of $130 USD. Raisa is requesting a loan to transform a room of her house into the gaming room or amusement arcade. She has already made contact with some technicians responsible for laying out the space so as to install the computers, TV and other materials in a handy way so that the customers can play easily.

Raisa thinks that this activity will have a very positive impact on the young people. It will help to elevate their self-esteem, since they will be more self-confident when they win a game or when in a competition with other friends, they can do their best to obtain victory.

loans.use: To transform a room of her house into a gaming room so that the young people of her sector can enjoy themselves, playing video games by computer or Super Nintendo.

loans.name: Wendy Amarilys

texts.en:
Wendy is 27 years old and is a single mother. Her 8-year-old only-begotten son goes to a private school in Santo Domingo, the capital. Wendy is finishing the last semester of Basic Education at the university. Six months ago, Wendy started her business with a loan that she had taken from our organization. She used her loan wisely and repaid it in the agreed time.

Wendy sells shoes, clothes, spreads (for beds), earrings and bracelets. She has a well established clientele in her university. Wendy is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more products to sell during the Christmas season. That way, she’ll increase her income and continue taking care of her son.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, spreads and earrings in order to satisfy her customers' needs, and to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Josefa Aquino

texts.en:
Josefa is 57 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a building worker. With the first loan she obtained from our organization, she made sewing machine repairs and invested in the purchase of cloth. She fabricates mosquito nets in her community, and she sells them in the capital. She managed her business judiciously and even repaid the loan before the due date of her payment. 

Currently, Josefa is short of some raw materials to continue production. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of thread, cloth, oil for her sewing machine, needles, and so forth. Given the loan, Josefa will increase her sales volume and will better help her husband bear all the expenses of their large family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as thread, cloth, needles, and oil for her sewing machine, in order to continue producing her mosquito nets.

loans.name: Dalys Gabriel

texts.en:
Dalys, 33 years old, is the prototype of the hard-working and multi-tasking woman. Her four children go to the public school of the zone, and her husband has a liquor store. She sells jeans, blouses, slippers and other items of clothing. She also prepares and sells sandwiches, hamburgers and cheeseburgers in her house. She is an independent saleswoman affiliated with Europiel, a shoe company. That way, she buys her products at very low prices and can get big profits from her business. Dalys cleverly used the first loan she got from our organization and repaid it at the appropriate time.

Dalys is now requesting a loan to purchase some new styles of slippers and blouses to sell during the Christmas period. The entrepreneur hopes she’ll increase her sales volumes and her income. That way, she’ll better contribute to the improvement of her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a large number of slippers and blouses to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Olguine

texts.en: Olguine is 41 years old and is the mother of seven children. She is living with her partner and his two sons. Less than one year ago, Olguine started a small business with a loan she obtained form our organization. She prepares and sells fried eggs, fried bananas, chicken, and some tasty empanadas. After repaying her loan on time, Olguine wants to continue moving her business forward. She has requested a loan to buy more raw materials so that she can considerably increase her sales volume and thus her income. Given this loan, Olguine will better help her husband face the multiple housing issues of their large and very needy family.

loans.use: The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as flour, spices, vegetable oil, bananas and eggs so that the entrepreneur can continue preparing and selling fried food to her customers.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en: Alina, 68 years old, is living with her five children and her husband’s two sons. She has been selling shoes, tennis shoes, boots and pants for more than 20 years. Her husband works as a watchman at a golf camp. In spite of her age, she continues selling her products. She can no longer walk into the streets to sell the goods; however, she operates business in her house.  Alina had already taken a loan from our organization. She used it wisely and repaid it.  Now, Alina is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes and jeans in order to satisfy her customers’ needs. That way, Alina will help her husband attend to the needs of their very large and needy family.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy shoes, tennis shoes, and pants, in order to supply the entrepreneur's business. Currently, those goods are running out in the business.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.en: This 30 year old woman, mother of four children, operates a women’s clothing stand in her house. She started that business eight years ago, so as to support the family’s needs. Her husband is currently unemployed. María Martha buys the clothing in Santo Domingo, the capital, as well as in Santiago, a province located in the northern center of the country. Currently, María Martha is short of supplies in stock. She is requesting a loan to replenish her business with bulk clothing, needed to satisfy an increase in her usual demand, as well as some new customers she expects to gain with diversified stock of clothing material.

loans.use: Purchase bulk clothing, as there is a perceived increase in demand for this cloth in the local market.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith has always worked with patience and friendliness towards her customers. She is the mother of 2 children, one of them is studying at university and the other is in primary school in their small city.

She lives with her husband, who works independently selling various articles for home decoration, which he brings to their city from the capital. They both contribute with their work to the family costs and education of their children.

Judith began a telephone service when she realized that there was no service like this near where they lived. She saw that in the cafes and restaurants there was a telephone service, but only with coins and they were often not working. She didn't doubt she made the right decision to offer a local service when she saw the favorable results and satisfaction of her customers. Because of the lower cost, every one of her customers is talking with the families inside and outside the country.

With the overflowing demand of her neighbors, she is requesting a loan to construct more telephone cabins, to grow her business and improve the service she offers.

Let's help Judith realize this project. She already has another goal of selling telephone cards, improving her service every day and improving the situation of her family.

Judith, trabajó desde siempre prestando sus servicios y hasta ahora lo sigue haciendo con mucha paciencia y amabilidad; es madre de dos hijos; uno de ellos está estudiando en la universidad y el otro en una escuela primaria de su pequeña ciudad. Vive con su esposo que se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente a la venta de diversos artículos de decoración para el hogar que lleva a su ciudad desde la capital; de esta manera contribuyen ambos cada uno en su actividad con los gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos. Judith implementó un locutorio telefónico a raíz de que no había un servicio como este cerca al lugar en el que reside junto a muchas familias jóvenes; y como observó que en las bodegas lejanas existía el servicio telefónico pero a través de monedas y fallaban constantemente no dudó en poner las cabinas viendo los resultados favorables de su decisión en forma paulatina y satisfactoria, debido al bajo costo que les resulta a cada uno de sus clientes comunicarse con sus familiares dentro y fuera de nuestro país. Teniendo en cuenta la desbordante demanda de sus vecinos solicita un préstamo para construir más cabinas telefónicas con el objetivo de seguir trabajando y mejorando su servicio para satisfacción plena de cada uno de sus clientes. Ayudemos a concretar los proyectos de Judith, ya que tiene como meta invertir en la venta de tarjetas telefónicas, mejorar cada día más su servicio y asegurar el progreso de su familia.

Tranlated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE WOOD FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF TELEPHONE CABINS.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia, 40 years old, is a very successful business woman. She started the grocery store fifteen years ago. Her husband is a taxi driver and is working in the capital. Her only-begotten daughter is fourteen and goes to public school in their home town.

In Francia’s grocery, people buy rice, salt, flour, oil, spices, milk, chocolate and other foodstuffs. Currently, supplies are running low in the store. Francia needs a loan in order to buy some sacks of rice, flour and wheat. She will also buy new items to introduce into the business so that she can better attend to her customers’ needs and attract new ones.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of rice, flour and wheat which are running out in the grocery store. Also to introduce new items in the business so as to attract new customers.

loans.name: Sherlith

texts.es:
Sherlith started selling juices after the advice and help of her dear mother. She is a single mother and lives with her three children. Two of them are in middle school and the last one is going to elementary school. Despite the troubles she went through when her husband decided to leave her, she gained courage and decided to move on with her kids. She started working by installing a small table on the sidewalk in front of her house. Because of the high variety and sweetness of her juices, little by little she has increased her clientèle and the satisfaction she gets from the trade.

Since early in the morning, she is supported by every member of the family in order to provide a better and faster service. They take turns in the different tasks and the purchasing of the supplies at the local market. Always minding not to disregard the children's studies.

Her main current challenge is to purchase equipment and utensils to keep working and service her clientèle with greater diversity of products and speed. Her dream is to set up a well put together Kiosk in the front of her house and increase her family's quality of life.

She is requesting a loan for 200 USDs, amount which will allow her to work and be able to accomplish her plans within a time not too far away.

Let's make the work of this mother continue so that she continues sweetening the dreams of her dear children.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Sherlith empezó con la venta de jugos por consejo e intervención de su querida mamá, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres pequeños, dos están en la secundaria y la última hija en la primaria; a pesar de los problemas por los que tuvo que atravesar cundo su esposo decidió dejarla, se llenó de mucha fuerza y decidió salir adelante con sus hijos. Empezó a trabajar instalando una pequeña mesita en la vereda de su casa y debido a la variedad y dulzura de sus jugos poco a poco ha ido incrementando su lista de clientes y satisfacciones en este oficio. Para un mejor desempeño y rapidez en la entrega de los deliciosos jugos cuenta con el apoyo de cada uno de los miembros de su familia desde muy temprano, turnándose en las labores así como en la compra de los insumos en el mercado, sin descuidar sus estudios. El actual y principal problema que padece Sherlith es el de adquirir algunos artefactos y demás utensilios para seguir trabajando y ofrecer sus servicios con mayor novedad y rapidez, ya que su sueño es poner en el patio de su casa un kiosco bien implementado para acrecentar el nivel de vida de su familia. La suma que solicita es de 200 dólares, monto que le permitirá trabajar y poder llegar a concretar sus planes dentro de un tiempo no muy remoto. Hagamos que la labor de esta madre continúe para que siga endulzando los anhelos de sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing utencils and equipment which will allow her to increase sales and build a kiosk on the patio in front of her house / LA COMPRA DE UTENSILIOS Y ARTEFACTOS PERMITIRÁ AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y PODRÁ CONSTRUIR UN KIOSKO EN EL PATIO DE SU CASA

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira is the mother of 4 children, all of whom have moved far away with their own families in search of better opportunities. She raised them all with a good education and good values.

Now she lives in her small home with her husband and lifetime companion. She works independently after losing her job just a few years before she had enough years for any retirement benefits. Elvira doesn't let these problems bring her down, always making an effort to improve her situation. Proof of this is the small shop/restaurant she opened. She had the necessary space and fortitude to be able to contribute to the monthly costs.

Thanks to her charisma and her growing customers, she now needs to expand the stock she offers in her small shop, buying more everyday household items and regional products which she also sells after her customers suggested it.

Let's help this couple maintain their well being, as they stay together and manage through adversity.

Elvira es madre de 4 hijos que se encuentran fuera de su hogar porque habiendo alcanzado su madurez y teniendo que velar por sus propias familias han decidido migrar fuera para otorgarles bienestar a sus nuevos miembros gracias a la educación y las buenas costumbres que ella les impartió desde muy pequeños.

Ahora sólo habita su pequeña morada en compañía de su único y gran compañero que se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente y a brindar servicios públicos de transporte en su unidad, ya que perdió el trabajo hace poco faltando un par de años para cumplir el tiempo necesario para jubilarse; a pesar de las adversidades por las que pasó ella no permitió que los problemas lo derroten y permaneció siempre a su lado dándole mucha fuerza, prueba de ello es el empeño que puso en aperturar una bodega para aplacar los sinsabores de este infortunado acontecimiento ya que tenía el espacio suficiente y las fuerzas necesarias para contribuir con los gastos familiares. Debido al carisma con el que cuenta y a la concurrencia masiva de su clientela, se encuentra en la necesidad de poder aumentar los artículos de su pequeña bodeguita comprando más abarrotes y productos regionales que también vende gracias a las sugerencias de su público. Colaboremos con esta pareja de esposos que tratan de permanecer juntos a pesar de las adversidades para seguir brindándose compañía y bienestar

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO EXPAND THE STOCK OF MERCHANDISE SHE CARRIES IN HER SMALL SHOP/CAFE, AND IMPROVE HER SALES.

loans.name: Juana Milva

texts.es:
Juana is a separated from her husband and lives alone with her children. The oldest is studying law at a prestigious university in her city, and the youngest is still in college. Because of the estrangement with her husband and the fact that she had recently lost her job, she realized she needed to do something for income. Aside from all the problems she has had, she never gave up because of her faith. She came up with the idea to improve her situation with a business selling sodas and cold drinks from her house. To do this, she bought several cases of sodas and a small aluminum display case which she put in her window. The disadvantage she has right now is that she is using an old refrigerator that she bought a long time ago, and slowly it is failing to work properly. It's very important that she buys a new refrigerator as soon as possible in order to keep the drinks cold, as well as other items she sells which must be kept cold. The loan will enable her to make this critical purchase and provide a better service to her customers, allowing her to continue improving the education of her children.

Juana es una madre separada de su esposo y vive sólo en compañía de sus hijos, la mayor estudia leyes en una prestigiosa universidad de su ciudad y el menor está aún en las aulas del colegio, a raíz del alejamiento del padre de sus hijos se encontró en la necesidad de trabajar más aún porque hace poco había perdido su empleo, a pesar de todo los problemas que se le avecinaron nunca se dejó vencer debido a la fe que tiene y le nació la idea de salir adelante trabajando en la venta de golosinas y bebidas heladas en su casa; para ello adquirió unas cuantas cajas de gaseosas y una pequeña vitrina de aluminio para la exposición de los dulces que es colocada en la ventana.La desventaja que tiene es que por el momento está utilizando una refrigeradora de segundo uso que compró hace ya bastante tiempo y poco a poco está dejando de funcionar por los desperfectos que día a día sufre es por este motivo que le urge la necesidad de adquirir una congeladora lo más pronto posible para conservar heladas las bebidas y demás artículos que necesiten de mantenerse conservados a bajas temperaturas. El préstamo que solicita le permitirá completar el precio de la congeladora que tanto necesita para brindar un mejor servicio y continuar mejorando los estudios de sus queridos hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes <

loans.use: TO BUY A NEW REFRIGERATOR FOR HER BUSINESS, AND PROVIDE BETTER SERVICE TO HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Rosa Merlincher

texts.es:
Rosa is mother of three children who go to school in a small educational centre in the city. She shares her small home with her husband who uses his small boat to transport people from one place to another.

Rosa started her own business out of her house with only a couple boxes of cookies and a bag of caramels. Due to her care and patience, little by little she increased the number of products she sold until later having a well assorted display with the help of her three children who help her with the sales.

Since her sales have increased she is now in need of supplying her store with more candy for her display and is hence requesting a loan with which she will be able to buy more products for the delight of her clients.

Let us help continue with the progress of this loving mother since her long term project is to be able to own a small store which sold exclusively these products.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Rosa es madre D. 3 hijos, que están aún estudiando en un pequeño centro educativo D. su ciudad y comparte las instalaciones D. su pequeña casita con su esposo que se dedica al transporte fluvial en su pequeña embarcación, un bote, con el que traslada a sus pasajeros D. un lugar a otro. Rosa empezó a trabajar provista con un par D. cajas D. galletas y una bolsa D. caramelos en casa y debido al empeño y a la paciencia con la que cuenta poco a poco fue incrementando sus artículos hasta poner un tablero bien surtido con la ayuda D. sus tres hijos que colaboran con la atención y la venta. Debido a que aumentaron sus ventas se encuentra en la necesidad D. abastecerse con la compra D. más dulces para su tablero y solicita un préstamo con el que podrá adquirir más productos para comodidad D. cada uno D. sus clientes. Ayudemos a continuar con el progreso D. esta amorosa madre ya que su proyecto a largo plazo es poder contar con una bodeguita exclusivamente dedicada a la venta D. estos productos.

loans.use: Purchasing candy to increase sales

loans.name: Deisi

texts.es:
Deisi is a single mother. She has 6 children, four of them live away from her home with their own families. The other 2 study at the accounting institute.

She learned how to sew from her mother when she was 15 years old. She started her business because she lacked resources and she needed to take care of her home after her husband and father of her children abandoned the family.

She began with a manual sewing machine operated by a pedal. Little by little, with the exclusive designs she created in her small shop, she won the admiration of each of her clients for the special attention that she gave to every request. Thanks to this demand, she acquired an electric sewing machine. Her biggest worry is that she will be stuck without materials to continue her work and meet the demand as her business grows rapidly. Her immediate need is to buy the necessary materials to continue satisfying her customers and providing for the well being of her family.

Let's help this hardworking and excellent seamstress, so that she can grow her business and provide for the futures of her two young children.

Deisi es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales cuatro están fuera de su hogar cada uno con sus respectivas familias, los otros dos estudian en un instituto superior la carrera técnica de contabilidad. Ella aprendió a coser cuando tenía 15 años gracias a las enseñanzas de su adorada madre y emprendió su carrera de confecciones debido a la falta de recursos que tenía que afrontar su hogar con el abandono del padre de sus hijos. Empezó con una máquina de coser a pedal y poco a poco por los exclusivos diseños que fabricaba en su modesto taller se ganó la admiración y el buen gusto de cada uno de sus clientes por el toque y acabado especial que les da a cada una de sus solicitudes; gracias a esta demanda adquirió una máquina eléctrica y ahora su gran preocupación es que por la rapidez con la que está confeccionando sus prendas se ha quedado sin materiales para continuar con su labor y su deseo más urgente es poder adquirir los materiales necesarios para seguir otorgándole bienestar y satisfacción a sus clientes y familia. Colaboremos con la noble labor de esta excelente costurera para que siga confeccionando y adornando con finos acabados los sueños de sus dos menores hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY SEWING MATERIALS FOR HER BUSINESS, AND BETTER MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
