When her husband fell ill recently, she was able to use the savings she has been storing in the bank to pay for his operation. She is asking for a $900 loan, which she will be able to put back into all aspects of her businesses, including the purchase of greater quantities of products and pay for transportation to the countryside to make these purchases.

loans.use: She is asking for a $900 loan, which she will be able to put back into all aspects of her businesses, including the purchase of greater quantities of products and to pay for transportation to the countryside to make these purchases.

loans.name: Hounkpati

texts.fr:
Mr. Hounkpati K. was born in 1947 in Atsansi-Djita, in the Vo prefecture. He is a farmer who also raises sheep. He is a married father of twelve (12) children who would like to build and modernize his sheep-raising business, as he is getting older and can no longer intensely work his land. His short-term project is to build a pen in order to keep his sheep from wandering away and to take care of them efficiently. He deserves financial support, as the success of this project will allow him to increase his income and to fulfill his role as head of the family. He is thus requesting a loan of $600, which he promises to reimburse in sixteen months.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Hounkpati est né en 1947 à Atsansi-Djita dans la préfecture de Vo. C’est un agriculteur ; mais aussi éleveur de mouton. Mairé et père de douze (12) enfants, il veut se consacrer à son élevage tout en la modernisant parce que son âge ne lui permet plus de cultiver intensément la terre. Son projet à court terme est de construire un enclos afin de pouvoir éviter la divagation de ses animaux et d’assurer efficacement leur traitement. Il mérite donc d’être soutenu financièrement, car la réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de relever son niveau de revenu et de jouer valablement son rôle de chef de famille. Ainsi, il sollicite un crédit de $600 qu’il promet rembourser en seize mois.

loans.use: Building an enclosure for sheep

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma G. Y. is part of a village bank called “Desarrollo,” which means “Development” in Spanish.

For 15 years Norma has been baking bread to sell to her community. She creates all different types including French bread, and various breads that are traditional in her home region of Ayacucho, Peru. Very early every morning Norma loads her baked goods into a large cart, which she wheels from her home to the corner downtown where she has been selling for the past fifteen years. She stays until about mid-morning and then returns home to bake the evening’s batch.

Today Norma is proud of her small business, which she literally started from the ground up. When she began she had just $5 to invest in a loan from her village bank. With this starter, she was able to take out a loan of $50, and with that she bought 25 kilos of dough. She used a very small oven made from stones and began to bake only small “chaplas,” traditional Ayacuchan bread resembling a hollow English muffin and seasoned with anis. Her beginnings were very humble, and Norma says she worked very hard to accomplish what she has today in the form of a growing bread business.

When asked if she has a goal for her business, Norma’s eyes light up and with a tone of resolve she says “absolutely.” She is in the process of building a large stone oven in her home, since the one she currently uses is rented and three blocks away from her house. Once she has built the oven, she will be able to sell bread from her home while keeping her small business downtown as well. All this she does with the hope of eventually opening her very own real bakery. The profits she earns from her bakery would be enough to support her family of a husband and three children.

Norma loves to be a part of her village bank. She not only considers it of immense help economically, but she has also learned how to better manage her home and family through the different talks given every week. Norma is requesting a loan of $1100, with which she will complete the large stone oven in her home.

loans.use: complete the large stone oven in her home

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr:
26 years old, Mr. Ayao A. was born in Togblé in the prefecture of Golfe. Married with two (02) children in his care, he ended his studies in the third class (equivalent to 9th grade) due to a lack of finances. He did not even get the chance to learn an occupation, and began very early, with his friends, in the extraction, washing, and sale of gravel. It is this activity which allows him to meet the needs of his small family. However, this business requires significant financial means. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $1000. This loan will allow him to obtain the material and human resources for the large-scale extraction of gravel, a construction material which is much desired by the construction industry.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 26 ans, Monsieur Ayao A. est né à Togblé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Marié avec deux (02) enfants à charge, il arrêta ses études en classe de 3ème faute de moyens financiers. Il n’a même pas eu la chance d’apprendre un métier et s’est très tôt engage, avec des amis, dans l’extraction, le lavage et la vente de graviers. C’est cette activité qui lui a permit de faire face aux besoins de sa petite famille. Cependant, cette activité nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Cet financement va lui permettre d’avoir les moyens matériels et humains nécessaires pour l’extraction à grande échelle du gravier, un matériau de construction très recherchés par les entreprises de construction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Maman

texts.fr:
Born in 1942 in Djita, Mrs. Maman A. has eight (08) children. The preparation and sale of palm oil is her main business and job. Very dynamic, but lacking resources, she usually buys palm nuts on credit; she pays after selling her oil. This does not allow her to obtain a margin of revenue sufficiently large to meet her needs. In order to establish a commercial base, she is asking for a loan of $700 to pay cash for palm nuts for her business. This will allow her to secure her income and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1942 à Djita, Madame A. Maman est mère de huit (08) enfants. La préparation et le commerce d’huile de palme reste son activité principale et son gagne pain. Très dynamique mais ne disposant pas de moyens, elle a l’habitude de prendre des noix de palme à crédit ; elle paye après avoir vendu son huile. Cela ne lui permet pas de dégager une marge de revenu suffisante pour ses besoins. Pour avoir un fond de commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour désormais acheter au comptant les noix de palme pour son activité. Ceci lui permettra de sécuriser son revenu et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts for the preparation of oil

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
At 41 years of age, Mrs. Abla E. is married to a taxicab driver and has two (02) children and one other person in her care. She ended her studies very early during elementary school to help her parents in their work. After getting married, she devoted herself to the small-scale sale of wood and charcoal. It is through this small business that she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. To improve the profitability of her commercial activity, she is asking for a loan of $800. This loan will allow her to set up a sufficiently large stock of firewood and charcoal during this time of abundance. She intends to repay this loan in 18 months.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 41 ans, Madame Abla E. est mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto et mère de deux (02) enfants avec une personne à charge. Elle arrêta très tôt ses études primaires au cours élémentaire pour aider ses parents dans leurs activités. Après son mariage, elle s’adonne aux petits commerces de bois et de charbons de bois. C’est par cette activité qu’elle arrive à aider son mari dans les charges familiales. Pour améliorer la rentabilité de son activité commerciale, elle sollicite un crédit de $800. Ce prêt lui permettra de constituer un stock suffisant de bois de chauffe et de charbons de bois en ce moment d’abondance. Elle compte rembourser ce financement en 18 mois.

loans.use: To stock charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Soila Martha

texts.en:
Soila Martha V. E. belongs to a village bank called “Llamkasun,” which is a Quechua (native language) word that means “We Work Together.”

A proud mother of three children who currently attend the local university, Soila is the owner of a restaurant called “La Perla,” or The Pearl. She serves traditional Peruvian dishes such as “Pachamanca,” a dish dating back to the Incas, which consists of different types of seasoned meats and is cooked over hot stones. Soila does all the cooking herself, seven days a week, because she says it’s the only way she can assure the quality of the food she serves. The restaurant also provides a small pool and playground for the children, who come to eat with their families, making it a very popular destination on the weekends when the restaurant is filled with families spending the day together.

Soila got her start in the restaurant business by preparing “ceviche,” another popular Peruvian dish made from fresh fish and lime, and selling it door to door in the small town where she lives. Through very hard work, Soila was able to save up enough money to rent and eventually buy the building, which now houses her very own restaurant.

Soila says she is very happy to be a part of her village bank and that she would not have been able to afford the opportunities she has been given without its help. Soila is asking for a $700 loan, with which she will be able to buy food supplies for her restaurant and maintain the pool for the children.

loans.use: Soila is asking for a $700 loan, with which she will be able to buy food supplies for her restaurant and maintain the pool for the children.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr:
Mrs. Viviane A., 25 years old, is a young married woman and mother of 1 child. Loving hairdressing, she very early on cast herself into apprenticeship. Because she loved this activity she mastered it very quickly. After work, she continues to work at home. The enthusiasm and warm welcome she has always shown her clients have contributed to an ever-increasing clientele. To truly enhance what she has learned and to better satisfy her clients, she is requesting a loan of $650 to open a salon, buy a hairdryer and other hairdressing tools. Once this dream is accomplished it will allow her to increase her income and she will be able to better care for her small family. Her husband, a house painter, has a hard time finding enough work to provide for the family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 25 ans, Madame A. Viviane est une jeune femme mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant. Aimant la coiffure, elle s’est très tôt lancée dans l’apprentissage de cette dernière. Par l’amour qu’elle à pour le métier, elle l’a vite maîtrisée. Après sa libération, elle travaille à la maison. Par son dynamisme et par l’accueil qu’elle a toujours réservé à ses clientes, sa clientèle n’a jamais cessé d’augmenter. Pour véritablement mettre en valeur ce qu’elle a appris et mieux satisfaire ses clientes, elle vient solliciter un crédit de $650 pour ouvrir un atelier, s’acheter un séchoir et autres matériels de coiffure. Ce rêve réalisé, lui permettra d’avoir un revenu maximum qui l’aidera à mieux s’occuper de sa petite famille car son mari peintre trouve difficilement du travail pour faire face aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Ouverture d'un salon de coiffure et achat d'un séchoir à cheveux

loans.name: Reina Marcelina

texts.en:
Reina Marcelina D. E. belongs to the village bank “Los Laureles,” which is a Spanish word for “The Laurels.”

Sunday through Saturday, from 5:00 am to 7:00 am, Reina can be found behind her display of delicious handmade fresh breads of several varieties. Located in front of the Santa Clara Catholic Church, Reina’s bread stand, “Pan Jose,” sells French bread, and also traditional Peruvian breads such as “chapla” and “bizcoch,” which she says are her big sellers.

Reina got her start baking bread eight years ago when she married her husband Jose, whose family boasts many generations of bakers. Together, Jose and Reina have three children ages eight, six, and one. Apart from selling her breads from the stand every morning, Reina also provides bread commercially to several local “tiendas” or grocery stores in the local neighborhood. A typical business day for Reina begins at 7:00 pm when she and her husband begin baking the bread to be sold the next morning. All the baking is done in their house and lasts all night until 3:00 am the next morning.

Reina says she is very happy to be a part of her village bank, which she credits for many of the opportunities she has received in order to increase the size of her business. She is asking for a $600 loan, with which she will be able to buy flour, eggs, spices, and other materials needed to continue baking fresh bread every day.

loans.use: She is asking for a $600 loan, with which she will be able to buy flour, eggs, spices, and other materials needed to continue baking fresh bread every day.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
Mrs. Louise K., 32 years old, married and mother of 1 child, is a dressmaker. Due to the fact that she practices dressmaking with love and joy she has an unlimited number of customers. She is conscientious and has the ambition of becoming a great stylist and designer. She creates, by herself, wonderful designs that her customers truly appreciate. Her husband, oblivious to his responsibility as a father, leaves Mrs. Louise K. alone to face the needs of the family. A good manager, she succeeds in making ends meet with her small income. Wanting to accomplish the goal she set herself, she would like to purchase additional sewing machines that would be more efficient. Those machines would allow her apprentices to master the trade quickly, which would help her develop her business. Lacking the funds she is requesting a loan of $500. She promises to develop the full potential of her family once this project is in place because she is confident it would bring her great profit.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère d’une (01) fille, Madame K. Louise est une couturière à 32 ans. La couture qu’elle exerce avec joie et amour fait qu’elle a un nombre illimité de clients. Dévouée et ayant l’ambition d’être une grande styliste et modéliste, elle crée elle-même de merveilleux modèles que ses clients apprécient tant. Son mari inconscient de sa responsabilité de père de famille, laisse Madame K. Louise seule face aux besoins de la famille. Bonne gestionnaire, elle arrive à joindre les deux bouts avec son petit revenu. Voulant à tout prix accomplir la mission qu’elle commencé, elle voudrait acheter d’autres machines plus efficaces ce qui permettrait à ses apprenties de vite maîtriser le métier en vue de l’aider à évoluer dans le travail. Faute de moyen, elle sollicite un crédit de $500. Elle promet assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille une fois ce projet réalisé car elle est confiant d’entier un profit maximum.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines
